text: Excellent chicken and great service and the fried chicken is to die for. What else can you say other than try this place, you'll like it.

Forget all the chains ,Forget the Bars, Forget Canes They can't compare to the chicken shack.They have a top quality product and they deliver the goods every single time.  You have read the reviews and they are all true. If you order 5 fingers and fries you better be hungry there is nothing frozen here and the quality of the chicken is amazing!  The fries are like shoestring fries seasoned lightly and you get a big portion of them with your combo.  The wings are just as large I ordered the 3 fingers and 3wings a great way to try them both.  Better choices of types of sauce too but the best way is plain with sauce on the side  Come Hungry and Enjoy!
Great place to eat. The chicken and fries are amazing and pretty cheap for the amount you get. I am a regular eater here.

There are not enough great things to say about this place The people who own/work there are thee nicest people The food is outstanding IT'S ALL ABOUT CHICKEN! Haven't tried the wings yet but have no doubt they are as delicious as the chicken fingers LIGHTLY breaded, huge breast meat perfectly cooked fingers Fries are perfection Sauces are incredible (many choices) FAST FRIENDLY CLEAN DELICIOUS!!

I usually love this place, but tonight around 6;45 (they are open until 9), the employee lied and say the "Fryer was down..."  It was obvious he just wanted to leave.  I am fine with places closing early on the eve of holidays, but they need to post it ahead of time, not lie. Disappointed. Not sure if we will return....

To all my 250 plus repeat customers and potential new customers.  I need to be clear about a review I saw on yelp.   Josephia C commented about chemicals on the grill.  It's soap and water in a industrial spray bottle.  Fries are made to order and can sometimes be soggy. Not always perfect, but neither are McDonald,s fries.  We make to order.  Striving everyday to get better. Older gentleman talking at front of house to a guy, was not an employee, but a customer. All foh employees are female cashiers.   Take a look at Josephia C reviews, if real name and not disgruntled ex-employee. 5 bad reviews and nothing good to say about any place they have been to or maybe previously worked.  I'm sorry, The Shack isn't perfect, but my wife and I take our business serious and will always strive to make it better.  Just remember, everyone has an agenda, look at what you read here objectively.  Thanks for business!
This place was good. Good price for wings, fries and a drink. Two of my boyfriends chicken fingers were overdone but overall will be coming back. Place stayed busy

Our chicken shack is the best chicken fingers i have ever eaten anywhere. Their portions are great, the service is impeccable . their food is so fresh, crisp breading, quality chicken. Thank goodness we are lucky enough to have you here.
One of my new favorite spots , the service , the food , and especially the ranch were perfected ! I couldn't ask for more !  Keep doin what your doin
Awsome wings and chicken, plenty of different sauces,  1.00 beers!
Excellent chicken, excellent service. Feels like they've been here for years. Great stop on the way out of vegas. Damn good chicken.

We stopped in here after a quick side trip to the Hoover Dam. We chose it solely based on Yelp reviews and we were not let down! The place is an old car hop joint, but no car service. We walked inside and took a look at the large menu board. At first it looked pretty extensive, but in the end it boils down to various combinations of chicken fingers and wings. We all had chicken fingers with fries and I had also had a few wings as well. The chicken fingers were big, fat pieces of white meat with a light batter. They were amazing! Juicy inside and the batter was not overly seasoned. They were not dripping oil either. The fries were the "shoestring" variety that were perfectly cooked. Crispy on the outside and fluffy (as fluffy as shoestring fries can be) on the inside. There were many options for dipping sauces (we all opted for some variation of BBQ) and it was decent too. I was a little disappointed to see jugs of "Sweet Baby Ray's" sauce on shelves in the back when I used to bathroom, but it worked for us. I opted for "hot" wings and they were also perfectly fried and the "hot" sauce was a nice compromise of spiciness and flavor.   The owner (or maybe just a manager?) came out to the picnic table were were eating at outside to ask how we were enjoying the food. He was happy and really seemed to care. Not just going through the motions. I thought it was a nice touch.  I would definitely stop here again if I were to be in the area and needed a fix of fried chicken!

Very tasting wings, I prefer them to the tenders because to me, the wings have more flavor. I also like that the wings are breaded then fried so they are extra crunchy. I recommend avoid going in within 30 minutes or even an hour of closing. We got there a little after 7, got our food after 7:30, and were still chowing down around 8. The guys working there though were putting the chairs up the second customers leave the table. I understand there's a lot of prep work and cleaning they have to do after closing, but it made me feel like I needed to hurry up and get out of there. It also doesn't create a very welcoming atmosphere for customers who are coming in to eat.

If you like chicken wings with a pound of breading and batter on them then this is your.place. You cant get there chicken wings unbreaded at all instead you get a mouthful of oily batter. The fries were not bad but not amazing there were just average fries.

Firstly the chicken tenders have a great crunch with moist breast meat. The fries are skinny, crunchy golden brown goodness.   Portions are huge! Each tender is about 4 inches long. Not realizing how big the tenders were I ordered a five piece combo and was amazed at the size of the tenders and the mound of fries! There are 22 sauces to choose from! The fry sauce is delish and the best complement to the fries. I tried the BBQ and Chipotle BBQ sauces. I was expecting small cups so I doubled up! One container of each sauce is more than enough!   You can call your order in advance and it will be ready for you.  Ill try the wings next time!   It's worth a try!

I've been to chicken shack a lot of times without complaint so I was really dissapointed when I went last night I ordered 3 tenders mild, but when I got it home it was a bit thrown together the sauce was not fully on the chicken and it was way hotter this time maybe a medium   they forgot my ranch dressing and to make things worse the chicken tasted as if they made it earlier and put  it in the microwave  to rewarm it ,it had that texture.. chicken shack is one of my favorite chicken places please don't start going down hill you guys are the bomb! And why did you get rid of fruit punch from the beverage machine??? Anyways I will not give up on you yet you guys deserve another chance this has been my one and only complaint about you ever.

First  things first - the chicken strips.  Big, juicy, crispy, greasy deliciousness.  I got them plain with bbq on the side for dipping.  Yum.  Shoestring fries also good, the price for the combo is very fair.  Why only 3 stars?  Well, I hate to pile on but previous reviewers are right - the tables/eating area is a dump.  Come on Chicken Shack, either hire someone to clean up the place or have one of your current workers spend a few minutes out of each hour wiping down tables, emptying trash and mopping up.  My shoes were sticking to the floor it was so bad.  I told myself that the cleaning problem was probably just limited to these areas, since I wanted that chicken, but it's not hard to extrapolate and think that the kitchen might not be so great either.  These aren't the kind of thoughts you want your customers to have.
I always get the 3 finger with fries and drink and normally it has four fingers in it. Four gigantic fingers. Delicious. Love this spot

This place was delicious! Everyone was super friendly. The chicken tenders are juicy and big. We got 10 tenders to split and I was only able to eat 3, lucky me I get leftovers. We came in right as they closed (we didn't watch our time enough) and they served us and the 2 families who came in right after. If you're in this area, I highly recommend this place. Wonderful chicken!

Lets start with the fact that - this place is great! Too bad I found out about it only couple of weeks ago. The guys that work there were on a positive note, and those chicken fingers and fries are just delicious, the only thing that I didn't like was the amount of people, the place was full, that's because I came at around 3pm, and that's the time that hungry students get out of school. They need to get a bigger place for sure, because those chicken fingers have a big future! They deserve every star of the five that I put.

On vacation to Hoover Dam and found this spot along the way, was going to settle for Taco Bell up the street but so glad I didn't!!!! THE BEST CHICKEN FINGERS I'VE EVER HAD! The sauces are amazing as well. Wish I lived in the area because I would be here at least twice a week. Definitely coming back!

One of our favorite chicken places. It is so good! I get the #3, 3 chicken fingers with chili cheese fries, with ranch & fry sauce. Absolutely delicious! My boyfriend got the #2 , 5-6 chicken finger combo with regular fries, and spicy blue cheese sauce. Amazing!! Must go. We watched Star Wars on their tv while we waited for our food which was awesome.
Great wings big size wings french fries you're just like I like them hot and crispy services spectacular I'll definitely recommend it to come back or anybody else come here

What an amazing place !! Omfg I love their chicken big pieces of chicken & great flavor options. The place has funny things on the wall & it's cozy. The staff is so nice & very helpful if its your first time or just cant decide. I've been here 3 times in the past month... Yea I'm addicted :)
I was just there yesterday order for the whole Fam  best wings ever!!!!! Love the fries too.

YUM!  Real chicken breast - delicious.  Chili cheese fries and baked beans were also great. Good size portions and decent price.  Will definitely come back.  Bonus - in the same shopping center as Galaxy theaters.

I shop at the Smith's next to this place all the time there's always a packed house here so I thought I'd give it a shot and I ordered a chicken sandwich and that's exactly what I got just a chicken sandwich nothing special not overly tasty just plain maybe I'm the bad apple don't spoil it for the bunch but I'm not overly impressed and I probably won't go back no make that for sure I won't go back

Oh man-- I think at one point I've gained about 5 lbs from being so addicted to their chicken. When it comes to chicken, my husband is a monster (you know like cookie monster ...except with chicken :)) This is hands down one of our favorite fried chicken spots. The chicken is lightly breaded, perfectly seasoned, and juicy on the inside. Service is always pretty friendly. Oh and the fries are delicious! We're hooked.

When I get a craving for hot wings this is my go to spot. Love the shoestring fries. They've got sweet tea. Seating is limited since the place is small. It can get packed during lunch. Everything is cooked to order so expect to wait a few mins for your order. I always call ahead especially when it's busy. Great customer service.

Without a doubt some of the finest boneless chicken in town. There are a lot of options in terms of flavoring of the wings so you don't get just boring plain or hot wings. My wife absolutely love the fries and sometimes just orders that from the place.  The staff there is top notch and the atmosphere is great. Love the feeling of eating at a sports bar without the smoke or rude customers.  The only thing I dislike is the size. Wish the place was bigger but I'm sure that will happen somewhere down the line as the place becomes too popular for their current location.

Before leaving Vegas we visited the chicken shack. We ordered 12 wings An fries. The meal was out An hot within minutes. Nice size wings a bit on the salty size as well as the shoestring fries. Staff allowed us to taste test sauces before placing our order. Decent price, restaurant on the small size only around 8 tables.

Stopped in for dinner on the way to Vegas.  Amazing,  juicy real chicken.  Delicious, ready quickly and friendly staff worth the grab n go or to actually sit.  It's not a big restaurant or extravagant but definitely worth the stop.
Have to keep it short and sweet.  Best size wings in town..  I had about 3-4 of them and got full!  I'd recommend to others!

I am absolutely in love with this place. I don't know what they do or how they do it but I find myself craving their chicken strips all the time. I would like to try other things on the menu but I feel like if I don't order the chicken strips I will regret it. The habenero honey is my favorite. Also, this place is reasonably priced. Chicken strips, drinks and fries usually come out $6/person.
Fantastic food and flavors! Excellent sercive! Great friendly  atmosphere. Great music!  All around awesome!
Awesome overload! An absolute must try..best damn chicken around. You won't be disappointed!! Yummy!!
It is not good. The chicken is dry and very hard. I can't stand the chicken. The chicken they serve at my school is moist and spicy. I rather review my school food. Don't go its a waste money.

the kids menu was good enough. chicken always good but didn't care for the fries! ranch is good, also had more fingers for me and , side of beans, really yummy and a side of potato salad that was ok. the cashier guy was really friendly and helpful. Notice the back door opened, and well health dep dont like that. I will totally go back and get some other sides
Loved this spot!  All the variety of sauces. Great chicken. Perfect to stop before heading back to Phoenix.

Fantastic! We used to get just the grilled chicken fingers as we try ro be health conscious, but the breading they use is very light and males the fingers come out delicious, the insides are moist and tender and break apart able to dip in their  multitude of fantastic sauces. Add on a giant beer for only $3 and this meal can't be beat!
I been coming here a couple times and it has to be one of my favorite spots to eat chicken wings and chicken fingers.the prices aren't bad and the customer service is attentive and friendly.
This place is awesome.  Great chicken, not a fancy place but nice.  The place was crowed, the mark of good food!  I recommend this place!

My family and I had dinner with Jaime W. and Shirley B. It was quite lovely. I got what most people would get. Chicken fingers and fries. The fries were da bomb diggity. Dip them in ranch, perfection. I would want to be buried in these. The fingers were decent as well. Dip them in ranch as well, they will be tons better. (I am in an open relationship with ranch.) It was pretty grimy there though. Doesn't see like they clean the tables. You sit, you clean up your mess, with the exception of a few crumbs and papers. You order at the desk, so the staff probably doesn't see the nastiness of their tables, other than a quick glance when they bring your food. It was sticky. You can get over it once you eat though. Just wash your hands after and you'll be as fresh as a daisy.
Great little place for a quick meal. Chicken wings, fries and salad were perfect to end our day. Found on Yelp and trusted the reviews - thanks

I love eating at Chicken Shack! They provide generous portions, and the chicken fingers are to die for! They also serve beer to wash down all that delicious unhealthiness! The only deterrence is all the construction happening on Sunset Road. All that construction and lane closures is a joke!!!

Very hit or miss, depending on who is doing the cooking. If it is the older guy, he was the actual chef from the old Chicken shack, and he makes bangin' wings. The hispanic guy messed up my order 3 times out of 4 so far, he is the chef "in training" but seriously, its just wings, you make them all day, it cant be that hard? Mostly he makes the wings plain and gives you a tiny side of whatever sauce you asked for to dip in. This is WRONG. When I order "habanero honey" I want the wings smothered in that delicious sauce. That should be the default way, always.   This is in Cactus Jack's saloon, and the reason why I believe is because the bar rents out the kitchen to the Chicken Shack guys. From a logical standpoint, it makes sense because its cheaper than leasing one of the empty storefront's next door and installing a new kitchen, but it may be something they want to consider for the long run. I have no problem going in a bar to get the food, but I can see how some would think this to be an annoying and avoidable step.  1/5 when the hispanic is the cook (so far, maybe hell step his game up), 4/5 when it is the older man.
Clean and pretty good chicken strips. The price is not bad. I don't like it as much as my favorite chicken place which is Raising Caines but still it's good food.

This place is awesome. The wings were great (and I'm not partial to bartered wings), the guy at the front nice and so was Steve the cook. I mean the man gave us a free sample of their cold slaw because we weren't sure if we'd like it or not. Needless to say we got a side of slaw.  Overall great experience. I'd roll back there again.   Keep up the excellent food and service fellas!

Big portions the chicken wing as well as the fingers were delicious. It wasn't very expensive and I got my food quicker than I expected. I got the hot Sauce on my wings and it wast very spicy but the taste was delicious and went perfect with the ranch. Will definitely be back again!

Really good chicken fingers and the fries were great as well! They give you a LOT of food so come hungry! We didn't try any of the sauces this time but I'm sure we will be back and we'll give them a try then. The dining room is small and can get loud, but everything was clean.

Definitely the best wings I have had eating out. They have a pretty awesome deal Including wings, fries and a pitcher of beer for like 20 bucks. Highly recommend this place if your looking for solid wings!

We ordered the 10 piece chicken fingers and small fries to go.  Although the quantity of food was well worth the money the quality was severely lacking.  The chicken was on the chewy side but what really was bad was that the breading had so much salt in it that you couldn't eat it.  Same goes for the fries - way too much salt.  We were very disappointed in that the one other time we tried a Chicken Shack was the one on Sunset and it was very good.

Ok so my husband and I stopped here on our way through and it was the BEST decision we've made in weeks. The way they cook their chicken is one-of-a-kind... it's savory, juicy, melts in your mouth, the breading is perfect, and adds just the right amount of spice. Plus it's whole pieces of chicken breast, not the prepackaged stuff. We had the fingers, which would be perfect on their own but there's also numerous sauces to choose from. And on top of it, we received great customer service from the woman working there.   If you're a fan of chicken, you will NOT regret coming here! I would drive out of my way to eat at this place. Chicken Shack - were comin' back!!

I came in earlier today with a friend of mine to catch up really quick on old times. It had to be a quick meet up because she was on a half hour lunch break. We picked Chicken Shack because it was close to her job and from all of word of mouth advertising made me really want to try out this place. I ordered a five strip meal with fries and selected spicy blue cheese and honey habanero sauce on the side. Few minutes later, my both mine and my friends food came out rather quickly with a clean and concise presentation. Eating the food, I can tell that they use quality products and they pay attention to detail with cooking. Nothing was skimped on and the sizes of everything were proportionate. I found myself really enjoying the food, however my eyes were bigger than my stomach. When I went up to the counter, the gentleman working at the counter already knew I needed a to go box without asking. So I can honestly say I will be back here. Clean place, great food, and friendly staff. Count on me coming back and recommending all of my friends to eat here!
Great stop from Lake Mead or Hoover Dam, the food was fresh and delicious, the service was even better!! We wish we would have know about this place sooner!

The chicken is really good here, but it is interesting because the thing I like the most is their bacon cheeseburger. I know you might be saying, who gets a burger at a chicken place, but think about it... would a chicken place even be selling a burger if it werent good??? hmmm??? If you are a fan of burgers you got to try it out. It's big. It's good. It will rock your world.

My Brother took me here on a road trip. I hadn't even gotten my food yet, but they let me sample a piece of tender (fingers) and it's probably the best I've ever had. Garlic parm wings are on point and a large fries is enough for 2-3 people. Fabulous food and good people running the place, which makes a lot of difference. I'll be back.

This location is laughable when compared to the original on Sunset. As part of Cactus Jacks Saloon your stuck walking into a smoky bar, dealing with a rude bartender/waitress who may or may not want to help you unless you are a regular I guess, and if you are under 50 be prepared to be gawked at when entering and stared at as you sit down. Came in at 4pm on a Thursday and I sat for 3 minutes without help and ended up walking out as no one was around to help me and I was getting tired of being stared at. As I was walking out the bartender finally came out from the back and didn't even make an effort.   Where I would give their original location 5 stars I wouldn't even step foot in this place again. There is a open store front in the same complex just like you have on Sunset - just open up in there chicken Shack! I would be back and give you business weekly! Putting yourselves INSIDE a locals bar that caters to older and depressing community ruins it and makes it unapproachable and disappointing as I really enjoy your chicken and your wonderful staff on Sunset.

I go there with my girls and mom. We love it! I dont like honey mustard that much but theirs is really, really good.  Chicken is excellent!  My mom loves the fries! It get really busy at lunch and the place is small. So plan ahead, i would say
Had the chicken strips sandwhich.   Was vey good.  The chicken was hot juicy and good flavor.  The fries and chicken surprisingly were not super greasy.
Hands down best chicken you can get fast for a great price!!!  I've been going here every now and then for about 6 years now since back in the "chicken bonz" days and highly recommend it!!!

Not sure why there was no mgr on duty when i called to complain about my horrible meal, who  close's  the place??!! My ff were xxx crisp, like burnt, and wayyy too much salt, as was my cheeseburger, salted xxxx!!?? Could not hardly eat it. Saw similiar reviews of excess salt on yelp! Is the cook trying to have this business fail! Also gave me a warm slice of romaine lettuce!! Yuck!! With owners not even there, and clueless cooks, i wont be back!!

Here's the deal with this location located on Sunset Rd.   The chicken is good as long as it's not overcooked. In my experience of going to this location at least a dozen times it's about a 50/50 chance of whether the chicken will be really good or flat out burnt. I have learned to ask for the chicken to be cooked on the spot and to say "don't overcook it."   The manager has not been very professional on a couple of occasions. She basically didn't want to hear about the problems in her store and just proceeded to talk over me. I wasn't to happy about this, but I did like the chicken so I was eventually willing to overlook this and she was more professional on visits thereafter.   What really pissed me off big time was on my last and final visit. The girl who works the register (heavy set, short dark hair, butch looking) did something which I find pretty bad. We ordered our food, I sent my 17 year old autistic child up to the counter with a $1 bill to buy an extra dipping sauce which is 59 cents or there about. He gave her the $1 bill, yet she didn't give the kid any change. She just kept it. We are only talking about .40 cents or so, but that's not the point! She knew the kid didn't know any better and she took advantage of it. I walked up and said something, but she acted as if she didn't know what I was talking about.  For these reasons and mainly the last, I will never return to this location ever again. The employee who did this is constantly on her phone, tables are dirty, floors and walls are dirty, yet she stays on her phone instead of cleaning.   This has been my experience, yours may vary.

100% recommend whether you live in the area or are just passing through, you don't want to miss this place! The staff is super friendly, food is ready to eat within minutes of ordering and you can see them make it!

Anna, the owner of this family run business, greeted us warmly and helped us navigate the menu. She brought out a piece of chicken, freshly fried, when she learned that we had not tried it.  We ordered up a fury!  Delicious. The chicken is perfect and we all picked a different homemade sauce. Everything is fresh - never frozen.  French fries are divine.  This is a great stop on the way to or from lake mead and the Hoover dam!
good "hole-in-the-wall". great chicken. a touch salty, but still pretty damn good, hand-breaded and fresh.   i give it an overwhelming thumbs up!
Best wings in vegas.  Large serving size and great price. They offer kids meals as well great family stop. The jokes on the wall provide entertainment and make the chicken shack a fun environment.
Best chicken fingers I've had in a long time!  Loved the tangy dipping sauce choices.  The skinny fries were perfectly salted and delicious.

We were thankful to have found this place after a long drive today!  I'm so glad we skipped the hotel restaurant and went to the chicken shack.  The food was excellent, the portions were nice and the service was friendly and welcoming.  This will be a place to visit whenever in Boulder City.

This Chicken Shack location is da bomb!!  Super friendly and fast.  Food ALWAYS on point.  Those of you who are  Cane's supporters.....you're missing out!!!  Chicken Shack has HUGE, juicy pieces of chicken.  Mounds of fries.  Endless dipping sauce choices which are flavorful and just add to the chicken experience. I refuse to eat at Cane's or KFC ever again.  Give me Chicken Shack or give me nothing!!! :)
Best chicken in town  bww, wing stop, chick filet all mediocre this is where it's at. So many flavors to pick. Hot BBQ is my shiznit if ur in the area of one stop by!!

My husband and I have been here a couple times now, and although it's on the other side of town we go out of our way to go. I love the chicken it's super soft and tender, ranch and buffalo sauce and we're set!! It is a little hard to find a table but it's worth it.

The food had hairs in it. They're very stingy with there sauces. Don't wear proper hair nets in kitchen so don't be surprised if you find a hair are two in your meal !!! When you walk in they don't greet you how you'd like

This is our new go to wing joint, and let me just get this out of the way...This place serves some big ass wings!!! My husband and I crack up every time, wondering where the hell do they get these chickens?!  Soo.. big juicy, crispy well cooked wings and delicious sauces. (we've only tried a few so far) The chile-lime was yum, the habanero honey was sweet/spicy heaven for me. Both kids like the honey bbq, and occasionally we order the dry spiced wings for when we don't feel like getting down and dirty. They have lemon pepper and garlic parmesan, both good. The fries are super skinny, and that's a nice change...very crisp.  So why not 5 stars? I hate that they offer big packages, 25, 50 or 100 wings but you may only have 2 different flavors in those packages. I don't know if it's like that at other places or not, but regardless, I think it's lame.  The second reason is that there are always dirty tables. Every time we've been, we've searched for the least dirty table and watched the other ones sit there un-wiped for the duration of our stay. You may be  understaffed due to the economy, but the tables have to be wiped down. No one wants to sit at someone else's mess. On the bright side, you can phone in your order, walk in and pick it up and bypass the dirty tables.
I am a chicken man  this place is pretty good. Clean seating environment. Took a while to get the food but it was worth the wait.

Jack of few trades, but master of all, is what I say about this place.  Their chicken fingers and fries are top quality and arrive at your table, fresh, hot and crispy.  They have an amazing selection of dips for your chicken, and you're usually chewing down within 5 minutes of ordering.  Staff are wonderful, especially this Steve guy who treats you as if he's known you forever - very welcoming and a joy to return to - EVERY TIME!

Love, Love ,Love the new Chicken Shack in Boulder City!   We ate there with some friends last night and it was awesome! The chicken is so juicy and tasty it makes me want to go back for more today! The sauces offered are super! especially like the sweet chili!  Keep up the good work CS!

Hard to mess up chicken fingers, right? I agree. The shitty gas station tenders can be pretty damn good in a pinch. But this place?! Man, this place does it right.   The fingers are perfectly HOT when they come out and the inside remain juicy while they are nice and crispy on the outside.   The variety of sauces really makes it so I don't get sick of the place. You can always find a new combo.   On days I don't feel like fries with them, they happily sub a different side.   And, to warm the dark cackles of my heart, they offer both ranch AND blue cheese as dipping sauce.  No, the staff isn't the most warm and fuzzy and happy group. But this isn't  a Guy Savoy fine dining experience-all I care about is getting my fingers fast, hot, and crispy. And that they do.

Came here for the first time today and I must say this place was amazing!! I'm not usually into chicken strips and fries but this place changed my mind. Great choices for dips and the price is great! Fed my family of 7 for less than $55 and they ALL agreed it was a repeat.

I don't know if it was the heat of the moment when I had my first bite, but in my opinion, this beats Buffalo Wild Wings and Wingstop. That's means a lot coming from me especially since I love eating chicken wings haha.  Nice little hole-in-the-wall location right in the Smith's shopping center. Place is a little small to eat at during the lunch rush, so I recommend just taking your order to-go.   My favorite sauces to order are creamy garlic parmesan and creamy hot bbq. So delicious! I feel like it's almost a guilty pleasure. Overall, good food and good vibes.

This is a little hole in the wall place in a Smiths parking lot. I would've normally just overlooked it if a friend hasn't give me a gift card.   Chicken Shack does chicken justice. I had some of the best chicken strips I've ever tasted. Their grilled chicken sandwich was similarly tasty. The choices of sauce are add nice variety and flavor. Further, the portions are generous.  However, the Chicken Shack's strength is also the major weakness. The focus is on chicken such that there aren't many non-chicken selections. There is salad and burgers, but it seems to defeat the purpose of going to a chicken specialty restaurant.  Take home point: if you're craving delicious chicken, this is a good place to satisfy that hunger.

I was craving chicken tenders and I came across this place. We came during lunch so the line was long but moved pretty quickly. Small space but we did get a table to sit down and eat at. Everything was hot. It took awhile to get a rogo box but like I said it was lunch time. I will return next time I want chicken tenders!
Love the Chicken Shack! Have gone to the one in Henderson on Sunset. Wish they had a location on the southwest side of Las Vegas! Good fresh food and always great service w a smile!

First and last trip the Chicken Shack. Ordered the 5 piece strip combo and chicken salad. The strips were large but unremarkable with little flavor. There is a wide variety of sauces, but that doesn't make up for the flavorless chicken. The salad is just lettuce with some cut up strips on top and a choice of several dressings. Kane's, Popeyes, KFC, or Subway are better options.

So I thought I would give this place a visit ,seeing that I do like to support my neighborhood food joints. Well let me tell u the honest truth, I should of continue going to Kohls to shop instead of stopping here to grab some chicken! I ordered the 6 piece wings and the chili fries ,which came out to 13.33 with tip now anyone in their right mine know that u can buy a 14 piece of chicken pack at Sam's club for 10.00. I was hungry and delusional so I knew I had to stop and try this chicken now to quench my hunger ! Man I was sadly disappointed someone must of poured a whole bottle of salt on the chicken so much so I tried to wipe it off with napkins to no avail I was screwed there was no hope , the chili was so so whatever that means . In ending this review there is a lesson here shopping or a quick bite at the chicken shack ? U decide.

My son and I normally love this place and always come when we are in Henderson. Yesterday I wanted to take some out of town guest to try it out because they live so close, but unfortunately the wing we're horrible this time. They tasted as if they were precooked and heated to serve. I felt bad for bringing the guest because normally we have a great experience. I hope this was just a one time issue because my son loves this place and would like to return. I appreciate fast service but if that doesn't mean my wings are cooked to order than I don't mind waiting longer to have good fresh food.

Ive been going  to  the chicken  shack in  henderson  on sunset the service is awesome  and if i could i would  give a 10 out of 10 the reason is because  of  one young lady that works there she is awesome  her name is Priscilla shes always friendly  and she always has a smile and the food is great thanks chicken  shack for making it a wonderful  experience  for my family  and  I

We're new to the area, so when we asked the kids what they wanted to eat, our daughter suggested this place we seen on the way to Hoover Dam.   I'm glad we gave it a try. The service was friendly and the customers were as well.   For the price you pay, you get a whole lot.We had the chicken fingers, with 2 large sides and 4 drinks. It was enough to satisfy our hunger. Everything we ordered was yummy, esp the bbq baked beans. If we're ever in the area again, we're definitely going to stop by again to try something new!

Now this establishment takes the award for best customer service of the day. When you come here you get such a homey feeling where you can just relax and eat good food.   Like it's name suggests the Chicken Shack specializes in Chicken; Chicken Sanwiches, Chicken wings, Chicken Fingers, Chicken Everythang!!   My friend Anthony and I had the honor of trying the "6 piece chicken fingers with medium sauce" and the "chicken sandwich" both of which were cooked to the point of perfection. The meat was so tender that it would literally melt in your mouth.   And while we were enjoying our meal the cook had overheard that it was our first time at the establishment, so he brought out a sample side of wings with 2 of their different flavors of sauces!! Honey Jabanero and Sweet Chilli, which completely topped off out whole eating experience!  As we finished our meal we noticed how much like family they treated all of their customers. While calling regulars by their names and with greetings like "Aye!!!" But what really caught my attention was their willingness to help one of their customers who had a fairly large to go order, out to their car. That's something that's not at all necessary but it's nice to know that they would go that far for their customers.   Overall my experience here was 5 stars for their amazing overall vibe. We'll be back Chicken Shack!

The workers, presumably the owners, were as nice as can be: extremely courteous and outgoing. We got the chicken fingers and a dbl burger. The chicken was good- it reminded us of Raising Canes. They were a touch on the dry side, but we'd definitely recommend and will get them again ourselves. The burger was really good. Everything from the meat to the lettuce were very fresh. The fingers and burger came with an extremely generous portion of french fries. The fries were delicious! We really enjoyed our first visit and we'll definitely stop in again!!
worst service ive ever had, it took forever to get my food when it was almost empty, the food wasnt even good, undercooked, pink chicken with no flavor, please dont waste your money on this place

We ordered the chicken wings and fingers.  Tried a few sauces - hot, lemon pepper and habanero honey.  Hot was standard buffalo sauce, lemon pepper was TOO salty and the habanero honey was great (not too sweet with a slight kick at the end).  The hot and habanero honey were sauces but the lemon pepper was a dry rub.  I like my wings and fingers crunchy so next time I will ask for sauce/dry rub on the side.  Chicken was not dry and the portion size was good.  The only negative thing was the cashier made a mistake on my order.  He offered to correct my order, but I would have to pay the difference.  No thanks, it was your mistake buddy.  Overall, the food was good and I liked the decor.  I don't expect mistakes to be made all the time so I think 3 stars is fair but my true rating would be 3.5 stars.
Obsessed with this place !!!!  Better than Buffalo wild wings, better than wing stop just amazing! Their fries are the best and the staff is always nice !

Picked the wrong day to come try this place!!!!! Called in my order for myself and a co-worker and specifically asked for sauce on the sides. Drove about 6 miles to pick up and of course the orders were incorrect. The girl who was working the register at 12:10 pm was rude, arrogant and had a HUGE attitude when I told her the orders were wrong. She started to have MORE of an attitude when I asked for the manager and she said " anyways with you" which I thought was beyond disrespectful. A male chef came out and tried telling me that I didn't order what I said I did over the phone but yet I spoke to a female on the phone to place my order...how does that make any sense?? The male chef asked me what I ordered and I told him, he then went back to the kitchen and fixed my order. By the time my order was fixed I had already lost 23 minutes into my 45 min lunch break from work!! I will NEVER go back to this disrespectful place of business. On top of it all they screwed me out of a chicken finger when I ordered a 3 piece they only gave me 2 fingers and shorted out on the fries !!!!! This place sucks !!!!!!!

This place is delicious!!!  The chicken was not overly breaded, so you can taste the juicy-ness of it.  Sauces were out of bounds, & the fries...I normally don't eat them, but today, I ate mine & some of my son's.  Yes, they're THAT good!  Service was friendly & fun.  My family & I HIGHLY recommend this place.

First time here. We ordered a chicken strip combo and 6 wings with the honey habanero. Chicken strip were excellent . Crispy and juicy. The wings were also awesome. Huge and good flavor. The only minus was the fries.  They were soggy and tasted like old fryer oil. If not for the fries it would of been 5 stars

I was surprised by this place. It's in a not-so-great location (which makes it a little difficult to find), but they didn't disappoint. The chili lime sauce on chicken strips is great. I always order their sauces on the side, as the chicken is much crunchier (which I like) this way.
Great food! Great service!   We ordered take out over the phone and it was ready super fast. We are never disappointed with our meals. Sooooooo much food in each portion.

Chicken is pretty much my favorite food you name it Jack in the box McDonald's Wendy's I've tried all of it  When I tried canes when I was About 13 I never thought nobody can top that  I found something that did top it and it's chicken shack  It's the best place to grab chicken they give you massive amounts and usually throw in extra and you can get toppings like garlic parm or mild ETC  I usually get #2(5 piece) with garlic parm with garlic parm on the fries it can't get much better than that

This small unassuming little restaurant off the side of the highway is a best secret that needs to be discovered. I was driving home after a 3 hour hike with my wife and dog, and we were really hungry, but for something really good, not just something to fill our stomachs. We saw the Chicken Shack, passed it to go to another restaurant, then decided to back up in the center lane and try this place out. It's small, but the food is delicious, the service is personal, and when you leave, you leave knowing you just had the best chicken fingers and wings around. The batter is light but favorable, no salt or extra spices needed, the french fries cooked to perfection, and the choice of sauces to choose from will cause you to stop and try to decide what you have a taste for; my favorite is the garlic sauce for my chicken.  They also went above and beyond my expectations, we said we had to take our food to go because we had our dog in the car; they gave a few extra pieces of chicken for our dog Dundee in his own container with his name on it; now that's a place of business that knows how to meet their customer's needs. Everything was so good, that we are recommending this place to all our friends. Keep it up Chicken shack; you know how to do it right.
Great food but service and cleanliness of the place need work. The place is always busy and it seems like more help is needed.

I stopped going to the chicken shack on sunset after two years of going atleast 2 times a week sometimes more because the place was always dirty even when it wasn't busy so I wondered what the back looked like the tables,chairs were always dirty the legs of the table and chairs were filthy...  It's been 18 months and I found out there was a new CS  so I came in tonight it wasn't busy the owner had just walked out the door ( I pretty sure it was him).  I ordered and my wife got us a table when getting to the table she showed me she had wiped it with just some water and paper towel.   It was black so I looked around and for this to be a newer place I'm disappointed.    So no more chicken shack.

One of our favorite places in town (or out of town, i should say) to eat. Ive taken my family here probably 30 times since it opened a couple of years ago and its great every time. Service and staff are always the best and Im pretty sure the same people have worked here since it opened. I think that says something. Highly recommended.

It's very unfortunate to write this kind of reviews but somehow they need to help other people not eating or making the same mistake. Me and my friend order 2 burgers of " Angus meat" that's what the girl said, everything was great until I tasted the burger, it was very salty and I say very salty!!!, and here is the thing we were approach by the manager or one of the girls in charge and she asked if everything was ok, and we told her that the burger was super salty and she apologizes and told the people at the back that the customer was unhappy with the burger and she remind them to don't add to much salt to the burgers. She came back after a few seconds and I thought she was going to offer us our money back or at least change our meals for something else, but NO she offer us RANCH DRESSING so that can we somehow make the salty taste go away!!! Can you imagine,  There are better options out there don't waste money and time, even McDonald's would be better compare to the great Angus burger .

Not to much of a chicken person, but decided to join in with some friends. Chicken Stack is actually very good, I was pretty impressed. Got to bring my family here to try it they love chicken wings. This place is hidden in shopping center only way we knew about this place was through yelp.
Always delicious, always fresh.  My got too fast food place in Henderson. Just wish they were open later and that they delivered.
A friendly and tasty simple, quick stop joint! Hand breaded finger! Yummy shoe-string fries! And delicious homemade dipping sauces!
Excellent stop for lunch. Chicken was well cooked, the service was fast and cheerful. Highly recommend this Chili-lime sauce, spicy and tart. Cook recommends it for shrimp too.
Absolutely the best chicken tenders, wings, and fries around. The service is friendly and fast.

My family and I tried the fingers, wings, and chili fries. I liked the wings the best.  Service was exceptional for a wing joint. The cashier was very friendly and helpful and the cook/owner(?) came out from the back and let us try the secret "kitchen" sauce that wasn't on the menu.

Excellent service second only to the top notch food. Love the wings with blue cheeze.  Owner cam over the table and asked how the food was.  Great place.  Do yourself a culinary treat and stop in.  Beware. ...portions are large!
The fries were really good, but the chicken fingers were a little chewy. Plus, they didn't have milkshakes.

The wings here at the chicken shack are subpar simply. They are oversized, underseasoned, BREADED (which should be mentioned) and have lackluster sauces!  I believe this restaurant is surviving on the massive portions versus the quality! These wings are by far the worst I have EVER had and I eat wings several times a wing from great places like Wingstop and Wings!  Stear clear of this place or you will be highly upset!
EVERY time I visit Las Vegas, this is my first stop.  There are few food items in this world I would choose to eat over the Chicken Shack chicken sandwich.

Called ahead and ordered to go around 7:30pm. Once driving, I opened the box to grab some fries and noticed order was missing 2 tenders (5 pc order), & so i circled back to get rest of order. *not a huge deal, but definitely inconvenient*  The big issue here is that upon opening the lid of the box there immediately was a very foul and overbearing smell which reeked of rubber/old dirty oil. I mentioned this to the staff and was told, "it's fried so its going to smell and taste like oil". I left, as I was in a hurry and figured once I dunk it in hot sauce and ranch it wouldn't be bad.   While driving, I took a bite and dipped the chicken into the buffalo sauce yet had the worse taste of butt/oil in my mouth.  After looking at them in the light closer, the chicken fingers were drenched and coated with a greasy/slime residue of oil and very soggy. The fries, unfortunately, were exactly the same and tasted like pure oil. I immediately lost my appetite. After only having a few bites of a chicken tender and a few fries my stomach soon after began to reject the food and  I had to pull over and puke.    I have eaten here several other times and the quality of food and way of which it was prepared has never been an issue. Not sure if maybe they had new cooks, if they hadn't cleaned out fryer properly (using old dirty oil), or if they just got lazy due to being later in night. Regardless, this should never of been an issue and it was a waste of my time, money, and messed my stomach up for the night.   I hate that I wrote a review only after having a bad experience as I've enjoyed chicken shack before, and for that reason alone I will give a 2 star rating. However, after eating/throwing up what was clearly food that was not prepared correctly and not suitable to eat, I doubt I will ever return here again or reccomend this establishment going foward.    Side note: good prices on beer and good location.

Dined on 9/2/2016.  Hands down, some of the best wings I've ever had. Big, juicy, flavorful, and cooked perfectly.  I went for the bone-in wings, the wife went for the boneless wings. The wings are breaded (so they are not naked), and this serves to soak up their sauce just fine. Just a heads up; the wings are so saucy that we found the sauce permeated the paper that the wings were served on. As the wings are served on a thin piece of paper, which sits in a plastic wire basket, my thoughts are that the heavy amount of sauce, and its acidity, eat away at the paper. Towards the end of the meal, we noted some holes in the paper and the pieces that tore away were mixed in with the sauce. I'd go so far to say that I probably ate a couple of pieces of the paper, but you know what? It was worth it. The wings are that good.  And the fries. While the wings are some of the best I've ever had, the fries are easily *the* best fries that I have ever had. And, we stopped in right after they opened for the day. So obviously they were nice and fresh; my point being, some places might have used the oil from the day before resulting in some not-so-fresh fries. Not these guys.  Last tip: use the restroom; you'll love the key.
Best chicken wings I have ever had. They buy their chicken fresh daily and use milk and flour to bread them. Family owned, fun atmosphere, great pricing, amazing chicken!

Coworker and I visited the Hoover Dam before leaving town and the food at the Dam Visitor Center didn't look appealing. Quick Google and found this place on our way back...and what a gem!  Friendly staff/owner and super tasty chicken! The #4 combination gets you 3 wings, 3 fingers, fries and a drink - it was a huge portion! The fingers were crispy on the outside and juicy in the side, and wings were finger-licking good. The fries are truly the best in the world!! Everything was fried to golden perfection and no hint of grease...  Best fried chicken I had in a long time!!!

Been going to the chicken shack since 07' when it was still Chicken Bonz on sunset. I was thrilled when chicken shack came to bc. Still is and ways will be my favorite place for chicken fingers and fries. Never had any better. Plus the people that work there are very nice and helpful.
I love this place!  We never miss a chance to go there when we are in town. BEST fried chicken EVER (and this comes from an East Texan who knows fried chicken!)

Was cruising around looking for somewhere to eat and saw the line inside this little joint in a strip mall.  Thought I would try it.  Boy was it good!  I decided to get takeout and I was not disappointed. I got the #4 combo - wings and strips with fries.  They had many sauces to choose from and since no one was in line behind me, the counter guy was extremely accomodating by letting me taste a few sauces to see which one I wanted.  Good price for a quick, delicious meal!  Enjoy the Chicken Shack!

We stopped here leaving Vegas for a quick lunch. I ordered the boneless chicken strips with fries and bbq sauce and ranch for dipping. The chicken was sooooo good! So fresh! Crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. The seasoning they use on the chicken it amazing, like mouth watering amazing! The staff was also super friendly! I will definitely be going here again!!

Best chicken fingers ever! I absolutely love this place. The price is right for the amount of goodness you get. What makes this place different from the rest is definitely the SAUCE. The sauce is definitely the boss over here. Bar none. The fries are good, but not the best. Dip the fries in the sauce, then they turn into the best fries ever. Service is always friendly and top-notch. My favorite spot in Henderson.  I love the Jamaican Jerk, Spicy Teriyaki, and Hot Buffalo. They also have dry rub seasoning too.

Been here a few times and the food is consistently yummy.  The chicken tenders are fresh and lightly battered and very juicy.  The wings are equally yummy,  very light and crunchy on the outside with the perfect amount of spice and so juicy inside.  My son has been asking to try the burger so we finally let him get one and I  almost ate it! He got the double shack and it's proportion to the bun is perfect,  the bun itself was delicious as well, the veggies were very fresh and crisp.  I love the potato salad but others in my family didn't care for it, guess it's just your taste.  The fries are great, skinny and crispy.  Baked beans are pretty good,  just okay I  think but my husband loved them and then the chili with beans,  very good in my opinion, you can get it on your fries for a little extra or as side and they will add cheese, onion, sliced fresh jalapenos and sour cream for your pleasure. The only thing I  forgot so far was the coleslaw,  that probably is my least favorite, just not enough kick for me, some apple cider vinegar world fix that. All the sauces we tried so far have been really good too,  ranch, spicy ranch,  srirachi ketchup and a creamy garlic I think. The sauce cups are big!  Which I love since you're being charged for extras they give you more than enough.  This has been one of our go to places when I'm too lazy to make dinner.

Really happy with this place, my boyfriend and I ordered the 10 piece chicken fingers with half order tossed in hot and the other half tossed in the creamy parmesan garlic. Which the 10 piece is a perfect amount for 2 people by the way. Also ordered a small fry, which are skinny beer battered and they are awesome! Everything came out hot, really hot. My only recommendation to the place is the deli paper they serve the chicken on gets soggy. For us with the chicken fingers we wanted to dig in right away but being fresh out of the fryer we used a fork and knife to cut the sauced tenders and that's when the deli paper tears and your getting bites of paper. Its probably not a problem with the wings because let's face something ain't right if a person is cutting into a chicken wing, those are meant to be hand held. So only recommendation is to change the deli paper they serve the chicken on, especially the sauced tenders. I will be returning though to try the chili and other saucey flavors!!
Great seasonings.  Decent size chickens and strips. Fries good. All around tasty. Yum yum... sweet chili sauce and habenero honey sauces were on point.

Best chicken ever... The breading on the chicken fingers is thin and crispy with a subtle spice, the meat is moist and tender. The owner says they never use frozen chicken breasts which is the reason it's so good. The fries are addictive; thin and crispy and always hot. They make their own fry sauce, and I think it's just great. My husband sometimes gets a salad, and he's never been disappointed.  The service is very friendly and the food comes out from the kitchen fast.  Cute decor, and the key fob for the restroom is a big rubber chicken. The only downside is that seating is limited, so once in a great while you have to wait to get a table. No big deal...the food is worth it. Another perk is that the building is an old drive-in, so there is covered parking. Love this place!
This place is good my boyfriend comes here very often & couldn't wait till I try it. I would say it's good but maybe a little overrated. I'll probably come back my boyfriend request not mine.
Wings are juicy and crispy without being heavy on grease.   Good sauces. I get the honey habanero.   This location and BC location both excellent on food and customer service.
Nice people. Friendly, fast service. Great fingers. Many dipping options. I have eaten here many times. When my son comes to town from LA this place is on his list of must-haves.

This is the only restaurant my picky teenagers will eat chicken from. The chicken is always fresh, never dry, and breading is just enough.  Fries keep well-you can even freeze leftover fries.  They heat up nicely. We never have any chicken left over, but I'm sure it reheats well.   You MUST ask for extra fry sauce, though-that stuff is like crack. Dip everything in it!!

Chicken shack is awesome! Food is delicious and staff is very friendly. The line is always long but don't let that turn you away. The service is fast so you won't be waiting long. The line was out the door when I arrived I was only there for 10 minutes by the time I got my food. Overall delicious and defiantly the best food place in Boulder city.
BEST WINGS EVER!! They also have some of the best sauces I've ever had!! Best ranch I've probably ever had! Great crispy fries!

Decided to come here and try it for the first time. Atmosphere was cool a little crowded they were busy of course on a Saturday. I got the 5 finger combo with fries and drink came out to $10 bucks not bad. I took it to go. Let's start with the fingers they were very tasty with the ranch it was very good. The fries are very good but were a bit on the salty side. Maybe they put too much salt that day. But overall it was very good I will return again and I do recommend this place to anyone that loves chicken fingers.

This used to be our favorite place to get our yummy chicken wing and fries fix! But now not anymore..the person that they have up front is so terrible! No personality,her attitude totally suck,and has noo customer service..thank goodness for the new location as we from now on going to that one annd its closer to the house...I gave it 1 star but thats for the service,the food is still yummy!

Nice place with a good local feel and laid-back atmosphere. Very tasty food, they have every dipping sauce you've ever dreamed of. Even if the food was only passable, I'd still come here for the great service with a smile provided by Taylor.

We just finished shopping at the neighboring CVS when we stumbled upon this newly opened Chicken Shack so we decided to try it out.   I got the 6pcs chicken fingers in mild sauce and my friend got the shack salad with fried chicken. The servings were so big we had to share everything. The salad was so good and the chicken fingers were so deliciously cooked to perfection. The french fries was so good, too. They were thinner than the usual cut served by other fast food chains and for some reason the thinly cut fries looked more appetizing.   The place was so clean and well lit and it had a sportsbar kind of vibe to it because of the overhead TVs but I like that they weren't loud at all so we were able to enjoy our food and our converstion.   The people were so friendly and the service was fast. We got so much more than what we paid for!   I will definitely visit this place everytime I'm in Vegas.

Delicious, tender and perfectly fried chicken. Cole slaw is great too. The service can't be beat. Make sure you stop here for a meal if you're heading through Boulder City before or after visitng Hoover Dam or Lake Meade.

i am done coming to this establishment, i am done with their oppression! i am a black, independent, single, mother and when i brought in my 7 kids they kicked me out because my children were disturbing their customers. my children are more important than anybody and i don't appreciate their actions. plus these people are racist. one of them called me a prostitute because he couldn't believe a black woman could afford a fendi bag! dumb privileged white people !
I love chicken shack! I seriously would eat here everyday if I could. Food id ready in a flash and the wait staff is fantastic!

Chicken Shack is a fantastic go-to for good chicken. The portions are generous and the chicken has always been tender and juicy. The chicken is slightly salted for flavor and I'm not sure if I could pick up on any seasoning, but the chicken is delicious nonetheless.  You have the option of getting a combination of chicken fingers, chicken wings, and/or fries. They had a wide array of dipping sauces, all of which are good when paired with the chicken and fries. I either get the 10 piece chicken fingers for $12.29 or the 5 piece chicken fingers, fries, and drink for $8.99. I usually get the habanero honey and honey mustard sauces. I've heard the garlic parmesan and lemon pepper are good sauces too.  The service is quick and there is not wait staff, so you have to get everything yourself if your forget it at the counter.  It's a very straightforward and simple restaurant, just chicken and fries, nothing else. If you're looking for a good chicken, check out Chicken Shack!

I really like Chicken Shack. It's my guilty pleasure because of the grease, the chicken, and the variety of sauces you get to dip everything in. I feel like if Chicken Shack gave us more sauces to work with for free, that will help with bringing in more customers who want that variety.  The chicken itself is breaded and tender, but not crunchy, just crisp without the part where the flakes dig into your gums and inflame them. The fries are shoe string and fried to perfection (in my opinion). I really like InnOut fries, but Chicken Shack fries are up there in quality.  The honey garlic and habanero honey sauces are staples in my dipping inventory. Usually I get the 5 fingers and fries combo or I can get a 10 fingers with a small fries, either combination will have leftovers because there's so much food.  The staff is nice, not as fast as the Sunset location, and the facility is clean. It's much closer to where I live than Sunset so I've been coming here more often. Definitely check it out!

The chicken here is great (much bigger and tastier then raising canes) they have such a big selection of sauces, I'm a big fan of the Honey BBQ and the Cajun. I work nearby so I usually come here once a week and even though they can get pretty busy during the lunch hour, they have the food  ready super fast.
Love love this place! Got a number 3 chicken fingers with lemon pepper was delicious. Sweet tea was an added bonus. Will definitely go again

This review is purely based off of the fact I just made a large order for my office and got nothing but attitude from the woman taking my order. My office orders lunch on several occasions from small local businesses like this one and I have never witnessed someone be so annoyed that we haven't finished our large order yet. The state that broke the camels back was our final co-workers order was preceded with the exclaimed comment of "oh my gosh ok, is that the last one". Prior to that, a side note during our order was that if we have a large order, to call ahead of time. Believe me when I say that if I didn't work for a busy office and that the last thing we had to think about two hours before lunch was what and where we were going to eat, we would have. We got to our order for a burger, where she then continued to largely exhale and tell us how small her grill was (we had 45 pieces of grilled chicken on it already and she told us it would take at least 30 minutes) and that now it would take even longer. As if being there and ordering food for at least 10 people wasn't bad enough, we sure as hell weren't going to waste anybody else's time by cancelling a burger order because you warned us of how inadequate your cooking equipment was. I'm sure I could continue with every eye roll and every interruption during our order from this woman, but to make matters worse, yes - I was standing there so long that my sandals were stuck to their disgustingly sticky floor and I could have potentially cracked my ankle. I hope they're glad that I do NOT recommend anyone bragging to a group of people to eat here or else you'll be greeted with frustration. This experience lacked enjoy ability as much for us as I'm sure for her.
It was alright. Fries good but the chicken a bit soggy. Really good sauces. They want to charge 50 cents for every sauce though. I'd go back if I was drunk or really hungry.

I usually enjoy the fried chicken fingers but i opted for the chicken salad today. What a bad decision. The chicken was so dry and overcooked. It was shredded up while they chopped it up. I tried to use ranch to make up for the dry chicken but had no luck. I used one and a half ranch cups on less than half the salad and it was still dry! It had 3 pieces of sliced cucumber and 5 cherry tomatoes atop a bed of chopped romaine lettuce and two pieces of red onion. It was sprinkled with croutons and cheese which was probably the best part.   I had some of my bfs chicken fingers and fries and they were good. That Chicken was dry as well and the batter was soggy. Dipping it in the honey mustard seemed to remedy the problem.   Overall, i recommend ordering ahead so you dont have to wait in line. The dining area is way too small and hot. The fried chicken fingers and fries are good, but i personally prefer Raising Canes any day.

Chicken Shack had some scrumptious chicken fingers. I especially liked the chicken, which was not dry and fairly juicy. They got that right. I just wish the coating was a bit more crispy, but I liked the chicken so much that it wasn't a big deal. It was a bit pricey, but you got a lot of food. There was no way I was going to eat all that in the combo, which came with a ton of fries. The service was friendly and unbelievably fast. It was lunch time and there were a lot of people in line. A few minutes after I placed my order and was getting my drink, a man came out with my food. Wow, I never had food brought out that fast!
The service was friendly and fast. The fries were perfect and amazingly hot unlike other places. Only issue I ran into was the chicken was a little dry... Other than that it was a good dinner
Excellent wings and helpful staff. They even gave us advice on which sauces to get and dropped an extra wing or 2 by accident.   The taste was delicious. Highly recommended on your way to Hoover Dam.

Consistent, cooked to juicy perfection, crispy, tons of sauce options, delicious shoestring fries, very generous portions, and your plate will be ready before you get a chance to sit down and pull out your phone. If you're a fried chicken fanatic then this place is where you will find the best bang for your buck as well as your palate. If only there was another location in Vegas!!!
This place is great, best fast food available between PHX and Vegas. We always order a burger and 5 fingers and share. Plenty of food, great value, great service and people. Highly recommended.

I absolutely love Chicken Shack but do not come to the Rainbow location. We decided to go because we were across town running around doing errands. We all ordered 3 piece wings and 3 fingers combo. The fingers were cooked hot and fresh and the wings were cold like they were prepared earlier and then sauce was added as the orders came in. Or fries were old room temperature fries. I don't understand because I've been to 2 more of their locations and haven't had an issue at all. I brought my dad to show him how good it was but he wasn't impressed and doesn't ever want to try it again. Bummer. The valle verde and sunset location is always busy and has super fresh hot food! They have great customer service at those locations as well. Definitely check out the other locations.

Don't second guess stopping here. The friendly crew running this shack knows what they're doing. The food was nothing short of great and service was right there with it.  Whether it's their wings, burgers, chicken fingers or fries, you won't regret your choice. And their sauces are legendary.  This will definitely be on our pit stops when we come to Vegas from now on. Well worth the drive!

I LOVE CHICKEN, this location is perfect 2 minutes away from my house instead of having to drive 12-15 min to the other one.  The barbecue chicken strips with the fries are my favorite! They have the best fries , soft, tasty everything you want

Been looking for a place like this in Vegas for awhile now and this place popped up in my neighborhood. Super clean spot. The prices are great and the service is fast. Pretty sure I've found my new lunch spot! Their honey bbq is my sh#*!! I gotta be careful!!

Never disappointed whenever I order here, the chicken is fire flame. I always get the chicken fingers with the honey BBQ and honey habanero sauces on the side. Combo comes with fries and a drink and the fries are too good as well!! Just wish had this in California!

Great food stop along HWY 93 between Hoover Dam and Las Vegas...that is if you are willing to unleash your inner carnivore.  Prices are right, tons of flavors, wings are big and meaty - went with the Jamaican Jerk- and humorous sayings on the wall. Fries were nice and crispy as well. Some indoor seating, but plenty of shaded parking similar to a sonic set up. They'll give you a free sticker and magnet as well.

This location is always busy...and well worth the wait! Not only do they serve deliciously prepared food, they always do it with such warm and friendly service! It's the kind of place you end up leaving with a smile. Eddy, one of the cashiers is pretty much the best at guiding new customers through the menu and suggestions & just great, attentive, & caring overall. Always keeps me coming back!
Great temperature great flavor great value!  The best skinny fresh tasty French fries ever. The spicy chipotle wings is a must try.

This place is near my place of work so I have ordered from Chicken Shack many times. I always order my food to-go and it's always ready pretty quick and they are consistently delicious! This is kind of a small restaurant so seating is limited here but like I've said, I always get it to-go.
One of the best places to go and enjoy great food.  Service is amazing,  the young crew that runs the shack is awesome.  And the price for great food is good.  I recommend  everyone to come here!

I guess the main ingredient is salt. This place is horrible. I ordered the chicken fingers and fries. The chicken had no flavor. Thank god they gave me a side of ranch for 49 cents. I don't recommend this salt Shack at all. I will never return. And to top it off, my plate was over $9.00 m

THE CHICKEN SHACK IS WACK! Frys were hella soggy ' chicken is same as you would get from Albertsons or Vons deli' 40$ down the drain'  I don't see a purpose for chicken shack when you have Canes all over the place that serves good food  for fair prices'
Omg. Very good wings. Crunchy and very flavorful. I had the honey garlic and creamy garlic Parmesan. So good. I really wanted to go back for more. Didn't want to be greedy
Tasty Tasty Chicken!!!!!   Just driving through and it sounded good. Very impressed. Much better than Canes or Chick Fil-A   Cool atmosphere and very nice people running it.
I've been hooked on this place for over a year now the service is great and the food is delicious . Chicken shacks is so good makes you wanna slap yo mama !
Great customer service, horrible wings. Very soggy and salty fries for my first time eating here

Mmmmm good, first timer here. Staff are friendly and fun. Having the chicken fingers and fries real real good. And the sauces, honey/ habenrro and Jamaican jerk awesome. Must be good food, people just keep coming in. Enjoy!

Exactly what it should be. Fast food chicken fingers and wings with a HUGE choice of dipping sauces.  Overly salty and greasy for me - but the chicken seemed very good quality, and the portions were large.  Tiny place. No ambiance to speak of - other than a wall of "Why did the chicken cross the road?" jokes. (some of which were actually pretty cute - but it wears off quickly).   Because of the limited menu, this probably won't be a regular stop for me. But if I'm craving wings or fingers, this is definitely the place.

I've been to Chicken Shack several times now since it's just a quick walk away during lunch time. The food comes out quickly, service is great and its affordable. I've tried a few of their items on the menu.  The chicken tenders are very juicy and come in larger portions. Sometimes they'll even give one extra chicken tender with your meal. The fries....don't get me started. I. love. chicken. shack. fries. Sometimes they can be on the salty side, but they are the thin, shoestring kind and they are always perfectly crispy!! I'll admit...I've gone just for the fries before...(Don't judge me). Don't forget to ask them to toss your chicken in your selected sauce, or else it will come on the side. I've tried about half of their sauces available and all are yummy. You can't go wrong with which ever sauce you choose. I usually get the buffalo and ranch. Their ranch is so good. I've also had their salad for a healthier alternative with grilled chicken. Its not bad for healthy...but if you're going there you might as well indulge and get the fried stuff!  Definitely my go to spot if I'm craving some chicken tenders!

Great food great service to people really nice the food was really good I want to go back to I'll go back there again and again I hope to use them for more parties and and football games and hockey games in the future you should try this place out it's like the old chicken place is back east

I should have been smarter then to be fooled by the TV ad for this place.  There is a reason I have driven BY this place for years without stopping.    The young lady who took my order had the charm of a wet mop.  There was no greeting, just a "what do you want".  When I said I needed a second to decide, I got an obvious eye-roll, and a slump in her posture.   There was no one behind me in line, but I felt like I was bothering her just by being there.    I had chicken fingers with fries, and a small cup of macaroni salad.  One should be aware going in that EVERYTHING is ala cart.  U don't even get one dipping sauce for the overpriced fingers without paying extra.  Speaking of the chicken fingers ... definitely one of the worst I've ever had.  They were very tough and stringy.  The crust was plain-ass flour!  I don't think the chicken or the breading had ever SEEN any seasoning.  Bland, bland, bland!  That, on top of the chewy chicken made them a ZERO star item for me. The macaroni salad, while WAY overpriced, was pretty descent.  At $2.50 for about 1/2 cup, it should have been good! The tiny cup of honey mustard dipping sauce (which was a 50¢ charge) tasted just like the Kraft dressing of the same flavor. The only thing that was actually good was the order of fries.  ($2.50 for a small).  They were the shoestring type, which I prefer.  They are about one and a half of the 2 stars I gave the place. Would I return?  Only if I was VERY hungry, and everything else was closed.

We were visiting in town and this place was highly rated so we took a shot. SO good, super fairly priced and large portions. This place is legit, the chicken is hand breaded and juicy, and the fries are crispy and on point. We will definitely be back next time we are in town.
Food is fresh and flavorful. Service is fast and friendly. I only wish they were a drive through... but no one is perfect, haha! Their ranch dressing is amazing. Yum-o!

First time there.  Was told  everything is made fresh  there. My order was ready in less than 3 minutes so I questioned it. I was told they blanch them first then finish them off to order. Well that's crap! Makes no sense. They were dry, tough and the breading had no flavor. I bought blue cheese and it was only half full. The chili was small for the price and is mediocre.  Not going back!!!

Worst customer service I have ever experience arrival at 8:40 and the guy says they are close. How do you run a business that close at 9:pm and say you close at 8:30 pm  every day poor business etiquette if take you 30 mins to clean then make your hours that you stay at work to close 9:30 I travel far to try this but I will come back you can keep it
Its my new go to place.Dont think I will ever get enough.Fast and all the staff are very, very  friendly.Its also a hometown favorite.

Chicken Shack has the most amazing fried chicken and fries to be found in the Vegas area. I dream of this place, it's that good. People concerned with their health need not bother, come here if you want to assault your arteries with fried chicken greasy wonder and salt. Lots of great sauces, bone-in or boneless, heck they even have a Gardenburger. The fries are splendid. The location is small, the tables are sticky. It's perfect.
Went here for chicken tenders hand tossed with bbq sauce, got slimy somewhat cooked tenders that had bbq sauce poured into Togo box. Returned food I thought it was prett gross
Tried for the first time and it was really good ! I got 5 Sweet Chili fingers and my boyfriend got the triple shack burger . We really enjoyed it and will be ordering again soon !!!
Chicken was very good, served hot.  I'm not a fan of their fries... they are shoe string type fries.  Chicken wasn't as juicy as KFC,  but still very good.   Give it a try,  it might work for you.

I feel so morbidly obese for loving Chicken Shack's chicken tenders so much, but I dream about this place when I am back in Los Angeles, the land of many delicacies. I really don't have another chicken restaurant to compare this to since I've never been to Raising Cane's due to the distance, but this place is mouthgasmic enough for me. Chicken Shack is just minutes away from my house, it's cheap, and service is fast, which makes this place a great choice for poor medical students like myself.  The tenders are deep-fried to a crisp, moist, and comes piping hot either drenched in a sauce of your choice or on the side if you so please.  You can also ask for a side of ranch to cool that palette if the sauce is too spicy. The fries taste fresh and definitely beats any fast food chain.   I'd come here every week if I wasn't worried about growing another chin or fucking up my arteries...but alas, I'll limit my attendance to every few months because my hyperactive thyroid is now slowing down and soon, i will have to eat just lettuce to stay alive.

We stopped here on our way back from touring the Hoover Dam. It's a small place with some indoor dining and some outdoor picnic tables. While it doesn't look like much, the food and service are fantastic! Raising Cane's wishes it were this good. They have excellent chicken tenders and an expansive list of sauces for dipping. If you like the sauce at Raising Cane's, try the spicy ranch here. If you're hungry for some great chicken, look no further!

While on our way to the Hoover dam,  the two teenagers in the back were hungry. They opted for Jack in the Box across the street. My boyfriend saw the Chicken Shack directly across the street and said, we should try it. I thought, hmmm that place looks a little quiet and run down. But hey, we're on vacation lets try something new. We walked in and I was surprised by how cute it was inside. They had license plates from all over the country on the walls and the staff was so friendly. The prices were good. I ordered some chicken strips and fries. My boyfriend ordered the same. Oh. my. gosh! The food is amazing. It was so much food that I couldn't finish it all. The portions are huge,and they also included a bunch of different sauce with your meal.. I cant wait to go back once we're in the Vegas area again. It really is worth stopping by and having a look for yourself.
