The chicken fingers and shoestring fries are really good. Some of the best in Las Vegas. I love how they have a large selection of sauces! I love trying different sauces. I recommend you try the Sweet Chili.

Busy little place alongside a noisy highway but the chicken tenders were the best I've ever had and I loved all the variety of sauces. Very friendly staff, fast service and they even gave a piece of chicken to my dog!

Stop here and give them your business. You WON'T regret it.   Everything that's great about a small town is nestled beautifully init The Chicken Shack.   If you're looking for a comfortable place where you'll be greeted with a smile and warm casual conversation, as well as amazing chicken (and fry sauce), stop here and enjoy the captured comfort of a time near forgotten.   The cashier even offered and gave us a ride to our car (we walked because we thought it was closer to where we parked.   Comfort food meets comfort atmosphere and comfort conversation at The Chicken Shack.

3.5 star because the seasoning on one of my chicken orders was too salty..it tasted like gallon of salt was added to the wings and it was not hot off the fryer when it came out , so three 3.5 stars for now. I did like the fact that it's not greasy and very crunch texture on the outside and moist on the inside. Overall , I would return and try their other flavors and hopefully the chicken is hot off the fryer on my next visit.
Awesome service!!! , delicious french fries, tasty sauces! A really good place to stop by !

Came in the first time today and just ordered chicken wings with teriyaki sauce the wings were very well then the fries that come with it or in small Cuts so they are nice and crunchy Sharon was our hostess she was very nice the place is very clean atmosphere is very warm great radio station if you love 60s and 70 music I would recommend this place to anyone

Don't let the appearance of the building turn you away. That being said, it's not a bad looking building, just not new and shiny. The food here is sooooo good. I had the fingers and fries a few days ago. (Fresh cut big pieces of chicken, hand battered and hot crispy shoestring fries) Today I stopped in because I had to see if the wings were as good. They were beyond good. The batter they dip the wings in before frying had such a unique flavor. Be sure to get your sauce on the side because I didn't even feel like I needed it after my first bite. I got my, frequent clucker card, or whatever they call it and plan to fill it up quickly. Nice job guys (and gal) you are doing a great job there.

This place is a gem! If you like shoe string fries and dank fried chicken then stop in and let your taste buds get their party on wings and fingers were both great. The seasoning was on point and they have a bunch of sauces to choose from. Nice outdoor seating too
Wow! I consider myself a chicken finger expert and these fingers are LEGIT! Great service, smiling faces, and big sides of ranch! Thank you!
Excellent lunch on our way back to Vegas from Hoover Damn. Only 15 min from the Damn. Clean and friendly and obviously loved by the locals.
Yummy...omgosh...fries are awesome with mild sauce. The boneless chickens are huge and delicious. Like this place alot. Can't wait for my boyfriend to try and get his input. =]

Great customer service and even better food! Cute little place to go & the employees always great you and make sure you're welcomed. I love that they come out after and make sure your food is alright. Definitely a must try!! & prices are very reasonable and the food is always fresh to order!

Awesome place. I've ate Chicken Shack twice now. This is the BEST wing spot in the Vegas/Henderson area PERIOD! Trust me on that. Also the service is great as well. Btw, they are a part of the postmates delivery service so you don't even have to leave your house!

Welcome Derek and his team to Henderson. Went in there and this place is awesome! The staff is friendly and inviting and greet you with a smile! The food was fresh hot and smells extremely awesome! Come down and support them.

How do I describe the Shack ... hmmmmmm.  Of all the locations, this is the best (speaking of which, they are opening on on Rainbow & Tropicana!  Finally, movin' on up to the West Side).     Chicken is a little salty and greasy at times - BUT, staff is friendly and the chicken is juicy and yummy.  Habanero Honey Sauce - oh and don't forget the Fry Sauce.

We came in and the line was out the door. They took orders crazy fast! We had our order less than 5 minutes from ordering! AMAZING SERVICE! Employees are smiling and happy to be a work. The food is fresh, HOT, and tastes AMAZING!!! I only wish we had one in the SouthWest. We will always return!! Leaving happy and with a full bell!
Love this place but I really wished that one of their locations were open passed at least 10pm on fridays and Saturday's.

This is one of the best places for Chicken and Burgers.  Best place to eat when headed towards Lake Mead and Hoover Dam.  The staff is very friendly and even let us try the chicken fingers when we ordered burgers.  A class act of a place.

Try this place because it was close to home, and that wasn't my brightest idea. If you like fried everything, I'm sure that this place is the bomb. It's just not for me. The people are nice, the service was good, the place was clean, and there's plenty of convenient parking.

We got our order to go, but the wings were still crispy and juicy. The fries (strings) were ok, my partner in crime told me they used to have thicker fries and wondered why we had strings this time. Doesn't matter the wings and company made up for it.

This place is amazing. It's small inside. The chicken strips are not just chicken strips they are chicken tenderloins. Service was super fast and super friendly. If you are ever driving by and are craving some fried chicken this is the place to stop. Next time I will be trying the wings.
Great local flavor restaurant. The chicken was fresh and not the already prepared variety. Better than any chain choice of Buffalo Wild Wings or Hooters types! Will visit again when in Vegas!!!

Amazing chicken here! Also, their thin shoestring fries are to die for delicious. This place was one of the hardest things to leave behind when going off to college. Not only is this nice family owned and operated business tasty, but it also has quick and friendly customer service to boot. If you have never been here before you will certainly not be disappointed.
Great chicken after checking out Hoover Dam. Great sauces and fries too.  I did not think a chicken finger could cause me to write a review, but I was wrong.

This is place is mediocre at best in my book.  I felt that the chicken fingers were rubbery (probably from being overcooked).  Also, the fries were too salty.  Why do places put any salt on fries?  I can put salt on fries, and as much as I want!  I was hungry, so I ate it anyway, but I'll never go back to this place.  Also, charging for the dipping sauce?  Really?  Can't you just include it in the already high prices?  Just go to Chick-fil-a, they have better chicken strips and don't charge you extra for some freaking ranch!

Have been to this place several times and have not been disappointed. I've tried several of the sauces and each one has been flavorful and the portion sizes are more than enough. I get the 3 piece tender meal and more often than not get 4 tenders, so I'm assuming it's done by weight and not just a number. The counter attendants are extremely nice and courteous, even when it's busy.   While true, sometimes the some of tenders can be a little dry, it's not something that ruins the meal and everything else far outweighs this issue. Highly recommend.

This business has been open for about less than a week, we've been waiting for it to be open so patiently, but now it's here and we can rejoice!  I love chicken shack, I love everything about it, the food, the service, the location.  Food is awesome as usual, there were some new tech equipment they were using, which I thought was an amazing feature.  The food was more delayed than I would like it, but in all honesty they've been open for a week, it takes time to get to that awesome status, which is why a star is missing.  I know I'll be rewriting this eventually with five stars and hearts everywhere, but for now the kinks need to be sorted out with that.  Actually all my stars really go to the service.  There were hiccups and delays, but Jamie was so sweet and apologetic, she was able to help me carry my order because I had my infant, and let me know why it was delayed with great explanation.  That alone, is what makes this place have a minimum of three stars.  Customer service is such a big part of this industry, it can make someone smile to having the most infuriating person ever.  Jamie was so amazing and if all the employees are as sincere as she is, then there's no doubt this location will be the best!
Best customer service in town! Told him it was my first time at his restaurant and he took care of me real well. BEST FINGERS IN TOWN!

Love this place great staff and food. The only reason I give it 4 instead of 5 is its just so small and crowded and when it's busy that line takes forever to move being only one register, however food always comes out rather fast.

So I love Chicken Shack it's probably my favorite place to eat. I was so happy to see the opened a second location in Henderson. Let me say this new location is so slow I called my order in at 7:56pm they said 10 minutes so I got there at 8:07 pm I figured it would either be ready or close to by time. I paid and took a seat, I sat there for 20 minutes waiting for my food and when it was finally ready they brought it to me with no apology for my wait. Here's the kicker, I get in my car and decide to grab a couple fries and they're total soggy. I guess I'll stick to the location I know best the one on sunset and mt vista -__-
Absolutely love this place! Chicken sandwich is great. Sides are great also like the potato salad
Simply put, the best chicken fingers I've ever had.   Beats Canes by FAR!   Great service and fresh food - came in 10 minutes before close and they were so pipping hot and delicious.

Sorry Yelp fam it's been 2 weeks since I've been to check this place out and here is what I think. The service there/here is very friendly and they take really good care of you. If you want to know where all your cox workers are well come have lunch and you will see lol. We arrived about 11:00-11:30 and it wasn't packed just a few ppl but in 30 minutes this places filled up and it was a Saturday. Ok ok let's rate the food the chicken was ok nothing I was in awe about it satisfies your craving though if you're having one. I will be back I think maybe I didn't order right maybe I will try a different flavor. The fries were yummy but what I loved best was the bacon cheese burger we order.....go figure right but it was hella good! Well that's all I have for now but the experience and food were good you should go check them out

Bomb! Best chili cheese fries I've had in forever. I had the honey habanero sauce and it was pretty tasty. Not the cheapest and they charge you extra for ranch and stuff, but that's okay. My new go to for wings.
Food was memorable in that I wasn't impressed. Our chicken fingers were soggy and the breading didn't stick at all. Staff was nice and super helpful but I just wasn't impressed with the food.

I love wings and they are the best I've ever had. Got five sauces which were all delicious (They have many more than that), but I also like breaded wings without sauce. The crunchy breading had a great taste all by itself and the chicken underneath is juicy and the pieces were all good size. I will definitely be going back to the Chicken Shack in Boulder City. The guys there were really nice too!

the chicken wings and strips were just awsome.  string fries were crisp and crunchy. only down side was i upgraded for the chilli cheese fries. my personal recommendation is you can pass. but grab the 3 and 3 combo. its great. it was a bit pricier than i had expected but i didnt mind after tasting the food. if you in the mood for a quick fresh fried chicken make sure you stop by.

I really love this place, but I have a hard time giving them 5 stars when we go at 9pm on Tuesday and they're closed. The sign says they're open until 10pm. What gives? It's making it very hard for me to consistently go there and we average at least once a week. If your sign says you're open until 10. Stay open until 10. Jerk your customers around and they won't come back.

Had my eye on this place and was happy when I had a chance to sample it's delights.  Upon entry I noticed the it is close quarters ordering and eating.  I suggest either an early or a late lunch.  This place gets busy!  And rightfully so I might add.  I ordered up five tenders and fries with a sweet tea.  Some tenders were coated with habanero honey and some were dusted with the garlic parmesan seasoning.  For dipping I chose both ranch and bleu cheese.  Fully expecting the habanero to hurt me, it did not and was not overpowering but offering a very nice spicy/sweet taste.  I did not notice the parmagarlic rub to much.  No matter, the chicken was moist and tasty.   FYI...They serve beer.
Great fries, but expected the chicken to be better.  It is not bad chicken...but for the price, they should be phenomenal.

Chicken Shack has hit the west side, just in time to be my go-to takeout order for football season! With their ridiculously awesome selection of over 25 sauces, there's a flavor for everyone, whether you're looking to dip your wings, chicken, or fries. The friendly young staff and vaguely southern decor with corrugated metal and license plates almost trick me into thinking I'm back at Plucker's wing bar in San Marcos, Texas. Short of a plane ride, this is as close as I can get, and that's a huge compliment.  All the chicken orders are made fresh with never-frozen chicken, and their batter is in that Goldilocks area of being neither too thick or too thin. Menu also has salads and a handful of sandwiches and sides, but you come here for the chicken. The huge, meaty tenders are my preferred piece but if it's Wednesday, you'll catch me cleaning their wings down to the bone. Combo portions are as big as the wide-open hill country sky, with SIX wings, FIVE tenders, or the half-and-half option, any which can easily make two small lunches.   My favorite sauces are spicy honey garlic (gotta love those little bits of garlic!), Jamaican Jerk (slow, building heat), the creamy garlic parm (cheesy and cooling), and the spicy bleu cheese (for the best of both worlds)- I always get sauces on the side so I can dip, otherwise they'll toss your order, so be sure to specify!

Great chicken but greasy! They even throw in 1 or 2 pieces extra depending on how large of a fingers order you get. Kinda of irriatating to have to pay extra for some of the sauces though since they aren't included in their reguilar sauce list. And then they don't even fill the containers more than half full when you've paid extra for them. I suppose when I am in the mood for chicken & in the nieghborhood I might stop in again.
Heard good things but was totally disappointed chicken came out burnt fries were cold and the server acted like he/she (couldn't tell) didn't care about their job at all! Will not be going back!!!

We just had the chicken finger and chicken sandwiches with fries. The fries were done well crispy and salted just right, the chicken fingers had a light coating on them and was good quality lean chicken, the bread and sandwich ingredients were all fresh. The place looks like an old fashioned bell hop type of drive in from the 50's, it had 4 picnic tables under the shaded area in front of the restaurant, a perfect place to sit on a nice day, it had about 8-12 tables inside also. Best chicken fingers I have had so far in and around Vegas.

Decent at best, the breading was soft and so were the fries, the whole meal seemed a little oily compared to the Chicken Shack  in Boulder  The Chicken Shack in Boulder is way better, they make a crisper, less oily chicken finger and crisp well done fries. Also Raising Canes on Las Vegas BLVD is better.

When I arrived at Chicken Shack, I asked the cashier to help me with my discount on my phone. Although it was on the site, we couldn't make it work. So he went to his manager & they gave me my discount anyway. I ordered the 3 piece tender combo. The chicken was perfectly fried & tender & I really enjoy the way they make their French fries.

I called and ordered dinner to go. 5 piece chicken fingers and a single bacon burger with cheese.  As soon as I walked in I was greeted by the friendly staff. Food was fresh with great flavor. Exactly what I was craving.

This place is the best. I'd recommend over canes. They hand batter the chicken to order so it's always fresh. The fries are made in butter so they're super buttery and delicious and crispy. Everything is made fresh to order. Every time we've gone we've never been disappointed. The customer service is always pretty great and their sauces are all homemade and super tasty. The only downside are the drinks because their soda machine isn't the best. The chicken wings and fingers are pretty huge compared to like bww or canes or any other place. Definitely recommend!

Shack attack!   From the first time we set foot in Chicken Shack to the present, it's been our favorite place for wings.  I have a catch phrase of 'Shack Sunday' because we always come here to get our wings during football season.  They open at 10 so it's perfect for game time. They are located off of Sunset in the Smiths shopping plaza so it's easy to find with ample parking.    Now let's get down to business- the wings here have stayed consistently huge, succulent and flavorful.  They offer a huge variety of sauces for the wings.  All are great.  The hot sauce and the honey habanero are our favorites.  You can choose to have them tossed in the sauce or on the side.  Tip- if you're carrying out, get the sauce on the side and toss them yourself when you get home.   I hate to leave out mentioning the over addicting shoestring fries.  They do not skimp on these tasty sides.  The BBQ baked beans are also a favorite of mine. It's always a tough choice of mine which side to get.    Customer service is reliably top notch. They treat us like one of their friends every time.  They are always friendly and make a point to say hi even during a busy time.  I always appreciate their kindness as well as the amazing food.    Any day is always a great day for wings!

The fried chicken is cheap.  That's the attraction and why this place is busy, even at ten in the morning. It's better than the fast food places for sure.   Latest visit the place already looked trashed, sticky floors, the floors around soda dispenser area was wet.  Come on, they just opened? I was hesitant on ordering chicken because if front of house is a hot mess what about the kitchen? Went against my better judgment and ordered my combo meal from the surly cashier.  Well now I remember why we don't come here so often.  Some pieces were good, some salty, most pieces dry.  Ended up with upset stomach even though I ended throwing most of my meal. Sigh.  So this update is more a note to myself why we pass on this place.

My chicken tenders were dry and the breading came off all of them as I tried picking them up. What else might be left to add?   The restaurant is small & cute and they have great side sauces like ranch and honey mustard along with many other options but I like eating food that tastes fresh and delicious. The skinny fries are ok but didn't do it for me either. I found my fries to be incredibly salty.   I think that if you make one thing you should make it really well.   I also think other similar chains offer better quality of food and lower prices. The end.
Food = great! The people = great.  We go there all the time! Sooo good Fries = yum Cannot go wrong !

Sooo bomb. I got the 3 finger combo & had them put the mild sauce over the fingers, SHIT. The mild was kinda spicy but sweet at the same time. The fries were kinda salty but tasted good with the ranch. Speaking of the ranch, they have really good ranch. The ranch says a lot to me about the quality of the place. My boyfriend got the 5 piece finger with hot bbq over them. Reminded me of Buffalo Wild Wings honey bbq boneless wings, but better. S
Tasty wings & strips. The wife variety of sauces was awesome. Came on a Sunday, the gal at the front was really nice.

I always get the #3 combo, which includes 3 pieces of chicken, fries and a safe. You can get the chicken tied in the sauce, but I find that they get soggy quicky. Chicken is most and tender. I love the Jamaican jerk sauce and their ranch!

I prefer coming to this newest location of The Chicken Shack. Located in the strip mall anchored by Kohls, it's by a residential area, less traffic to deal with, right off the 215 Valle Verde exit. It's cleaner and kept clean, unlike the other Henderson location which I reviewed in the past.  The meal combos are good deals. My go to is #1 Combo.. 6pc wings, heap of skinny fries(or veggies on request) and a drink. Just under ten bucks!  Favorite sauce/topping: It's a garlic parmesan, but the dry rub version, tossed. Not on the menu, so you have to request it..or point to my photo. The owner, V..?, told me she makes the sauces every morning. I haven't got around to trying any other sauces, just the garlic/parm one, 3 different ways..lol..So you got a favorite, I want to hear about it, maybe I'll change up my orders.  The chicken ..good.. nice size, meaty..but not the best. But for the price, I'll go for it. There was one time I came and it was a tad dry, another time under seasoned.  The employees, owner or staff in charge do make the rounds to those dining in and will ask how is everything and are eager to please their customers.  Dining area is clean, same furnishings left from previous restaurant are still here,,,makes me miss BBD now..sniff sniff.  The wall is decorated with those corny "Why Did The Chicken Cross the Road" jokes and license plates. I spotted one from the Phillipines!  It's busy from the start at 10am and seating fills up fast. This particular franchise is separate from Sunset and Boulder City locations, different owner/operator. The staff is really nice and friendly and make it a point to remember their regulars, an overall good neighborhood vibe and place to get wings!

First time @ this place. It was packed which seems to be a good sign, I ordered the chicken fingers, and really wasn't impressed. I had heard alot of good things from others, which led me to try it, but I wasn't excited about it. Needs more sauce as they seemed dry... Not bad, but not great.

It was my first time! I came with my boyfriend and our 2 girls and it was amazing!!! I definitely will come back, maybe even this week lol! The customer service alone, without even trying the food yet was outstanding. The food just topped it off. :)
They have awesome chicken fingers.  My favorite is creamy garlic Parmesan.  It gets pretty busy so we always call & order first then go pick it up.  I would recommended to everybody.

This place is AMAZING. the only reason it gets 4 instead of 5 is because the place is super small, and when it's busy sometimes all the tables are full. I love their fingers and fries! Everything is cooked fresh and hot, and their sauces are amazing too. They have so many different types to choose from. My favorite is the chili lime sauce and regular hot sauce. The service was great too, they called us by name, and every employee had a smile on their face. Definitely returning.

I have been a loyal customer of the Sunset location since we moved to town.  Now that it's minutes from my home, that was a cherry on top!  What do we want? WINGS!  When do we want them? NOW!  With the amazing service, that is exactly what you get.   Delicious big and juicy wings delivered to your table quick!  What I love almost more than their wings are their fries.  Addicting and abundant.  I believe our baskets were overflowing with so many fries.  Our To-Go orders have been the same.  They surely do not skimp on them and it's totally worth every bite.    I was happy to taste the same great consistency as the original location.   This 'Shack Sunday' girl will be back for more!

Awesome place. My friends and I got the 4 person deal. We got 25 wings, a gigantic basket of fries, 4 sodas, and 1 lb of potato salad. The wings were huge and they were very tasty. We had different opinions of what flavors to get, but we were happy with our choices. This is definitely recommended and we will come back to eat the "all you can eat wings".

Had another craving for good chicken wings...thought I'd update my thoughts.  There's something about the batter on the chicken pieces that makes it taste so good...it's also spattered all over the fries.  It's just a nice, greasy, deliciously unnutritious meal.  I have to slightly recommend the wings over the fingers though, as the fingers are a little thick and dry.  I tried the BBQ and mild sauces this time, and the mild was nasty.  I'm not a hot wing guy, so I'd definitely recommend sticking with the honey BBQ or teriyaki sauces if you're anything like me.  TIP: The fingers taste better if you let them marinate for a few minutes in the styrofoam "to go" box on the way home...a lot juicier and tastier than dining in.

Fries were pretty tasty and I like the variety of sauces that they offer. I got chicken tenders and they were nothing special. I probably would have been better off getting the wings. I liked the atmosphere of the shop though.

This is my favorite chicken fingers place, huge chicken portions and the best fries I've ever had. Friendly service and loved the 70s classic rock music . They have a lot of great sauces to choose from I try new one every time I come in.
We were in town for Sema and met up with a bunch of people here one evening last week...great food and customer service!
CHICKEN SHACK IS AMAZING ! Great customer service , awesome management and overall 20/10 on the food !!!! Great prices and a easily accessible location as well !

After living in Vegas for a year, I'm used to going to places with high ratings/reviews and being underwhelmed. This place lived up to the hype! Large, meaty wings in great sauces, with surprisingly tasty shoestring fries- and I don't even like the shoestring cut! Service was also surprisingly friendly and prompt, so don't let the location and exterior fool you.  The #4 combo is the way to go for a little of everything: 3 wings, 3 strips, fries, a drink (fountain), and toss in bleu cheese or ranch for just under fifty cents extra. Your total is under $10 and it's enough to stuff you to the gills or share (though for dinner I'd add on an extra 6-piece).  Habanero honey and jamaican jerk are really tasty sauces- as my BF said, I'd buy these bottled if they were available! The bleu cheese dressing tastes homemade, which makes paying extra for it a little less annoying.  Wish they had more than one location- I think they'd do well on the West side (hint, hint).

I used to work at Sunset Park for Clark County. So, I've been to the chicken "shack" since it was Chicken Bonz.  The blonde lady who runs the register has been there since I remember. She really didn't smile, or seem to have any personality at all. I remember ordering chicken tenders in habenero honey to go, with fries. The meal that I got was six pieces of chicken, and included a drink. Somehow, this ends up close to $11.  $11...? That's like charging me a dollar for every piece of chicken. Then charging $2 for a handful of fries, and then $2 for a drink, plus tax. I just think that's a little steep.  I get home, and I didn't have tenders, I had wings...and they are wimpyyyyyy!!!  The sauce was good, and so were the fries. I just think that the prices are steep, and the feeling of the store isn't very welcoming.

I've only had their chicken to go and was ok fried chicken.  We had strips and wings.  Their fries were soggy by the time we got them home and to be expected in a Styrofoam container.  We tried them twice.  The second time felt undercooked.  The flavor was good and the fries are better if you heat in oven after getting home.  There's a reason the fast food places put fries in open paper container ;)
Their chicken is the best!!! The flavor and it's so tender! The correct amount of breading on it. The sauces are amazing!

so I think they need to change the oil more frequently.....my last 3 times the chicken has been burnt due to bad grease. Not sure what's going on with them never had this problem until lately.  Very disappointed

Fast and friendly. I had the Sweet Chili wings with their Spicy Blue Cheese, fries, and baked beans. The wings were perfect and the spicy blue cheese had plenty of kick. The baked beans were fabulous.

Amazing, the flavor a was all there the chicken wings are incredibly huge (bigger than bww)  The only thing is seating capacity. It gets so busy during lunchtime that most people order Togo because there are only like 8 tables inside.  You know it's good when it's always busy! I'm definitely coming back!
This place rocks!  We stopped for lunch. The folks are friendly and the place is clean, bright and cheerful.  The chicken was juicy and potions of an unbelievable size.  We will be back!

Had an unfortunate experience when I was given another customers order to go. They caught me outside and explained their mistake and quickly corrected it. They continuously apologized and gave me a free meal card on top of it. My chicken wings were fabulous.

Alright, when you walk in, the first thing you see is all these license plates which makes me think, "This is about to be some good a$$ chicken." I go over to the counter and order that 3 piece and a drink. I get my drink and these dudes go ahead give me an extra chicken. You know what that is? That's Kobe in the 4th. CLUTCH.
Great food at a great price. The staff was incredible! We were headed to lake mead and Hoover dam. Seen this on Yelp and gave it a try. We will go again if in area

The Chicken Shack, not to be mistaken for Chicken Bonz. Although almost everything taste the same.  You may think 6 wings, fries, ranch and a drink for $9.12 is pricey, think again. These wings are huge and they give a generous amount of fries.  I recommend getting the 3 fingers and 3 wings combo, way worth it, the fingers are huge pieces of juicy breast meat.  They also have an AYCE special going on all day everyday for $11.95 ($1 dollar cheaper than chicken bonz).  I still have yet to try it.  They also have $1 drafts!  As for the inside, it's small and it's maintained pretty well, they got two TV's hanging on the wall, two arcade machines and limited seating on the inside, but there's a couple tables on the outside too.  Overall, flavor and quantity is what Chicken Shack has.  That's really all you need for a good place to eat right?
What can I say.. I love Chicken Shack! The finger, the sauce, the fries. So stinkin' good. The staff is awesome. Great prices.
Great, quick service! The fries are well done and are the perfect ratio from crispy to chewy. The medium sauce is a good balance between spicy and sweet.

I really loved the French Fries. Very thin and crispy.  My husband and children got wings and we got an order of fingers. The fingers didn't get eaten like I thought they would but everyone loved the wings. Next time I'll just get way more fries and pass on the fingers.  The place was pretty busy ( which I consider to be a good sign). It took about 15-20 for my Togo order to be ready.
I've been going there for many years. We usually go in a group when we go. I usually order the chicken fingers and fries. Their portions are generous and the food is good.

I ordered 3 shack burger meals, 1 with cheese, tomato and pickle, 1 with just cheese, and one plain.  In addition to 12 wings with the sweet chili sauce "tossed ON" the wings. What I received was 2 burgers with everything but cheese and 1 with everything including cheese. The fries were cold and my wings wasn't covered in sauce. Instead they put 2 little sauce cups on the side. Lastly, with the shack burger meals came with 3 drinks. I only received 2. The couple times I've been to CS I loved it. Hence why I'm very disappointed.

Whoever answered the phone when I called just now has no customer service skills. He was super short and unfriendly when answering my question. Will not be going to that location today or anytime in the future.

So after everybody claiming this place is great, I finally went and boy was I disappointed. The chicken was chewy and greasy. The sauces were not good. The ranch dressing was though. The fries were disgusting, oily and cold.  We also purchased wings and those were nasty as well. Don't do what I did and believed people that this place was so great and then expect great, because you will want to slap yourself for believing this. People are easily impressed with anything they don't cook. Maybe that's the problem, they should cook.   Don't waste your money. To top it off it is pretty expensive for the quality of food. Don't do it.  Unless you like wasting money.  :)

Its pretty bomb.  A little dive but man can they cook chicken.  They also have pitchers of beer.  It's pretty great sitting outside eating wings and drinking beer.  Small and cozy.  Jerked and hot teriyaki are my favorites bone in or out doesn't matter, along with some Alaskan Amber beer.  Yummy.
Good place for chicken fingers. The fries could use some work.. very skinny and greasy and overall seems like a very cheap fry. But as far as the chicken fingers.. pretty good.

The best chicken fingers I've ever had, by far.  Better be really hungry if you order the 5 piece cause they're big!  Owners are friendly and welcoming!  They even brought some grilled chicken out to the car for our 3 dogs. Maybe I've lived in Vegas too long but when you come across friendly people like them, it's refreshing and makes you want to come back. The neighboring business blocks/ distracts view of their signage and we had to flip around in busy Saturday traffic....but it was well worth it.. Thanks Chicken Shack!

I love the food here! the first time I came here there was a kind young gentleman that assisted us at the register and his hospitality alone made me recommend this spot to all my friends and family. I returned again on Labor Day and the lady that is mentioned numerous times on their Yelp page helped me. she is completely rude but had no problem sucking the tv reporters butt that was in their establishment. because of her attitude I don't think I can support this eatery any more. way to make your customers feel like shit

All I have to say is that if you are ever heading to The Hoover Dam and pass through Boulder City and have a hankering for some Humongous Crispy Juicy Chicken Fingers or perhaps done Chicken Wings, then you better make sure you make a Pit Stop here at The Chicken Shack or else you'll be sorry.   After eating the Chicken Fingers here at The Chicken Shack, the bar has been set so high I don't think I'll ever eat any Chicken Fingers like I've eaten here.   The Chicken Fingers here are so juicy and cooked to perfection with that perfect crunch, i was in Chicken Heaven.   As for the Chicken Wings, it would've been perfect without being tossed in the sauce because I'm a savory type of guy and it was a tad bit too sweet for me but still good nonetheless.   But the star of the show are those Chicken Fingers. It really left a lasting impression on me. Because this may be the only chance I'll ever eat here, I also had the Chili and it was so savory and full of meat. I loved the addition of Sour Cream and Jalapeño's on it as well.   And make sure you use the Bathroom even though you don't have to and you'll get a kick out of it.   I'm still thinking about those Chicken Fingers even when I'm in Hawaii....

Looks a little sketchy from first glance but the food is outstanding! Staff is great and attentive. Bathrooms are super clean! Prices are very fair. A really fun experience! You have to use a rubber chicken to access the bathroom! That was a fun little side bar. I would absolutely eat here again a snd recommend to anyone looking for a unique experience with great food!!

So many sauces, so little time! There's a truly huge selection of sauces for tossing or dipping your wings, strips, and fries, so you can change up your order every time. Some of my favorites are the Jamaican Jerk, Hot Honey Garlic, and Creamy Garlic Parm. They also offer spicy versions of their house-made ranch and blue cheese dressings, to kick things up a level.  This location recently opened and is clear across town from me, but has been consistently clean with friendly staff across a couple of visits. I prefer the huge, meaty fingers over the crispy, juicy wings, but they also offer salads, sandwiches, burgers, and a surprisingly good bowl of chili. My go-to is the #4 combo (wings and fingers) with their skinny, salty fries to complement the spicy sauces I get.   TIP: Order online through the Yelp app so you can grab on the go!

So happy I found this place on yelp. We were driving back to Phoenix from Las Vegas. We got our food super fast and it was so good. They give large portions and even allowed us to try one of famous tenders. I got the lemon pepper wings. I don't have any complaints. I can't wait to come back! We will def. stop by again!

Absolutely some of the best chicken I've ever had. So flavorful even with out the sauce which is very important when it coomes to chicken, because most chicken eateries the chicken is very bland and this chicken hands down tops all chickens joints rasing canes wing just STOP ain't nothing on THE CHICKEN SHACK puts them to shame. If they ever decide to move it down to LA they would make a killing....can't wait to go back so I have some on our road trip home

7:29 for 6 wings isn't especially cheap. On average good wings should be about a buck each. Also the fingers are good but way salty and the ranch dressing is very thin.  Fries are pretty good shoestring fries and tasty but again very salty. With all the positive reviews I'd hoped for better. Inside it seats about 20 essentially it's a sonic drive up but no car hop service must walk in.

Another update...  went back to the shack again. This time it was busy. It was also a holiday. New guy at the register, had no idea what he was doing, but he was trying.  This time the food was good. Trip #1 good food good service. Trip #2 eh food and eh service. Trip #3 good food and eh service. "I'll be back."

The chicken is really good and so are the fries. It's too bad because this place is pretty gross inside. Food all over the floors, sticky table tops, a single trash can that looks like it's been there since they opened the place. Woman wearing a backwards ball cap at the register is super rude, I've been brought here by some friends a couple of times and she's always been working. She's very short and makes you feel stupid if you can't hear what she says as she mumbles questions to you. You can tell she doesn't want to be there as you compete for her attention with her cell phone.   Bottom line the food is great. But I don't think it's worth the bad customer service, and I mean it's a chicken place, it's not that hard to take an order. It's so dirty in there too. They have other locations so just go there instead of this one.   **Update** they have a new team and have cleaned the place up. It's perfect.

I went here ever so eager. My eyes went wide at the menu - so many possibilities and so many sauces to try.  I opted for the standard wings. And went with trying 4 of the sauces - hot, damn hot, chili lime, and habanero honey. Blue cheese and ranch for dipping. Also ordered fries with fry sauce and potato salad.  The wings themselves are nice and plump. Very good quality. And the wings are actually breaded, which can be hard to do well. But the breading was nice and crisp and had a good flavor. So all is good with the actual wings.  The sauces, though, are lacking. The hot was actually more like a mild. Zero heat and little flavor. The chili lime was similar. I could barely tell it was chili lime there was so little flavor. The habanero honey also had zero heat and was too sweet. The damn hot, however, was fabulous. It had heat and flavor, but wasn't hot just for the sake of being hot. So, with the exception of the damn hot (which is the hottest on their menu), if you don't like heat or lots of flavor in your wing sauce, this might be the place for you. This is where they lose major points. The sauce is the most crucial part of the wings.  The blue cheese and ranch were ok, but not great. They didn't add anything to the wings. They're just sorta there.  The fries are really good. They are shoestring fries that are crispy and non-greasy. The fry sauce was just average. They do also offer chili cheese fries.  The potato salad was edible. And that's pretty much the best I can say about it.  Good service. Props for the $1 drafts and all you can eat wings.  Overall, if they could just get some better wing sauces (or my taste buds suddenly deteriorate), I might be back.
The chicken fingers are amazing. Best in town. Thick and full, not like raising canes nasty full of bread and no chicken. Great customer service, will definitely be there at least once a week.

Ordered the # 2 combo, medium heat.  Overall it was really good, great value.  The chicken fingers were perfect, no "questionable" bites.  The fries were addicting - I kept eating and eating and eating them, even after I was full.  The only comment I have is that the chicken fingers looked like sauce was dumped on them, I'd rather have them tossed in sauce so the sauce covers 100% of the chicken.  Other than that it was a great meal, I will be back for lunch again!
Great prices and great food. the wings and legs are large sized so dont order too much.
Great chicken and adorable owners. What a difference between typical fast food and the gourmet chicken here. I have had better coleslaw, but I am not really going there for the sides.
The chicken strips were good, the fries OK, and the sauces as advertised.  The lettuce in the salad was edible, but not fresh.

I love this place. The chicken is always juicy and done to perfection and the fries are always hot! The Boulder City location is great too and so is Valle Verde. The new location on St Rose needs more than a little help, but I'm sure it'll soon come up to the standard of the rest!

My family used to go there a lot. We generally got decent food for what it was. Recently bought dinner and it was disgusting. It was soggy, under sauced, and tasted old and terrible. We called to let them know that night. They on their own offered to replace it, but the next day when we called in asking if we can pick up our replacement, they were very rude. Acting like we were trying to steal food, when they were the ones who offered. They talked back to us..argued with us, just all around acted terrible. They finally said they'd replace a small portion of the terrible old chicken they sold us. We said never mind.  My sister didn't think the food would be safe for her kids, that they might do something to it, because the people acted so underhanded and trashy. I wouldn't have guessed, from having gone in there that they would be so low.   If you like this restaurant, I'd go to a different location!

So happy that this location opened. Their menu is simple, the wings, fingers, and fries are perfection. The sauces are exceptional. As a transplanted Upstate NYer, I can honestly say this is my new favorite place for my Buffalo Wing and Blue cheese fix.
Love love this place! Excellent chicken and service..we are regulars and love garlic parmesan and honey bbq. The chicken is juicy and tender
Great food and great service! The Chicken Shack is now my go to spot for some bomb fried chicken!
So. Good. Super friendly staff and a ton of delicious dips to choose from. I always get the chicken fingers and fries and am never disappointed. Do recommend!
Such a great casual atmosphere. Huge portions at a great price! Pitcher of beer only $8. So great with the greasy chicken and fries!

The food was delicious! I came out to Las Vegas for vacation but also visit a good friend. He would always check in on Facebook at The Chicken Shack. I told him he will need to take me there for lunch. The best idea we both had. The chicken fingers were flavorful, juicy, and delicious. I had honey BBQ, the sauce was very light and flavorful. I will come back whenever I visit again.

Chicken Shack is a top-3 restaurant in Henderson for me. I work across the street and regularly walk to eat here for lunch. Their chicken tenders are the best I've had in Henderson, and their skinny fries are the perfectly crispy complement to the tenders. The best part of eating here is the occasional 4th tender they give you when you order a 3-piece meal. They have great sauces, and one of my favorite requests is to have the tenders thrown in medium sauce. For the days when you need a somewhat healthier meal, their grilled chicken salad is filling and somewhat satisfying. The only issue with eating at chicken shack is the limited seating.
Unbelievable.  You will not be disappointed.  In my opinion the chicken fingers are the best choice. That way you get to sample the sauces.

Absoulty the best wings I've had in Las Vegas.   Went early in the morning for chicken and waffles.   Well priced, 4 wings and the perfect waffle.     Recommend if your in Henderson and hungry stop by.  The wings reminded me of what the originals hooters wings used to be like.   Fresh, crunchy and cooked perfectly.   The spicy ranch sauce whoever made that up deserves a raise.   Check it out.

I love this place.  The chicken is so good that you don't even need sauce but you want it!  Every sauce I have tried is good but I love the medium!  Lemon pepper rub is also good.  Portions are really good sized and most times when I ask for extra fingers, they give me more than I ask for for free!  The fingers are the way to go although you also can't go wrong with the wings.  Better than canes or any other chicken place around.

This place is bomb!  I can't say how much I love it.  I was extremely happy when it moved closer to my house and literally 2 minutes from my work.  I may just become obese because of it but that would be ok because it is that good!  Easily the best fingers in town with the best sauces!  The medium and Cajun are where it's at and their ranch is great, which is odd because I've always hated ranch before I tried theirs.  Go here.  The staff are friendly although it did take them a little bit to figure out the register and gift card system but it's fairly new so I'm giving them a break.

A friend told me about this place. Small little quaint restaurant, but dont let the outside fool you. If chicken is what your really craving, I'd come to this place any day over buffalo wild winsg.  The wings are twice the size of buffalo wild wings. Sounds like a bold statement but u gotta try it and you'll know what i mean.
The food is awesome and the employees are very nice.   The chicken wings are the best I've tasted in years.  I ordered a 12 piece and it was way more than i could eat. Excellent fries too!

Best chicken strips I've had! Large juicy pieces that are breaded to perfection. Light, flakey, and crispy on the outside.  Wings were okay, 2.5 stars. Over breaded and light on the sauce. Stick to the chicken strips.

This place doesn't look like much but the chicken fingers are OUT OF THIS WORLD! Fries were great too - and the guys who work there were super quick and sweet, we loved our dinner and can't wait to go back.

Their chicken is on steroids!     I was thinking about getting the All You Can Eat special for $11.99 but I was stuffed after 5 wings. I tried the BBQ, Habanero Honey, and Garlic Parmesean. I think the Habanero Honey stood out the most and it's probably my favorite flavor there. I also got a side of cole slaw which tasted like KFC's (which I personally like). I also got a side of fries but it wasn't memorable and it didn't enhance the meal. Hence, I would probably opt out. As much as I like getting a bang for the buck, the unnatural plumpness of the chicken was bit disturbing. Though, I enjoyed the meal the breading was a little bit too thick. If they would refine the breading, I'd give them 3.5 stars for great price and the Habanero Honey flavor.

One word....DELICIOUS!! I showed up to the restaurant around 6 PM and the place was fully crowded. I knew that was a good sign. I am glad I called in my order because they were packed! The chicken was juicy and crispy and the chili cheese fries were amazing. Can't wait to come back here!

Awesome wings and even the fries are good!!!!! Needed a place to stop on the way to Vegas and this was such a hit with the kids! I'm a New Yorker so I'm picky about my wings and these passed the test!

Great Quality Chicken Strips!!! They have a great selection of dipping sauces that can be drizzled over top or on the side for dipping. The batter is light and salty and the chicken is 100% breast meat. Very tender. The prices are reasonable and there is a sauce for everyone. For an alternative to "Fast Food" that is a bit more healthy than the chain stores give Chicken Shack a try. I prefer them to Canes.  We were told the name change occurred when the original Chicken Bonz owners wanted to increase margin with frozen chicken and lower cost recipes and preparation.   Regardless of the name Chicken Shack is a solid pick for some Good Fried Chicken in Las Vegas.

Really the best chicken southeast.   The husband and son go here every chance they have. The chicken fingers are big and juicy and the wings are amazing.  A small order of fries is huge and they are crisp and fresh.   Prices are very reasonable.   The restaurant is a hole in the wall but conveniently located by smith's.   They would have gotten 5 stars if it was a little cleaner.   Staff is friendly and helpful and food comes up fast.

The lemon pepper wings here are the best I've had. I enjoy yard bird and in size and flavor these wings meet my expectations. This location is always busy whenever I'm there, a testament to good food.

I'm for sure a regular at chicken shack. in my opinion it is probably one of the best places to get chicken around town. not only is there good chicken they have exquisite fries. the sports atmosphere is fantastic. for a meal less than $10 you will not leave chicken shack hungry I promise you that.

Made an order to go by phone and an employee with a blonde bleached Mohawk said and I quote "We're f-ing closed" as I walked in to pick up. I ignored him and walked up to the counter and paid. Then a family with a small child walked in (keep in mind that the sign still said open and it was 8:38 when they closed at 9:00) and he was so rude that they left. Not even sure what else to say.
freaking awesome everytime !!!! My food is delicious and always fast. the staff is great!

Stopped here on the way to the Hoover Dam, and we were very glad we did! Anytime a place has 5 stars you gotta figure they're doing something right. And Chicken Shack certainly didn't fail to impress.   I had the double burger - Two huge patties on an onion roll, served with fries and a drink for like 6 bucks. I don't know how they do it. It's an amazing deal. And to make it even better, they had some of the best french fries I've ever had. Thin, shoestring style fries, but cooked and seasoned to crispy perfection. So few take pride in their fries these days. Chicken Shack is different.  My friend had their signature chicken fingers. I tried one - they too, were truly amazing. Juicy white meat, but crispy on the outside. Again, you could tell they were cooked with purpose, not just by some lackey who's trying to rush through everything. Came with some delicious dipping sauce. For both of us we only spent like $13. Wish they had this place where I live.

FINALLY---- A Chicken Shack close to my house!!! I've been waiting patiently for this location to open and I was excited when I drove by and the OPEN sign was illuminated.   Honestly, I've only ever had the wings and fries at their locations, so my review can only be based on those items.   The chicken is ALWAYS fresh and hot. It's always cooked properly and you always have enough dipping sauce. The fries are OK, but the place isn't called Fry Shack....  The staff is friendly and helpful. They always seem to have smiles on their faces!!   Welcome to the neighborhood!!

Called to place a pick order. They were pleasant and helpful on the phone. My to go order was ready when I arrived about 10-12 minutes later. I ordered a bunch of wings for a small party with all my sauces on the side. Wings were large, cooked through, and tasted great. Sauces tasted good (chili lime, sweet chili and medium). I will order from them again.

My husband was picking all our stops today, and he loves this place...I however, was underwhelmed.  -Service was friendly -food came out FAST -chicken fingers were good  -several sauce options   -didn't care for the fries, just a personal preference  -coleslaw tasted a little fermented  If he wants to bring me here again I would probably just order the chicken by itself. Good place to get a party platter from - I think the chicken would be awesome in a wrap.

I went yesterday and we got honey BBQ wings with fries and fry sauce. Everything was delicious and the employees were all very nice. We ordered way too many wings, so we brought them home and they were still really good after I microwaved them! I will definitely be going back.

It felt like 1950 again.  The wife and I sat outside eating our chicken and fries on a warm evening in February and watched the cars pass by.  They don't have anything like this in our neck of the woods (SoCal).  A very pleasant evening.  Customer service was top notch.  Thanks, we will be back.

The best chicken we have ever had and we eat a lot of chicken wings! Portions were big and sauces all homemade and delicious. Fries were skinny,perfectly salted and hot. Chris and Anna were the most friendly that we have met on our trip. Many thanks and best of luck!

Nothing special at this place, mediocre food and bad customer service. The chicken fingers have almost no breading and covered in grease, and very bland you'd figure you could at least taste the grease.      Been here a few times and almost evertime we order the people behind us get their food first, and we just get a simple 5 piece with fries. And when asked about it they were very rude.  Ok maybe you forgot, but to utter obseneties under your breath at a costumer so close they can hear you... that's just wrong!

Very nice!! The food quality here is excellent!! We both enjoyed their chicken tenders very much. The shoestring fries are very good. The medium sauce is just perfect. We also enjoyed the fry sauce and blue cheese dip.  There's nothing to complain about here. Lovely local place to which we'll return.
Yay! Finally one in Spring Valley. I grew up going to the one in Henderson, so happy that they are expanding. Best Chicken Fingers!

Highly recommended.  Best fried chicken I have had since arriving to the states in 2014. If you are in the area you must try!  The fries are also awesome.  The wings and fingers (chicken breast prices) were fresh and delicious.  They have many sauces on offer, you can have it over the chicken or on the side. We Tried the sweet chilli, honey BBQ and the honey garlic. All were great.  The only thing missing from this was a beer. They do offer Bud, but, I had a long drive ahead of me after lunch, but if I didn't I definitely would have had a beer with this!

Went there last night before a move mine at Galaxy theatre. The staff was super friendly the beer was cold I had 6 wings (hot) my wife had chicken fingers with garlic dipping sauce . The chicken wings and the fingers were both cooked perfect and very tasty. We will definitely be back again. Reasonably priced also.

I never thought I would review a Chicken Shack at less than a 5/5, much less a 3/5. I've been a Shack man for the past 5 or so years, having been dozens of times in that span. I was excited to hear another one was opening in Henderson when they announced the Valle Verde location. My first trip was shortly after the grand opening. The chicken was ok but not quite up to par with the Sunset location, and the chili I got on my fries (if you're going to get a combo, do yourself a favor and always upgrade to the chili cheese fries) tasted a little off. I chalked it up to, "new store kinks." I've now been back twice, and only once have I gotten the delicious food I'd expected. This last time might've been my last at this location. If you've ever been to a Chicken Shack, you know that there are two main reasons you eat there: the juiciest chicken in the lightest, crispiest batter on Earth, and the variety of amazing sauces. This location seems to be experimenting with both--and unfortunately failing.  The batter used today was clearly a different recipe than the classic Shack recipe. It was somewhere between that light crispiness and the thick, crunchy breading you see on frozen chicken strips. Now, even this travesty could be salvaged by the BEST HONEY BARBECUE SAUCE ON EARTH, which they traditionally have. Seriously, I could write sonnets about the smokey, sweet goodness of their HBBQ sauce. But today's recipe for that was wrong too! It was sour, tasting vinegary like they'd tried to make it more like a buffalo sauce.   I'm still giving three stars because the shoestring fries were on point as usual, and they threw in an extra strip--an informal tradition across both locations, where they'll randomly throw in an extra strip if they think that one of the other strips is a little too small, or if they just feel like it. I'm hoping today was just a fluke and the kitchen had the B squad cooking & mixing sauce. If it's not, and these are the new recipes, PLEASE GO BACK!!

Chose this spot for our first meal in Vegas because we found it on Yelp. I was a bit disappointed maybe because we might be spoiled by California. We thought it was going to be really good but the food was okay. The fries weren't seasoned and the wings were eh. The cashier was okay she kind of gave us an attitude in the beginning because I was asking a question but she made it seemed like my question was dumb. I asked her if the wings that I chose were traditional and she answered what do you mean it's traditional. Girl, isn't it obvious that traditional is bone in? It was a simple question. But she answered with an attitude. Anyways, won't be coming back but hope they improve on the food.

Come early or be patient because the food is good. The fries are crisp and the chicken is hot and tasty. It's a small place so be prepared to say excuse me and smile a lot. Don't be afraid to share a table. Of the table is dirty, it's because the lunch tables turn quick. You'll leave full and satisfied.

Tried it for the first time based on other yelp reviews. It was delicious! We ordered the chicken fingers. Huge portions! The sauces are amazing! They give you a ton of fries. The chicken was juicy and the coating was perfect! The service was top notch too! We will definitely be back!
Place looks friendly. Food is delicious. Staff is nice and very fast at Togo orders. Will be coming back! My food is amazing and the chili cheese fries are bomb

5 we'll deserved stars. I'm as picky as they come about chicken wings. I typically order boneless because most places don't get bone in right, and I typically leave less than impressed with the dried up over battered boneless product I'm often served.  I live 4 hours from this place and can't wait to stop the next time I pass through. You may remember when Chinese takeout was synonymous with huge portions. This place tops those memories. The boneless chicken is moist and flavorful with a nice crunch, and the sauces are on point. It was so good I had to give bone in a try and my extra crispy wings came with the fat well rendered, the chicken moist and the skin crunchy.  Plus, they were wings from a full grown chicken, not one of those game hen wings most places serve.  The bathroom was spotless. My family does not do germs. We carry hand sanitizer in to cleanse after washing. I was all sorts of impressed withy the cleanliness of the bathroom.  When I'm going back to Cali, I'm stopping at the Chicken Shack.

I was in a mood for some chicken wings and I went on Yelp to find a place.  I am so glad I did because my sister and I enjoyed our meal.  We got the combination 6 wings, french fries, and sodas, and I added a cole slaw.  My wings and fries were so delicious and hot.  We enjoyed the parmesan cheese (they have wet or dry) and original with a side of teriyaki sauce.  We didn't need the sauce because it tasted great without it.  We couldn't finish the fries because there was a big pile of them.  The two workers were so nice and welcoming.  We are going back.  Try this place, you will like it!

Our favorite place we went while in Nevada! Get a lot of food for what you pay, and the fries are the best I've EVER had! Service was great too. Cashier was very helpful as it was our first time visiting. Would definitely go back!
Good but Raising Canes chicken fingers are better IMO. Fries are the bomb!

The food and service here are AMAZING!!!!!!!! We had an encounter with Zeek recently who was awesome. The portions are huge and the quality is even better.If you are hungry for chicken, this is the place to go. We got the Shack Pack and my family of 4 came home with more than half the food there was so much

Alrighty, although there were a few minor issues I have to say this is my new favorite wing spot. I walked in and was greeted by a cool cashier chick with tats and a hat. She led me to order the #1 which was 6 wings (I chose 3 medium and 3 garlic parm), fries and a drink for around ten bucks and within 10 minutes they were yelling my name that my order was ready.  The wings are large and meaty for the record but when I bit into my first medium wing it was an odd feeling of wonderful flavor mixed with disappointment that it wasn't as hot in the inside as it was on the outside. My next wing was garlic Parmesan (plain wing with some powdered Parmesan) and that bad boy was nice and hot on the inside.....idk why, but they were oddly different temperatures. The fries were whatever, there were a ton of them but they weren't anything special. The ranch was fine too but I'm a dipper and I should have asked for two.  I could almost live on those medium wings (next time I'll try a few lemon pepper) but I won't be ordering the boring garlic Parmesan again and depending on the occasion I'll probably just go for wings without fries. Lastly, there is only one small bathroom and it wasn't a dump just a little dusty here and there.
This place is GREAT!!! Chicken Shack has very friendly service and the food is good too. Also, the sauces were amazing!! I will be going back for sure. #FiveStars

I've passed Chicken Shack many times but have never came close to coming in.  Same center as Ross J's Aloha Grill. It is next to a Smiths and doesn't have a sign that stands out.  So I didn't expect much other than another chicken place.  Was I mistaken.   First thing that caught my eyes were all the various quotes and license plates all over the walls, NICE.  Even saw a license plate from Hawaii that started with a 'K'. I'm 100% sure that a 'K' means it's from Kauai, my home.  They most have known I was coming LOL.  They have 2 flat screen TVs and two arcade games, PAC-MAN and Marvel Super Heros vs Street Fighter.  There wasn't anyone there when I arrived around 2-3pm.  But I just missed the rush, as I was waiting for my food it started to pick up and it was filled.  I ordered the #4 which was 3 wings, 3 fingers, fries and drink for $7.95. LOVED IT.  The wings were good, cant really mess that up.  But the fingers were AWESOME must have been a rhino's fingers, they were plumped, crispy and crunch on the outside, and juicy on the inside. The fries were different, it was prepared like how you would fry calamari and salty but really good, not your regular salt combination.  Something that I've been doing lately and recommend is having the sauce on the side.  My sauce of choice this time was the Hot Teriyaki sauce which was a perfect complement to the saltiness.  I left full but really wanted more.   After talking to one of the worker I found out that Chicken Shack or at least this location has been open for 8 years already. I wished I found this place earlier, especially now that I don't live in the area, this would have been my regular eats.  They have a HH special which is actually all day everyday, its 12 wings, bucket of beers, and a basket of fries for $16. Which might be a good deal.  They also make burgers, sandwiches, and a fried or grilled chicken salad. I'll be back soon definitely.
Great wings and fingers! Garlic Parm fries are ridiculous!

Super friendly place!!!!!!! Haven't been here in a while because I'm so used to having sandwiches at the lake and on the way home I'm just not hungry yet.  But! They do have fresh, never frozen chicken wings!  Only downfall is they're just a little bit overbreaded. Good fries. Just wish they were made fresh all the time just like the wings.
Just happen to pass by here on my way from Arizona going to Vegas and boy, they have great chicken wings!!!

First of all....the chicken fingers are so juicy, my girlfriend ordered the chicken fingers with a garlic parmesan dry rub and it's very good.  I ordered the #4 3 wings 3 fingers and upgraded the fries for chili fries, the chili is delicious. I got honey BBQ for dipping sauce. It's pretty good.   We'll definitely come back after our trips to Lake mead   Which is like every weekend lol

In vegas for veterans day and I was driving to the Hoover Dam with my friends and was starving for something good!  Saw a little old place in Boulder City that was once a drive in diner called the Chicken Shack!  I ordered 2 #4 combinations of  3 wings 3 chicken fingers and an order of fries.  Have to say I was surprised at how great the fried chicken is.  It reminded me of chicken I used to eat flavor and seasoning 20 years ago at Tuskegee University at a place called the chicken coop.  Chicken had just enough flavor and seasoning , the chicken fingers were good also but I like the fried chicken pieces better. The French fries were great also and so was the iced tea for it to be in Nevada it was probably the best sweet iced tea I had a long time.  This is a place owned by a couple and they were really friendly and made me feel right at home would definitely recommend going again!

Our 1st time at Chicken Shack was at the Boulder City branch. It was good so we were happy to see a branch open nearby. Unfortunately today's order was toooooo salty! :( we ordered creamy garlic parmesan and lemon chicken. Both of them were too salty. It was terrible to eat the wings on its own. Good thing the macaroni salad and coleslaw were amazingly deliciously and helped even out the saltiness. Regardless, wings should be delicious on its own. Not salty. I hope this is just a rare incident. We'll still come back and hope to have better wings next time.

Mom and pop chicken place.  Everyone very friendly.  Yes, the chicken-- both wings and fingers are freshly made. Both quite good.  The thing I didn't expect was the taste of the fries.  They were dam near McDonald fry like appeal.     I was full but kept eating the generous portion you get with the combo.   Check them out, you won't be sorry.
Best wings in town, without a doubt. Fast friendly service. Awesome fries.

This place is great I give it five stars total. Its a small place its always full and that means hot food. Nope you wont get any cold food here. They have wings, strips and fries. They have strong good soda pop with a extra clean soda pop machine. Rather you eat it inside or take it home you will be hooked on they chicken. They have cool quotes on the wall about chickens. This place is also not over priced so it wont kill your budget if your like me and your on a budget.

Move over Hooters and Buffalo Wild Wings cause I found the best chicken wings ever!!    The size of their wings are so massive that it beats out all the other chicken spots I've tried.  Yes they're full of flavor, too!  So far I've only tried the garlic parmesan and habanero honey with ranch dipping sauce and it was so good!    Prices are great, too!

First off I've eaten the fingers here before and they're good. But today I wanted wings and I took them to go. I was pretty disappointed. Who breads wings and doesn't tell you they're breaded? It doesn't say on the menu and the cashier didn't say anything even when I asked for well done. Which should have been a clue to what I was expecting. My daughter got the fingers and every thing too salty on top off that. So that's why I now only rate them 3 stars.

This place is "A-OK" as the 3 star rating indicates.  I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but it's a better alternative than, say, gnawing my own arm off.  The shoestring fries would be very tasty, but they were so covered in salt that I couldn't eat more than a couple.  It must've been a heavy-handed day in the kitchen based on everyone's otherwise rave reviews.  I had chicken fingers and they were tasty.  The breading was good and they were cooked well.  The ranch was runny, but yummy.  It's expensive for what you get, but not highway robbery.  Also, the woman at the counter needs to relax a bit.  Honey, you're not running a Fortune 500 company.  It's the Chicken Shack.  Take a chill pill sister.

Stopped in tonight closer to closing then I like to but regardess of the time I was greeted right as I walked  through the door with a very friendly hello instead of the eye rolls I expected because of the time. The customer service was 100% and the food was great. What a lucky employer to have such a great staff!
Came to try the wing they had great food but amazing service! I've never felt so welcomed! Priscilla was so helpful and not to mention very patient! Hands down the best service I've ever experienced!
Good salty food Dirty sticky tables A bone and a hair in my chili, beware Trash overflowing  Fries and chicken are as good as I remembered however, seems like this place is going downhill.

Best chicken fingers in Las Vegas! Always fresh, never frozen. This place is almost always busy so don't mind if you have to wait a minute, worth the wait. The ranch dressing is made fresh in house as well as lots of other sauces. A local gem that you should definitely check out!!

Glad to see the quality and consistency from the original location is here as well! Been a fan of the shack for years! Some people tell me canes is the best (and don't get me wrong I like canes), but chicken shack is the best for fingers in town. Glad there is a closer location to my place in anthem. Too bad they close so early. I guess I'll go to canes late night. Any other time I'm coming here!

Horrible service and you shouldn't kick someone out of your store at 845 so you can crank the music really loud and kick back with all your buddies. The young men there are very rude and shouldn't be aloud to represent a business that is said to have the best chicken in town. I'm sure the owner of this place wouldn't be impressed with you young men damaging their reputation.

I LOVE CHICKEN SHACK! And I love it even more because it is so close to my house. I have only ordered their wings (honey habanero are my favorite, but all of the flavors are excellent) because they are just too good to pass up on every time I go in. Sauces are unique and do not taste like any other wing place in town. Strongly recommend!
Great food, great service......experience was ruined by loud music playing overhead. The sauces are great too......I like the variety.
This place is the bomb freaking dot com! The chicken strips are sooo good and fresh, and I love their fries!!
Just stopped here on a long day trip food was great service was quick and the young man that took our orders was friendly as can be highly recommend you stop by

My hubs and I always drive by this place when go to the lake. He always insists we go to A&W (because it's so nostalgic for him)...Well I gave it a try but I think I'll be OK if I don't ever eat there again lol. Anywho, driving by again and thought we would stop at chicken shack. So glad we did. I got 5 tenders and fries and he got the sandwich with BBQ sauce. It was soo good. 5 tenders was too much. I ate 2 1/2 pieces...They were so big. I couldn't stop eating the fries tho. Soo yummy and crunchy. This is not every day food but when u need something greasy, and you happen to be hungover on the way to the lake...this hits the spot.
Really good chicken, good prtions, friendly staff. First time here but definately NOT my last.

This place has the best chicken wings in the USA! I always get the lemon pepper dry rub with a few sauces and eat them until I'm miserable! Huge chicken wings, fast service, consistent, and damn good taste!

Usually go to the one on Sunset. Came here and ordered the same as always. 25 lemon pepper dry rub. This time is tasted like the chicken was in a pool of lemon juice for a month then rolled in salt. Next time went to Sunset and asked if it was different owner or different mix they said no same owner. Service was good but size and taste of chicken left me very disappointed.

Today was my first time at the Chicken Shack. I went to the new location in Boulder City, NV. The building used to be an old Sonic. It was their grand opening today so the lot was super packed, not a single open spot to park. I parked at the o'reillys and walked over to pick up my phone ahead order. Parking was my only issue, but it may be different when it settles from the excitement, so I won't count that against them.  The aroma was amazing and you can hear them frying up that crispy deliciousness. The establishment was clean and has a few indoor tables as well as outdoor seating. When I got there to pick up my order the line was a good 10 deep. I eventually asked one of the gals if my order was the one on the counter. She started to prepare it for me, but the owner or manager (not sure which, could be both) asked if it would be alright for them to fry mine up fresh since those boxes were sitting for about 30 min.  I had come at the right time (20 min estimated) but they must have finished it up ahead of time. There will be a learning curve for pick up orders so it wasn't a big deal to me. She wanted to make sure my stuff was fresh though so I waited another 5 min, paid for my order and was on my way. I really appreciated her thoroughness and effort in ensuring a quality meal...and they did not disappoint.  The chicken was so tender with just enough crunch on the outside. Super tastey and the portions are huge. We ordered large bc we expected small chicken tenders. These were massive. I could only eat 2 (kiddie size for me next time lol). We chose multiple dipping sauces (I got 4 free with my 20pc order and 2 lg fries...each additional was around 40 cents): Chipotle bbq, regular bbq, hot, sweet chili, honey mustard and of course fry sauce. They were all so good and they are quite large...looked like a 2oz plastic ramekin vs the small 1oz you get everywhere else so that's a plus. The fry sauce had a kick! Loved the skinny "shoe string" style fries also. The large is an entire togo box full at about $4.19 I think. Needless to say, after feeding 4 people, I brought home an entire box of tenders AND another full box of the fries to my kids.  They offer a deal 20pc tender (or 25 pc wing) 2 lg sides and 4 drinks for like $34.99 but I didn't need the drinks, so I just ordered my 20 pc and fries separate.   We will go again sometime. It was great. :)

This review is for the Chicken Shack off of St. Rose Parkway and Spencer. I've eaten here twice and to be honest the next time I'll only order the chicken. The chicken is definitely better than Canes. The fries are way too salty. If you have hypertension this is not the place for you. I normally like a little extra salt on my food but this was too much salt for a salt lover like me. My family and I ordered combos with fries and none of us ate the fries. We tried wiping the salt off but that didn't help. The chicken is similar to Canes but with more chicken. :-)

I'm a frequenter at The Shack and I'll tell you first hand it is quality chicken at a doable price. The first time you try Chicken Shack you will fall in love. Chicken Shack is a definite go-to spot when you're muddled on where to have a bite or if you're coming in for a visit. Chicken Shack is by far one of the finer chicken eateries on the west coast. Would recommend this place to the most loathing person of chicken. Great atmosphere, definite 5 star.

The chicken was juicy and fried well, a testament to keeping fresh oil in the kitchen. The fries are very, very small (shoestring?). The interior has about 5 tables. The exterior has 8 - 10. But since we went at lunch on a hot day, it was a good thing we got an inside table. The staff is friendly.

Fried chicken! Who doesnt love it? Its the best way to eat chicken in my opinion.  Came here obviously to try the chicken- walked in and decor is very cute with all different cute jokes about why the chicken crossed the road.  Menu consists of: Wings, chicken fingers, burgers, sanwhiches, salads, fries Side: baked beans, potato salad, Mac salad, Cole slaw veggie sticks  Homemade chili bowls  We had the sweet chili and garlic Parmesan, Breaded wings. NGL I was concerned about the breaded wings because most placed OVER bread the wings and its too chewy. They dont make naked wings, so I was forced to get the breaded wings. I was very SURPRISED to find they were only lighly breaded and VERY VERY crispy! Absolutely delicious!  6 piece wings are:  7.29$- kinda pricey but worth it They also gave us a free extra wing (idk if that was on purpose)- see pics there are 7 instead of 6   WISH LIST: Wish they had a wing happy hour! And beers would be nice  Will be back!

My whole family enjoyed this place. Chicken was awesome! Perfectly fried and juicy.  Great portion size for the price. The staff was so friendly.  Customer service excellent!! We will definitely come back when we are back in the area. I would recommend this place to anyone in the mood for fried chicken wings!

Went in today, saw they had chilli asked about it. The fucktard said "I don't know" well that was it!!!  I don't recommend this place, customer service is a fkn joke, place was dead, and dirty!!! I don't feel one star is deserved!!!
On the road trip, this small restaurant made my day. The chicken and fries are awesome. The restaurant is interesting too, do ask for restroom keys:)

Meh, it will do. I have tried this place twice, cause of the hype & I wings. The prices are average as far as wings go. The wings are pretty good size, with lots of meat. I have tried the hot BBQ and just regular buffalo wing sauce both were OK.
