Upon my 2nd visit I politely asked what sauce they recommend, the lady taking my order was kind of a bit## , she just said," the sauces are on the menu" in a snide way. The fries seemed pretty good but mine were doused in salt. What's kinda bs is they charge you for ranch or any sauce. That's like ordering nachos and paying extra for cheese, also there's no celery to bite into when your mouth is burning. All that aside, I didn't think this place was anything special. I will probably try it again if there is a spectacular sauce someone can reccomend and I have better customer service.
Some of the best wings in Las Vegas. Perfect place to order wings for your football party!
Best fried chicken ever! The chicken was perfectly cooked & juicy. Love the many choices of sauce & friendly, welcoming service! Next time I'm passing through Vegas this is a sure pit stop!

Yum. I had no idea this opened. So happy to to have a location close to me. I used to go to the one on sunset with my friends. The selection of sauces is awesome, but there are so many to choose from it can be tough to decide

We had a great lunch at chicken shack. We shared a 12 piece chicken half garlic cream and half habanero honey. With a small fry and coleslaw. Everything had great flavor. Chicken was cooked well. Fries were shoestring and plenty to share between the two of us. The coleslaw was cold and had a great balance of sweet and savory.   We at in the car to avoid the sun and we had our dogs with us. The owner came out and checked on us and even fed our three dogs with a little treat from her own dogs private grilled chicken stash! All of us left full and satisfied! Highly recommended :)

OK so we gave it ANOTHER shot because this used to be our go to place but AGAIN the Chicken Tenders were SOGGY AND UNDERCOOKED!!!!  I don't know what the heck the new owners are doing but get it together and cook the Chicken Tenders the way the previous owners did them.  The wings seem to be the same but the Chicken Tenders are NOT THE SAME!!!  AWFUL!!

Stopped here on the way from the airport to our hiking adventure. Totally exceeded expectations! Fried chicken was fresh and delicious, coleslaw and beans were superb sides, and the skinny fries were the perfect consistency. I got a salad and the lettuce was legitimate romaine, not the crap you get in a usual "fast food" salad. This place was excellent, highly recommend for a fast and yummy stop.

Place is legit. Visiting here from So Cal and long day on the boat. Kids didn't want to go out, so I went to pick something up. The Chicken Shack came up on my Google Map, so I read a few reviews all giving this place excellent ratings. So, we got the Family Shack Pack and split the wings and fingers, got the beans, Cole slaw and French fries. We all ate good, nothing left as we demolished it how good it was. We will definitely come back when we are back at the Lake.

We were arriving in Boulder City later in the evening and were looking for a place that served salad.  The Chicken Shack had a tasty Salad with either Grilled or Fried Chicken strips.  The Service was quick and the staff were very friendly.   It was easy to find from highway 93 and the prices were very affordable.  Definitely a classic family style drive -in and restaurant.  The kids will love the squeaky chicken restroom key! :-)

Some good meaty chicken tenders.The sauce is what makes it. I highly recommend getting two sauces just to try them. We had the hot barbeque and the ranch tonight. The hot barbeque is impressive to say the least. You get a nice solid Smokey taste with a fun kick afterwords. 4 stars because they give a next to gross amount of fries. I can imagine people loving that but it was a bit too much for us.
Stopped by just to try this place out because of the great Yelp reviews... I must say everyone was right! If you see this place try it!! You won't be disappointed.. Amazing taste.. 2 thumbs up..
One of the best local places, they serve big and juicy pieces! And not to mention their fries! They might be a bit thin but they're really good and taste fresh.

I don't like sauces normally, but I like their sauces. Really fresh chicken, though it seems like they don't season the batter at all because they rely on the sauces for flavor.   Try the cajun with fresh parm!

Stopped in after going out to Hoover Dam and it was really good. I like that the place had an old feel to it. Everyone was very friendly and they greeted us before we walked in. I ordered the #4 which is the wing and tender combo. The chicken wasn't over fried and had a good flavor to it. You can definitely tell that the tenders were fresh and not the ones that come out of a bag. I had the honey habanero sauce and it was very good. I'm not a big fan of the shoestring fries but these were really good. They didn't taste like chips and they give you plenty. The price for the meal was well worth it. Keep it up!

The place is called chicken shack... so they should have amazing finger-licking good chicken right? Meh. I left a little disappointed. I ordered the chicken strips which I found were overly dry. The strips were large with a lot of meat to them and not too much breading which I liked, however the pieces were just too dry overall.   I will give it to them that they have every dipping sauce you can think of and then some. So I liked the choices there. And extra points because their French fries are awesome! Thin and crispy and perfect to munch on.

You come here for the chicken, however, you will be disappointed if you need a clean setting to eat. The food is nice, where the chicken is juicy and breaded with a nice crisp. My favorite sauce Is this sweet chili. I ask for it on the side, because I like to dip it. The fries are shoe string, but a much better quality than fast food joints. It's crunchy but still has a good amount of potato innards. The main problem I see about the chicken shack is how so many people come, dine in, and go that the workers have no time to clean. They are too busy cooking abd taking orders. Therefore, crumbs are everywhere, no clean tables, and trash cans get filled. I recommend then for take out. If you dine in, you could actually wipe your table using Pattie towels and their fountain water.   Anyways, the pros outweigh the cleanliness con. Go try it!
This is my favorite lunch joint in Vegas. Sevice is super fast! Sometimes I receive my food before I finish filling my drink cup. The chicken fingers are amazing!

This was my first time eating here tonight! I read other reviews that complained about the size of the place, and it is small, but it's called My Chicken Shack, not My Chicken Palace. The name suits the size.   It was busy when I went tonight, but not too cramped and they definitely had a good amount of tables for groups to sit at. I waited maybe 5 minutes in line before I ordered; they had only one register from what I could see. There were a lot funny phrases playing with the "Why did the chicken cross the road?" question all around on the walls though that entertained me while I waited to order.   When I reached the counter, the worker was friendly and provided recommendations of popular sauces to have for my wings. There are definitely a lot of options to suit everyone's preference. I ended up ordering 6 of his recommended Honey BBQ and 6 of my personal choice of Medium. The Honey BBQ was good! I could have done without the Medium though, it was whatever.   I ordered the 10 piece chicken fingers with Chipotle BBQ sauce for my boyfriend and was asked if this order was for one person. When I said yes, I was warned about the size of the chicken fingers and that it might be too much for just one person. I decided to stick with it but.. damn, he was right! Those things are huge!!! I thought the fingers were better than the wings too, honestly.   They only have one size option for drinks too, and it's probably the equivalent to most places' small size. I didn't dine in but it looked like you could have unlimited refills, at least.   I had high expectations for this place considering how busy it always looks from the outside. I'm not sure these expectations were met, though. It was good - don't get me wrong - but I was expecting it to be the most amazing chicken I have ever had and I think my hopes were a bit too high.   Rating is really a 3.5 but giving them the benefit of a 4. I would go back, but only now and then.

First off I want to start off with is customer service is great, young lady had a smile on her face,was open to any questions we had as well.   Ok so I'm not sure if it's just me, but Breaded wings just don't do it for me. I just went for a simple wing craving, but left very unsatisfied. Didn't really think they were fresh wings either.   I have forever been looking for a place where they serve lemon pepper wings that's a sauce instead of a rub. Which I was led to believe they had it here because under sauces lemon pepper was right underneath.  The breading  of the wings took to much of the flavor from the lemon pepper. Also they were a bit too dry as well.  If you're a person who digs the breading by all means. But I think I'll stick to Wingstop and Buffalo wild wings for my wing cravings.

Read the reviews from this place a couple weeks ago and got excited, and as usual...I was let down!!! I never like to review a place after one visit anymore, so I gave it a couple chances. Fail fail fail.   To succeed in business, you need great customer service. This place does not have it. After reading on their website that they close at 9pm, I get in my car around 7:45pm to travel 11 miles to this place. I arrive around 8:15pm. It's a family of four head of me in line. The guy behind the register is preparing some take out orders and never acknowledged them. They had enough with the waiting, and the lady says she's ready to order. His response? "Oh we're closed". What the hell are you talking about you're closed? He says "we close at 8:30 and its 8:31". I couldn't believe what I was seeing or hearing! If the customer is inside before those doors are locked? You're still open for them!!! The lady and her family angrily walk out, and I do the same. What made me even more mad??? I get to my car and see that it's only 8:24pm!!! The boy was straight up lying to our faces!!!  I told myself that I was done with that place, but because of such high remarks on yelp, I wanted to try the food. Decided to go back the weekend after, early in the day, so I can see if the hype was real. Ordered 3 wings, 3 tenders and fries. Back in college, I worked for KFC... So I know exactly what old fryer oil looks like when used on chicken, and what it smells like. Old oil (reused or not changed) will make your chicken darker, and make it taste funny. This was the case with Chicken Shack. Absolutely nasty. Fries were soggy and lacking taste. It was so bad that it prompted me to go online to find out who owns this place. Whoever you are...we need to speak.   You served me a trash worthy product. Get it together. Will not return.

My boyfriend and I come here every once in a while for chicken tenders. We would come here everyday but unfortunately it's across town from us but when we are on this side of town we come here. Well this visit was different because I ordered chicken wings instead of chicken tenders! Their chicken wings were a game changer. I will never order anything else but their chicken wings. They are so damn good like you can't go to any other fried chicken ever again because they are that good! They are buttermilk battered and fried just like the tenders. But they seriously taste like miniature fried chicken! Omg.... Drool. I've literally been trying to find a fried chicken place and now I can finally stop looking. Chicken Shack won. They won all the awards. I don't care what anyone says. Man like after I finished my meal I wished I had another basket of wings...  Another thing though, their service was spot on seriously. We went in there at peak lunch time. People clocked out for lunch and headed over here. The line was basically out the door. But they were so fast and efficient it was amazing to watch them work. We literally ordered, got our drinks, haven't even sat down for a minute and our food was already ready. Talk about fast food. And that was literally everyone's orders too. They barely sat down and their food was already done. It was piping hot and their portions are always generous. They always give you extra. My boyfriend ordered a 3 finger combo and they gave him 2 extra tenders. He almost mad that he got extra tenders because he couldn't eat it all haha. Chicken shack is always the best choice for chicken tenders and wings.
I used to crave this place, last two visits the chicken has been tougher and on the dryer side. Not sure if they changed the type of chicken or it's the cook.

Nice little joint you guys got here tucked away in a plaza off of East Sunset Road.  I ordered the number 1 combination which consists of 6 Wings, Fries, and a Drink for 8.29 plus tax. I chose chipotle honey barbeque sauce for the wings which has a nice combination of sweet and spicy. The wings themselves has a slight breading on it which gives it more of a crunch to its crispiness.  As for the fries, SHOESTRING! I dont think I have had shoestring fries that good in a long time. If anything, I would go out on a limb and say it was even better than the wings! I can only fantasize how good their chili cheese fries might be.   They also have chicken strips, burgers, and a salad with your choice of grilled or fried chicken.   Now for the downers. Their prices are bit high for your basic chicken wings. The biggest thing I think that doesnt make sense is that they dont serve you any sauces with your wings like ranch, blue cheese, etc. Of course you can have your choice of dipping sauce but only if you wanna pay extra. Also if you want veggies like celery or carrots, that is also a separate charge. WHAT? When you think of wings, you see a plate or basket full of wings, fries, veggies and dipping sauce. That right there is perfection. I can think of many other places that give you dipping sauces and veggies included with your meal or at least free when you ask for it.   With everything mentioned, mostly good and a little bit of bad, this warrants 4 stars. To the owners, if you are reading this, a little bit of sauce and veggies goes a long way.

Fucking excellent! This chicken is fucking delicious! So Crispy and no grisly pieces!!! The guy at the counter totally help with anything I needed, this was my first time here and felt so welcome as he helped me decide what I wanted. I'll definitely be back!
I'm giving 4 stars only for the wings, they are very good. Especially in Habanero Honey sauce !
Their chicken fingers with the fry sauce are absolutely incredible. Definitely favorite chicken/fries combo in town. Quick, convenient, and filling... & super affordable!

It's really, really good. And it's consistently good. I've been here no less than 10 times over the past year, and my orders are always done within a few minutes.  The chicken is seasoned and juicy. You get to choose your flavor of sauce. The portions are generous. I always am given an extra tender and tons of fries.   I can't believe I've been going to Canes all this time.  In-restaurant dining can get crowded. They don't have a lot of space to meet the demand. Tables are full of paper towels which is much better than napkins. Drinks are small.

So disappointing. Service is exceptionally slow. How does it take 10+ minutes to put chicken and fries in a box, with 5+ people working, when I'm the only person there? I even gave this location a second chance hoping that the slow service the first time was a fluke. Nope.  Please learn best practices from the Sunset/GV Pkwy location, where I have my order by the time I'm done filling up my drink, where I am always given an extra tender, and the fries and chicken are actually seasoned.
GREAT wings.  Big and greasy and juicy.  An order of six wings, fries and a drink could easily feed two.  A new favorite when funds are low and we are visiting.

5 stars for a fast food place. Clean, great service and price. The chicken sandwich has 3 chicken fingers. Fries were crispy and delicious. I came here on the way to willow beach AZ. Salads are big and there is lots of different dressings to choose from.

Great food. The atmosphere is pretty relax. They also brought some grilled chicken out for our dog. Good stuff will definitely be back every time we're doing a lake day.  The staff is really nice. Really clean spot for the age of the building. The workers sure show their pride with their job. Good to know there's good employees here. Keep up the great job guys. Definitely going to be a regular when we're around.
I've been coming here for 5 years. Food and service has always been good and the owners really are cordial. Feels like family almost. You HAVE to try the lemon pepper!
Always great food! Fingers tender, wings delicious. Staff friendly and nice. Great local place to come especially on our way to the movies.
The. Best. Chicken. Also, their ranch is off the wall good, and they have every sauce you could think of. So great. The service is always good. I'll keep coming back for years to come.

You instantly get the warmth of a small business as soon as you enter. The lady at the register treated each person like a distinguished guess (mom in the back was even nice). The menu is simple but the sauces are packed with all kinds of awesomeness. I went with the plain wings with hot teriyaki and sweet chili on the side. The fries were shoestring cut, fried to perfection, and flavored with fun.   I really dig this place and cant wait to go back. I NEED MORE SAUCE!!!
Good homemade chicken strips they were bigger then expected! A lot of seasonings and dip kids loved it!
Phone order your food ahead of time.. The batter they use for the wings here are amazing!

Driving back to Phoenix from Vegas and decided to stop and try it after reading the reviews on Yelp. So glad we did... the food was delicious! Chicken fingers were juicy and perfectly crispy. Chicken wings were huge and cooked perfectly. Shoe string fries were crunchy but soft on the inside. Portions were very large. Service was great and we were greeted right away. We will definitely keep this place on our list of places to eat every time we travel to Vegas.

I don't know where some of these bad reviews about the chicken being dry and such but I guess they changed things up cause my chicken fingers were thick and juicy and yes I would say they are waaay better than Caine's. The staff was very nice and I would come back here again!

The chicken was great!! If you like Raising Canes, you'll love Chicken Shack! It's like a more homemade canes with more variety on the menu. I expected the food to take a little longer to be prepared than Canes, but it was actually brought out to me extremely fast.  Not only is the food great, the service is excellent. I had Eddie as a cashier and he was very friendly and helpful. He brought the food to our table and even came by to check up on us and asked how everything was knowing it was our first time there! He was kind and courteous to even the children in the restaurant no matter how busy it got! That guy would be an excellent waiter.  I will definitely be returning to chicken shack for the tasty chicken fingers, bomb sauces, and friendly employees.  ALSO I LOVE THEIR CRISPY SHOE STRONG FRENCH FRIES!!! I prefer these to crinkle cut fries any day!
The best chicken in town!! And it's still a mom and pop shop!! Love it and the super friendly service!! You eat here once u will comeback for more!! Guaranteed
The food is exceptional and priced right. Must try when in Henderson! Try the Chili. A great selection of sauces to choose from. Great staff.

This is my go to place for Chicken wings in Las Vegas!  It took me a while to find a great wing place, as sadly Vegas does not have many, but when I found this place I was hooked!   First and foremost they have sweet tea!  For me this is a big win as I grew up in the south and sweet tea is the House Wine for any southerner.  And yes there is a major difference between making sweet tea and taking a sugar packet and adding it to unsweetened tea! hahahaha  The quality of it can very.  Sometimes it is great and other times it is not. But hey I am in Vegas so I cant be too picky lol  As far the chicken wings they are HUGE!  Much larger then a normal wing.  Not sure where they get the chicken from but the chickens must have a weight room and spent the day bulking up.  The wings are pretty tasty and fried well.  6 wings here is definitely a good size meal.    The sauces vary in good to OK.  After trying a multitude of them I have settled on the Hot BBQ and the Hot Teriyaki.  I like the heat that both provide along with the balanced taste of the BBQ Sauce and Teriyaki sauce.   I am not a huge fan of the Lemon Pepper as it can tend to be on the really salty side along with being a dry rub.  The past couple of times I have been they have added new flavors.  This is always nice to see as it shows they are experimenting with new things.  I always make it a point to try the newest ones.  They can usually be found on the chalk board next to the register.   The fingers are also really good and they have meals that are reasonably priced.  They come with fries and a drink!  The fires are also a plus as they are on the thinner side.  I would recommend trying the fry sauce with them.    The decor is all based on the joke why did the chicken cross the road.  If you dine in or are waiting for your food they are pretty entertaining to read.  They also have some TVs and a little outside seating.  Overall it is a small space so not a ton of seating.    I would call there style of wings pretty standard, nothing fancy, just wings fried and served tossed in pretty typical choices.  If you have never been I would give it a whirl as it is much better then most of the places that sell wings here in Vegas.

We arrived a bit early to see Mad Max at the Galaxy Luxury Theater, so we decided to find something to munch on to kill the next hour. We found a few places nearby on Yelp! and saw the solid reviews for The Chicken Shack and decided to check it out!  What i liked...  - Had an order of chicken wings and an order of chicken fingers, serving size was generous and both the wings and fingers were plump and meaty! I like! - they do give you a generous portion of ranch sauce, but if you wish to have an additional or different sauce there is an extra charge for that - Beer on tap for decent prices, especially compared to what you will get at the movie theater. - very fun and chill atmosphere with the 90's music playing and funny little phrases adorning the walls plus a ton of license plates and other unique little things - Service was pretty quick, and they were pretty busy when we were in there  What I didn't like...  - tables were not very clean. Having someone just wipe the tables down between customers would make a big difference - customer service was spotty. Some of the guys were very friendly while others would barely speak  - this place is very small and when it gets busy, it can feel cramped quickly   Others items to note..  - their soda fountain consists of Pepsi products - this seems to be a very popular spot for the high school/college aged crowd. Nothing wrong with that. Merely an observation. Lots of "dude", "man", and "bro"'s were being flung about recklessly.  I really am so back and forth between 3 or 4 stars on this place. The wings were nice and plump, but lacked any kind of seasoning or flavoring. The chicken meat on the fingers were excellent! I will definitely be back to try out more menu items and snag some more of those chicken fingers! After a couple more visits, I could easily see myself bumping this up to 4 stars. For now though, I like the Chicken Shack, but it's just..  A-OK.  3 stars.

We love the tenders and the salty fries. It's the sauces that make it 5 stars for our family.   It would be great if they power washed the outdoor tables. They are grilled and so can't be wiped clean.
Great wings and a huge selection of sauces that are amazing. Little bit tight for inside seating though.
My go to place to have chicken and fries! The staff is very friendly and even the smallest combo is very filling! I always take friends from out of town here.

This is possibly one of the nastiest wing places I've ever been to in my entire life I tried a different location the first time which was also gross so I decided to give another location a chance...EPIC FAIL! Food is super bland, and dry...if you can mess up wings, you just shouldn't cook anything period. HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT AND WASTE OF MONEY!

The wings were really good but the customer service left something to be desired. It was my first time going there and the cashier had no patience when I was ordering my meal. While deciding on my options the cashier rudely remarked "Well I guess you don't like answering questions". The experience left me very frustrated. Next time I will pass on this place and go somewhere I can enjoy my meal and my ordering experience.
Best chicken in town !!!! I always get the #2 with baked beans. Bomb chicken tenders and chicken wings. Customer service is on point as well thanks guys keep it up

On HWY 93 your way to Hoover Dam I'd recommend stoping your auto for some fresh mouth watering fried chicken. We stopped for a quick lunch and boy we're we're thrilled by The Chicken Shack.   After perusing the menu for a moment we ordered several tasty items. I ordered a small chili, 6 wings w/fries basket and chicken strips. Now your probably asking yourself why would you order chili, well simple answer cause its gems like this happen when u least expect it. And that was damn good chili ! Chili is definitely a worthy item to order, its meaty & full of beans and topped with onions & sour cream. As for the chicken portion of my order well this place didn't disappoint me on the bird. Wings were moist and battered with some really tasty spicing. I got mine plain, however you have many flavor options to add to the mix.  These strips were like no ordinary strips, they were sensational all white meat pieces and really thick ( two finger sized ). You really didn't need sauce but what the heck I used anyways. Make your own choice this is America!  You must stop for a bucket of wings if not your insane. I'll roll back in next time I'm in Boulder City for another order.

My son & his friends LOVE chicken shack so I decided to give it a try. It is a very busy place so they must be doing something right. My biggest complaint is how small the place is. I was placing an order to go, the counter to order is in the back, there is a 4 top on the left & the soda dispenser on the right. I have an 18 month old & had her with me. So trying to not have her grabbing or hitting the people at the table & not play with the soda machine left VERY LITTLE room. I was in the way of staff coming from the back to hand out orders & for people trying to get refills. We finally get to the counter & I asked a few questions making it obvious it was my 1st visit. I place an order for 24 lemon pepper wings & a garlic Parmesan fingers meal. I pay & turn around to go wait & there's nowhere to go. They was 3 people in line behind me 2 other people waiting for their to go orders & 2 people trying to get refills. SO CROWDED. I finally get out of the way & go to wait at a 2 top, the only open table. My order didn't take to long. I get home w it & unpack it & there was no sauce for anything, wings, fingers or fries. I'm assuming now it's something you order as well. That would've been nice to know.    Now the food itself, it was very good. The chicken was cooked to perfection & the fries were great. We will go back but try different flavored, the lemon pepper was good, garlic Parmesan needs more garlic & Parmesan. We'll also be sure to ask for sauces!

Leaving Vegas we were looking for a quick place to eat but didn't want McDonald's, Taco Bell, etc. The outside looked a little sketchy with yellow caution tape in the parking lot so we kept driving. There were cars in the lot so decided to pull over and check the reviews. After reading a few positive reviews we made a u-turn and went back. It was by far the best chicken strips I've ever eaten. Big, juicy, tender white meat with lots of yummy sauces to choose from. I got the 3 wings, 3 strips & fries with a drink for $8. Worth every penny!

I've been to the other location. This one is much cleaner. The service is excellent. The food is prepared to order, hot and delicious.  I have been there five times already and they havent even been open a month.  I wish them great success!  Just hope they dont turn it into a LOUD SPORTS RELATED experience cause I like to be able to hear my conversation with friends when we visit. That would stop me dead in my tracks from coming back.

Love me some chicken shack. My boyfriend introduced me to this place recently and it was so damn good! I had the fingers and fries basket, the chicken was super tender and the honey BBQ i got for it was so good. Small place but it was comfortable and the staff was helpful.
The chicken was undercooked and it was way too chewy! A waste of money and no one liked it. For some odd reason, the mild tasted sweet.
Great sauces. Good fries. Bland chicken if you're not getting a wet sauce added to the chicken wings or tenders.  The staff was friendly, the place clean, and once again.... the fries were AWESOME.
First time ever at this place and i love chicken so i lovebthis place gokd food will be back soon just doen the street from me

They are doing a decent job. It is not easy to duplicate a successful franchise and if they keep at it it will be as good as the Vegas location.   Might be a good idea to mute sports on the TV's and play mainstream music at a tolerable level instead of blaring the annoying TV network blather they have had on the last three times I was in there.  I suggest they stay on top of cleaning the frying oil, be extra vigilante on the chicken suppliers and freshness....and do their best not to freeze chicken if they don't have to. I can't wait for the beer license!

Almost didn't stop because they have Pepsi instead of Coke but we are so thankful that we did! This place is amazing! Best chicken fingers I've ever had! French fries are also absolutely amazing definitely some of the best french fries I have ever ate.  I am so thankful we stopped at this place!  The staff here is excellent, super friendly!  Try the habanero honey mixed with ranch sauce!  Yummy!!!   Fry Sauce is a must!!

This review is truly a 3.5, BUT everyone knows how I feel about good service and they had it. I could really make this one short and sweet. Better quality chicken than wing stop or b-dubs, not better sauces. Similar concept, but more mom and pop style instead of chain food. To me you can taste the freshness, which made up for the "just so-so" garlic parm flavor. Also tried spicy teriyaki and I expected more spice. The spicy ranch however was AMAZING. I think their dips are up to par if not better than the rest. I upped it to 4 also because I haven't tried all the sauces yet, and I will for sure return based on quality N service.  Another good local Hendo spot! Check!

This place is down the street from me so I decided to try it. The fries are scrumptious, thin & crispy the best! The fingers are large, the sauces are yummy! It could use a real good cleaning inside, but it is, what it is and for a yummy quick bite to eat, I like it! I have to try some other items next time! I will be back.

This place is amazing. Such a great atmosphere. It's in a good location usually busy but they are quick with your order and always on point. The guy usually at the counter taking orders is super friendly and nice. Every item on the menu is delicious and original!! Recommend this place to everyone!! They should totally expand!!

We love love love Chicken Shack, especially the fries!  This location is fast and their staff is friendly. The indoor seating is limited and usually full but they have some outdoor seating as well. Food is always fresh and great!
All I can say is WOW! The chicken is fresh and hand-battered and my husband raved about the fries. We will definitely be back in to have more when we go west.

If I eat any more of their strips, I will grow feathers.  This unassuming small eatery has great strips.  I am the kind of person that tries to eat things I wouldn't normally cook, and chicken strips is one of those  things on my "don't buy it if you can cook it" foods.  I gave in to my hubby's begging to try this place one day after work.  We drove from the southwest to Henderson just for these strips, and I told him, "these better be awesome for the trip."  Fortunately, he was right--the strips are awesome.  They are huge (I'm wondering what size these chickens are) and juicy.  Their coating is great and the sauces are wonderful.  I love their shoestring fries, but I was honed in to those strips and downed three on my own.  I even gave the wings a try, and they are quite tasty.    Overall, a great place to stop for some chicken.  I will drive down to Henderson just for these strips despite a closer competitor.  They're awesome.
Fresh chicken fingers, love the fries and the sauce .  The dining area could be bigger and lately we've had to wash the tables ourselves (employees seem to forget to do it when the customer leaves)
I love the Chicken Shack! The food is amazing and the atmosphere is great all the staff seems to be pretty knowledgeable and very attentive!
Passing through from Vegas and so glad that we stopped in. Great burgers and chicken strips. Add the nice owners and you've got a place that we'll come back to
A lot of food for the money. Thoroughly enjoyed my chicken strips and dipping sauces. I'm from California, so when I'm in Vegas, I make sure I stop here for the strips!

This place is packed and it seems like they have a real loyal following.  I got the wings and fingers combo and i definitely like the wings more as they were super crispy, tasty, and enjoyed the variety of sauces they provided.  The fingers were good but I prefer canes.   Good size portions and great value.   They serve a few things but they do it well.  I'll def be back when I'm on this side of town and have a craving
The best chicken fingers I've ever had! Very juicy/ moist white meaty! Chicken! Had the damn hot sauce on the side! I personally give it a complete hands down!
Great customer service. All the staff had a smile on their faces not to mention the food is awesome!! Will be coming back

This place never disappoints. The chicken is awesome. The fries are great. They have a ton of sauces to choose from. What more can someone ask for?  Around lunch, this place is jammed full of people and for good reason. The service is fast, and the food is always good. I often try different sauces on the menu, but my favorite, so far, has been the Hot BBQ.   Try this place if you're looking for great chicken fingers, wings, or a chicken sandwich. They also have burgers, but I haven't tried one yet.   The prices are so reasonable that it's hard to believe. The portions are larger than the price one pays.

We were just passing through and the yelp reviews lead us here. We ordered two kids meals, one # 2 and a chicken sandwich meal. They forgot to ring up my chicken sandwich meal and offered to make it when they brought the rest of the food to the table and we realized it was missing. I declined and am glad I did because that was more than enough food for the five of us. The fries are thin crispy and amazing! Seriously they just became the bar that all other fries are measured to. The chicken tasted good and was juicy but the coating wasn't very crispy. This just became my go to spot to stop on the way from Utah to Arizona. (No pictures of the food because one of my kids was on my phone.)
Very delicious...very friendly staff and the garlic parmesean chicken fingers are to do for!

What an awesome spot to eat.  Super clean with a friendly staff not to mention incredible food.  The burgers are perfect and the chicken is amazing.  The take out service is super fast and they make sure you get everything you need. The Chicken Shack is the perfect go to for lunch and dinner.

Had the 3 piece combo. Quality of product is excellent, chicken is tender and juicy, fries excellent as well. All came out hot and fresh. Service was exceptional-you can tell the ownership cares about their customers and the quality of their product. Highly recommend this location!

A must try for every fried chicken lover. Generous portion, crunchy/tender delicious chicken, and an amazing sauce selection. Try the fry, "damn" hot, and spicy ranch sauces. Fries are crispy and salty scrumptious.

A must try for every fried chicken lover. Generous portion, crunchy/tender delicious chicken, and an amazing sauce selection. Try the fry, "damn" hot, and spicy ranch sauces. Fries are crispy and salty scrumptious.

First time. Picked up chicken strips and chili for lunch. Got the 5 piece chicken. Very good. I prefer traditional fried chicken with a good crust and bones...but this was excellent. At first I thought $7.00+ for a 'large' chili might be a bit too much...it didn't seem all that 'large'. But when I got it back to the office I was so impressed with the quality that the $$$$ seemed fair (you get what you pay for someone once said). Very good -- with beans -- but they are minimal. All in all it was great quality, and excellent, friendly service. Can't wait to try the wings and some of the sides.

I love Chicken Shack! The chicken and fries are delicious. My husband and I have ordered a regular/large fry and usually (I forget the exact amount) 8-10 tenders to share and it was plenty. We have been here twice, and I am a fan. The only thing is both times the service was ok. I felt like an outsider intruding or bothering the workers. If I asked a question I was kind of given a quick short answer like I should already know all this and be ready to go. I had to laugh but agree on the other reviewers comments of "dont ask for a water cup!" I legitimately drink water some times with my meals.

Been coming here for years, and service has reached such a low that I feel compelled to write a review about it. But first, the food:  The food is okay. People writing reviews about "omg best chicken ever!" are probably comparing it to McDonalds chicken nuggets. The tenders are fairly dry and the wings are not much better. Their BBQ sauce is actually pretty decent but the other ones I've had (ranch and bleu cheese) are bad.   The crux of my review is the customer service. A bad experience will sour my entire meal, no matter how good the food is. I feel like the owners have an ongoing contest to see how rudely their cashier can treat their customers while still staying in business. Every single time I come in I get the stink eye and get attitude from the cashiers. I mostly ignore it because my mom loves to get the food here so I bring her here, but after the way I was treated today I will absolutely not be coming back.

I have passed by this great small business numerous times this past few months.  I probably would have never stopped had it not been for the guides at Flightlinez telling me how much they loved this place.  We were on our way back from the Railroad Tunnel Hike and of course really hungry.  We pulled into the lot which reminds me of Sonic.  I at first thought it was a car hop place but that was just the way the parking is set up.   I imagine it used to be a car hop place years ago.      The inside is small with just a few tables.  It was clean but had the disarray look about it.  The young lady who took our order was really nice.  We took a couple of minutes to figure out what we wanted and she had showed great patience with us.  I was glad no one was behind us.  We choose medium wings, chicken strips, fires and a large chili to go. Our order came out super quick which was great!       The chicken strips were pretty large and a couple of them with fries where a meal.  The fries were shoestring size and really tasty.  We ordered a small fries but they filled the container they came in.   We got the garlic parmesan sauce and honey habanero to dip our strip in.  They were both very good and unique.  The Honey Habanero kind of sneaks up on you and was on the hot side but not above the heat line so every dip was a good as the first.  The Wings were for the wife who loved them.  I got here medium in heat and she said they were great but wanted the hot next time.      The chili was really good and had lots of meat.  It had a few beans in it which I prefer.  Meat was the main item which was pretty impressive.  The chicken strips had a light breading coating.  Unlike other places where breading is the main part that is not the case here.  The breading was tasty and the big meaty strips were awesome.  We bought 10 strips and 12 wings and it was 2 meals for the 3 of us.  Great food and a good price - what more could you ask for.  Thanks Flightlinez team for sharing this Gem with me!
Great chicken great fries. A lot of cool sauces to choose from. The stag was cool and helpful for being a first timer to the place. Would recommend

I tried the damn hot wings at a friends house recently and thought it would be something my boyfriend would like so I drove all the way there from summerlin. I ordered 25 wings but the cashier told me they can't do more than 5 damn hot when you do an order of 25. I found that to be odd but didn't really care so I proceeded to order other flavors to total 25. The cashier was nice and offered to give me an additional 5 sauces of damn hot since it was my first time in there. My name was called when my food was ready and I grabbed the large bag that they said was my food and I noticed another large bag next mine and asked if that was with my order. The cashier said "no this is hers" (the lady next to me) so I took my bag and left then proceeded to drive all the way back to summerlin. I get home to find out that they gave me the wrong sauces and the worst part of it all is that I didn't even get the Damn hot sauces that I went there for. Highly frustrating. I couldn't even confirm my order because they took my receipt and gave it to another employee instead of me for some reason. Overall the wings are decent especially when you get what you ordered but the staff needs to get their shit together. If you like getting your order right, order small and double check it. Apparently 4 or 5 different sauces is too much to handle.

Good food but store closes early? Showed up saturday night 10 minutes before closing.employee had the door open moping telling my self and another customer they closed at 8:30.the other customer said he phoned down and a staff member said they closed at 9! I personally went down because yelped told me it closed at 9! Whats going on?
They're very slow.  Canes is better and right across the street.  Lol Dairy Queen is a few feet away, get tenders there!

We were recommended this place and since we were on that side of town, we decided to try it. It's in one of those strip mall centers on the corner of Sunset Road. The reviews about this place being small are correct. There are only 6-4 top tables and 3-Deuce tables. The decor and cleanliness is very fitting for the name as it did remind me of a shack with it being small and had that "dirty" look. I'm not sure if it was the floor color or what but, you can decide from the pictures. I couldn't get the whole place because there were obviously people in here.We ordered the 5Finger,fries and drink combo, 10 Fingers and a 3 Finger & 3 Finger,fries and drink combo which all totaled about $30. From the reviews, I was excited to try it because my ultimate Favorite is still Raising Canes even over Chic-Fil-A... have yet to try PDQ. I must say that I was not impressed. The fingers were bland and the fries tasted like straight oil. Perhaps our chicken would've had flavor if I didn't ask for sauce on the side(another tip I got off of here) but, even with the sauce on top, I'm sorry but, it still only qualifies for a ranking of 3stars. On a good note, the fingers are a very good size hence, the reason why I'm giving 3 stars and not 2. I would be willing to give a 5 if this place were bigger, cleaner and tastier.

These wings are delicious! We had wings with a variety of sauces. The hot honey garlic is sweet and spicy. Lemon pepper is regular and the chipotle barbeque is also tasty. The best thing about these wings, served piping hot, is that that are delicious without sauce.   The shoestring fries are crisp and will seasoned.   The star was lost because the hamburger was over cooked. My 10 year old wouldn't eat it so you know it's bad. Still, this is the chicken shack and not the burger shack. Who orders a burger at a wing place?  Get here.

I'd have have to say, this is probably my favorite place to eat in Boulder City. I can't get enough of it. Much better than the Henderson location, the chicken is never dry, the fries are always hot, and the staff are awesomely friendly. It's my favorite place to go have a bite before the Eagles' football games. I live 40 minutes away from BC, and I'll make the drive, just to eat at Chicken Shack!!

This is our go to spot after a fun day on the boat! The portions are so huge my husband and I usually share a 5 piece. They usually always give you an extra piece of chicken so it's really a 6 piece. Don't forget to get a stamp card!

This was our first time trying The Chicken Shake and we loved everything. The Chicken was nice and juicy, the sides were great especially the beans. The best sauce is the spicy honey garlic, it was a favorite for all of us.

A young Rex...a young taught schoolboy Rex...was once a star athlete. I was good at all of the sports the other boys wished they were. I was great at shooting dice, 3 Card Monty, pick pocketing and loan sharking. I was the envy of my entire 3rd grade class. Very few kids that age can play the shell game on a street corner for 8 hours and then kneecap some deadbeat over a 20 dollar debt at night.  I was a machine...a well oiled, tight bodied machine. The girls...oh the girls...nap time was a special time. A young Rex surrounded by his prepubescent harem.  It was magical. I was on top of the world.  My aunt Eunice would see me come back with some old man's pension check, because he owed 3 weeks of the vig after betting on the Giants, she would beam with pride.  We would go to our special place...and then he would take me for food. I deserved it...believe me. She would buy me fried chicken. I loved it. It washed out the taste of low tide. Bribe sweet bribe. Bribed my silence.  As an older man I look back on those days and still cringe. Sure the money was good. Sure the chicken was good. The rest...not so much.  I tell this tale of woe and want for one reason...all of that great chicken was almost blotted out of existence from a combination of court ordered therapy, LSD, electroshock, and Kenny G Therapy...my own creation...not for the week of heart.  I discuss it in detail in "Kenny G: How the Devil Gave Us Therapy."  Those great chicken dinners would be lost to the recesses of my mind...just flickering images...like the ones I see of me standing on top of a building, naked, wearing a beer hat and smoking a cigar...images of meaningful nonsense. That was until I went to the Chicken Shack. Oh, sweet Chicken Shack. Let me hold you. Let me kiss you. Let me call you aunt...wait...never mind.  Chicken Shack does what it does...and it does it amazingly! Chicken Shack chicken is never frozen. The breasts and the wings are huge...like Busty Dusty big. Ah, memories...I almost suffocated at a club in Pittsburgh once.   The 5 strip lunch/dinner is more than enough for the biggest eater.  It comes with fries and a drink for under 8 bucks.  Fountain drink for unlimited soda. I saw these two huge fat guys mowing down a 5 piece. They looked full. They looked content. They looked like they had hypertension. God Bless America. The wings are excellent but I recommend the strips. More meat. Tender. Juicy. Delicious. Same price.   The sauces. The sauces are key to a place like this. Like having weed on you when trying to sleep with Jennifer Aniston. Mandatory.  Well, Chicken Shack doesn't disappoint. Recently I had the special Habenero Honey. It was sweet. It was hot. It hurt a little bit after 4 pieces. It hurt the good way...like being dumped by Amanda Peet...that body can only keep you happy for a long time...then you are just praying for a stroke.  The BBQ sauce is excellent. The Garlic Parmesan sauce is absolutely amazing. The chili lime isn't very good, sorry. Too limey...like Hugh Grant.   If chicken isn't your thing...then you think that Rex will tear into you for going to THE CHICKEN SHACK...but no...not at all...they have a burger there that is amazing. A single. A double. A triple. You can add cheese and bacon. Yes...triple cheese and bacon.  Oh is it good...it's really good. I ate it. I cried. I ate it again. I cried harder. I threw a chair out the window. I ran.   They have an all you can eat chicken wing and 1 dollar beers. If that doesn't sound good to you then you are a loser. I say that with no hesitation. No remorse. No second guessing. You are the type of person who would hold up a bank but leave the stuff in the safe.  The atmosphere is great. They have funny slogans on the wall. Cute. Sickeningly cute. Rex is sarcastic. Rex hates it. Others will love it.  The bottom line is that this is obviously a family place run by people who actually care. Rex is very happy to find a local business that prides itself on quality and building an ongoing local relationship with customers. Nice owners. Great food. Local. Cheap. Quality.   When Rex dies please batter and deep fry him. He deserves the honor. Take a bite. Take a big bite. You love the way hate tastes.

These Wings Are Straight Fire!!! I had the Sweet Chili Wings n the Creamy Garlic Parmesan Wings! The Small fry could be shared w/3-4ppl! The wings are a little pricey but you get what you pay for! Definitely worth Every Penny!!!
Believe this is my second or third review on this restaurant and I'm telling you right now they make some darn good chicken always a smile and a good service thank you gentlemen and ladies

Chicken Shack.  I'll keep you my dirty little secret. Don't tell anyone.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/aqwn3jdQLCWnb59gHK4nAw?select=RdNqQUC1ycmedKx6NWD0Rg#YUmHZ0Wy3sIY5w6H0OZDKw  Who has to know?  Best fingers. Best fries. That's all you need to know.
chicken wings are very good, tenders are okay. Good sauces (especially garlic honey), great fries. Good service.

A huge amount of food for a relatively cheap price. But the tenders we had were on the dry side. I'll have to give this place another try and see if they redeem themselves. If it's good enough for chumlee, it's good enough for me

Not too impressed, I ordered a 5 piece tenders and large chili fries. The strips were large but the chicken lacked flavor but luckily the sauces saved the day I got the creamy garlic parmesan sauce and honey mustard they were really good, tasted homemade, and definitely made with love. The large chili fries can feed two people or one very hungry person. The chili didn't really taste that good and the fries did not taste fresh. I am definitely sticking with canes for chicken tenders.  Maybe someday in the future I will stop by and order wings, maybe that is their specialty.

I love the chicken Shack the food is really good and is always hot and fresh!!! I come in all the time to the location in henderson. The young man at the counter is always so nice! I just like the chicken wings with ranch. I get the wings with hot buffalo sauce. My bkyfriend gets the hot bbq.  I wish the to go didnt come in Styrofoam thats my only pet peeve because it makes tje friws hard to eat

I love the chicken Shack the food is really good and is always hot and fresh!!! I come in all the time to the location in henderson. The young man at the counter is always so nice! I just like the chicken wings with ranch. I get the wings with hot buffalo sauce. My bkyfriend gets the hot bbq.  I wish the to go didnt come in Styrofoam thats my only pet peeve because it makes tje friws hard to eat. The food and atmosphere is always great. This place is always busy so the food ia just on point.

Ow I love it when I have to work in Boulder city bc it's an excuse to come by here!! They have amazing chicken wings and nice things crispy fries. The wings are fried really crispy then rolled in whatever your favorite sauce ia. Mine is the sweet habnero or the Chipotle BBQ. Prices are are very reasonable and in my mind the chicken tenders blow canes out of the water as well. Place is kinda divy by the looks from the outside but the interior is clean and the staff is warm and welcoming and explains anything on the menu as well. A++

This place is really great. Not only is the food great but the staff make you feel like a family Memeber. Like you're hanging out at your sisters house. Chicken was cooked to perfection.  This may be the place that keeps the location up and going. Every other place in this location has failed for one reason or another.  All locals know the place.  Love the nostalgia in the restaurant.  Got an extra license plate, bring in it.  They'd love to hang it.  Above all, it's a clean establishment.  Great job!!!

First time at chicken shack. Ordered the wings combo. Wanted coke slaw instead of wings. Take out order. Got home just wings with the sauce no fries or coleslaw. The chicken was great. Service is great. Just need to check the order before it goes out. And. There was no ice in the drink machine. All said I will be back chicken is great.

If you are looking for a deep fried & finger-licken meal then this fried chicken was on point! The wings were equally scrumptious. There was a  good variety of different dipping sauces like jerk chicken and herbed parmesean that you could sprinkle over your meal. The haystack portion of french fries was also very yummy. They also had several good beers available which was one good reason to stay and eat there. We found that this meal is best eaten at the shack itself. Our take out was a bit soggy and cold by the time we got home.

I used to come by when this placed was called Chicken Bonz and the name had always fascinated me. So I decided to stop by with a couple friends and we were not disappointed.  The place definitely has that mom and pop feel to it. The walls are decorated by license plates and 'why did the chicken cross the road' jokes. They even have a couple of arcade machines if you get bored. The menu is pretty standard for a chicken place. They have wings, fingers, fries along with several sauces. They also had a burger, coleslaw, and some other stuff but I mean c'mon who gets the cheese burger and the chicken finger restaurant?  The fingers were great, juicy and moist and good size. The shoestrings fries were just like the ones you would find at other restaurants but a good addition to the meal. I had mine tossed in the hot bqq which had a perfect combo of spicyness and bbq flavor. The honey bbq and the lemon pepper are also great.   While I thought the food was great I did notice that the service was pretty slow. I understand they really focus on fresh food, but it should not take 25 minutes to get chicken fingers out. It's a fast food restaurant and even some sit-down places are quicker than that. I also think its a bit pricey for chicken fingers, a 5 finger combo is close to $10bux. Still def worth checking out if your into chicken.

I would give this place a 5 star review if they didn't use Postmates as their delivery service. I was able to make ONE single successful order though postmates but since that order, my cart will not clear. Because of that, I cannot make another order for delivery. I have tried emailing postmates a few times now and even called them. Each time, they give me the same useless solution. Uninstall/reinstall the app or click "edit". It still won't allow me to place another order. If Chicken Shack began delivering or changed their delivery service like EAT24 or BiteSquad,  which work flawlessly, I won't be able to eat there as often as I would like. This is the only negative. Their food is amazing and I wish I could have it delivered.... :-(

I stopped going to BWW's years ago when this place first opened on Sunset. This is the same great food in a better location. If you've never eaten here before, I suggest trying the both the wings and the tenders. My favorite sauces use to be a mix of honey BBQ and damn hot. But, now they have hot honey garlic that's become my new favorite.

I've always heard about Chicken Shack but there was never one close time. Now there is one right by my office and even better on my way home!!! Great wings and fingers.....I even liked the chili and potato salad!!! This will definitely be a stop more often!

I have been wanting to try this place for awhile. So I Tried it yeasterday. I ordered a 6 piece wing combo with fries and a drink,6 more wing and fries and a 5 piece chicken finger for $34.10. Seems like a lot of money. But for the amount of food it's not. The wings are huge and the chicken fingers are huge too. I could only eat 3 wings and half of my fries. The wings taste like chicken. I have had wings before that have no flavor. They are so good and crispy if you get certain ones. The people there are nice and friendly. I ordered for a take out when I got there. I waited for it. There were very fast making my food. It was hot. And the cook came out of the kitchen and gave me my food personally. I definitely will be back here to eat again. Great place!!

The chicken was thick and juicy. (+) The fries were decent, I've had worse and better. (-) The dipping sauces I had was spicy BBQ and regular BBQ and both were amazingly great! (+) We ordered a 3 piece combo and a 5 piece. We received an extra chicken finger in both combos (10 pieces total) (++++++++++++++++)  Customer service was very nice friendly

Really big juicy wings with a variety of sauce to choose from. A casual kick back place that's a good stop by for a good bite to eat. Great customer service. The place is very small and only a few tables. The place wasn't that clean, but wasn't filthy either. I will be going back. My kids loved those wings and fries.

I had the six piece chicken combo with sweet chili sauce. $9.59 Small cute and tidy place . You may not get the parking space you want because there are several other popular eateries in this complex. Customer service is friendly . Too may sauces to mention. Here's the basic cut to the chase review compared to those other chicken wing places - it seemed to me that chicken shack uses a better quality chicken and therefore the end product is a better tasting chicken . Also extra extra extra thanks for having wet towelettes to wipe your fingers . The other places don't offer those .

Was there on August 23, 2015 on a Zip Line trip with FlightLinez and a dude there said we should try Chicken Shack. We paid him mind and actually were looking forward to lunch after an awesome time ziplinning. The chicken was juicy,moist,tender and flavorful. I wish we had one in Los Angeles.  If I return to Boulder City I'll be there for my chicken fingers!!! Great sauces had my eyes watering with such intense flavors. I love me some chicken shack!

Avoid this place.  I've definitely had better. I was looking forward to this place, and it was a complete let-down. Yelp led me astray for the first time. So astray that I feel inspired to leave my two-cents.   The fries were soggy. I like a fry with a good bit of crisp, but without too much crunch where it is overcooked. These fries must have been sitting around for a long time. The chicken was terrible. For a place being named for their chicken and still being open, I'm surprised it lasted this long. The chicken fingers were just as soggy, the breading fell apart, and there was no seasoning. I can't believe I spent money on this.  The only thing this place has going for it are the jokes on the walls and its variety of amazing sauces, which had some kick!  You're better off with Raising Cane's. It's cheaper and better quality.

my foodie "uncle" recommended me here. I like it a lot. many sauce choices. fries are crunchy, wings and fingers are juicy and crunchy. just the way I like it. opens at 10. I came in before 11 and it's full of customers.

Nice location... Service was good but nothing major. From the look and smell of the garlic parmesan wings I was expecting greatness!! The crunch and seasoning on the wing is excellent! However, one bite of the chicken and you wonder what happened. There is no flavor in the actual chicken... Such a sad find. It doesn't take much to season chicken... If they did that it would put them above the national franchise. The fries are cut thinner then most places but are so good! My disappointment comes when the signature item lacks flavor. I'd eat there again but I will definitely be trying something else.

I really have to say that they have some great chicken and the customer service is really good and they have all kinds of different flavors of chicken and they can even make Cajun fries careful it's super hot but it really is good and I will definitely be back for more I also got the medium strips with some BBQ wings and they were both amazing I have to try other the next time. Definitely check this place out.
You won't be disappointed coming here. We had the chicken fingers, wings and fries with every imaginable dipping sauce there is mmmmmh. Service great and cozy don't pass by
that's a great place. It's near by railroad system so after visting railroad museum, we can pass by there and eat. Good price and good food. Clean and friendly service. Recommend go there!!

On our way to the Hoover Dam in Nevada, we came across The Chicken Shack. We decided to stop by to try something diffrent. We did not know what to expect, at first glance I was kinda worried about how clean it would be, but as soon as we walked in my worry went away. This place is SUPER clean!!! Restrooms are clean. The cashier is super friendly and very helpful. We told her it was our first time and she explained the menu.   The menu consists of mainly chicken fingers and fried wings. They also have chesseburger, chicken sandwhich, and salads. They have a variety of sauces and dressings. They offer beer and fountain drinks.   We ordered our food and sat at the front  patio. The food arraived very quickly. The portions are big. You defenetly get for what you pay for. Nice country music playing. Very good, I will be stopping by next time im in the area.

Been here a few times and they've always been very nice and fast. If there's a line it usually isn't for long because they're very prompt.  They have some cool menu options and the food tastes really good.  The only slight drawback is the size of the location.  It's intimate but small and the front cash area can get very congested.  I do suggest trying the Pitcher of beer and wings combo deal.

One of the most delicious chicken joints in Nevada! The staff is professional, helpful, and friendly. The place is small, and looks like an old fashioned fast food restaurant from the early 1900s. 30 minutes away from the city but totally worth it!

Cool place, cool guys behind the counter.   Combo meals are a good deal for lunch. They have a good selection of dipping sauces and the containers are plenty big so it was more than enough for me. Chicken fingers are plump and tasty. Teeny tiny shoe string fries that I don't care for because I like steak fries much better, but I will admit they are tasty. Simple dining room to eat in and the counter guy even asked me how the food was and I gave him the international thumbs up. They play classic rock music which is amazing. This Chicken Shack rocks!! "I'll be back"

The did have shoestring fries and fry sauce...  and Alaskan Amber beer... all great starts... but at the end of the day the wings were at best average... I asked for Jamaican jerk on the side... they came out soaked in it... to their credit, they did bring me 6 more plain for free... Onto my next quest!!!

My youngest son loves chicken wings.  Actually the whole family does.  We discovered this gem of a eatery via Yelp and visit every time we are in Vegas.  Even if we are not staying very close by.  Why?  Because the wings are plump, juicy and delicious. We had the sweet chile, honey bbq, teriyaki and buffalo medium.  Everytime we have been here, John was behind the counter and taking care of us.   Very friendly and patient and has great suggestions.  It is obvious from the steady flow of patrons that the wings are delicious.  We also had the shoestring fries and coleslaw.  Coleslaw was ice cold and kind of sweet but definitely great.  And the fries disappeared almost as fast as the wings.  I wasn't sure the 36 wings would feed the five of us but the wings are so big that we left full.  No leftovers.  My only comment would be that the orders had a much higher percentage of drummettes than wing sections.  I prefer the wing but I am guessing John could make that happen for me next time.  Worth the trip and forget about the decor.  The chicken is the draw here.

Ok, first off, the food is great! The chicken wings were really good, the sauce is tasty, and the fries are CRAZY GOOD! My only complaint is with the service.  They advertise being open until 9pm. My wife and I showed up October 31st @ 5:50pm and were told that they were closing in 10 minutes, so we would have to eat outside.  We agreed to this and then proceeded to watch multiple people get turned away, even though the open light was still on and the door was unlocked.  We could hear the employees talking about some Halloween party that they were wanting to go to, and it made us wonder if they were really supposed to be closing early, or if they were just taking advantage of the boss being away.  There was a sign on the door that asked patrons not to wear masks inside the store for Halloween which made us believe even more that this was not something that the owners were aware of. We sat outside for about an hour and watched numerous groups get turned away because the "fryer was already turned off" as the cashier would tell people, and then proceed to take the orders groups of 1 or 2. One lady who was turned away, was pretty upset, and she was talking to her husband, complaining about them supposedly closing, but saying that she overheard the people in the back talking about their Halloween party. Then another group that was turned away, said that they thought it was ridiculous that they were closing @ 6:30pm. I overheard them and said, "That's funny, they told us 6!" Another group was turned away shortly thereafter being told that the fryer was already turned off. Not 2 minutes later, a man and his wife walked in, ordered their food, and continued to eat their meal, inside. Some people were forced to eat in their cars, because there was no room @ the tables outside, and the staff kept telling people that they had to leave. The cashier came to the door as we were eating, and started to peel the sign off of the door, notifying customer about their mask policy. He looked over at me and said, "I probably should lock the door huh?" I said, "Probably, unless you want more angry customers than you've already had so far tonight." My wife asked him if the owners were aware of their early closing, which he skirted the question by saying that it was a family run business that closes early for holidays, like Thanks Giving and Halloween.  I told him that this was the first business I've ever heard of that closes early for Halloween and he just kind of nervously chuckled and said, "Yeah" and then I told him that it might not be a bad Idea to turn off the Open sign, or put up a sign notifying customers of their change in business hours. My guess is that this was just a bunch of idiots, thinking that they were pulling a fast one, by coming up with a "genius" plan to close up shop early, so they could get to a partly. I know that I won't be going back, the next time I am in Vegas.

Food was just ok. I used to go to Chicken Bonz I was told it was the same people. So we tried them out. Cashier was rude stopped helping us twice to take a phone order and then to talk to an employee. Customer service lacking. THEN if you order wings or fingers your order doesn't come with any ranch or sauce. You have to pay extra if you want dipping sauce. I've never heard of such a thing. I'm not asking for 5 just at least one since I'm paying $14 for an order of wings.  I was asked if for here or to go and why ask if you going to bring them out togo? Or maybe your just so rude you didn't listen to anything I said. Which was probably it. Won't be back.

Great and convenient location! Fast service and food portions are generous.  We loved the medium sauce on the wings. It was like at traditional buffalo sauce.  The honey mustard and barbecue sauces were terrific on the tenders. The wings were my fave: crispy, plump and seasoned perfectly.

This is my first time trying the chicken shack and was not disappointed! Fresh tender and juicy chicken strips with killer dipping sauces is the best way to describe my eating experience. The staff was on point and recommended some really good dipping sauces to try. Considering chicken shack are chicken specialists, I would say they have perfected the chicken and fry basket game! This is a must try if you love Canes or Zaxbys will definitely be back

For a real treat after your visit to Hoover Dam stop at the Chicken Shack in Boulder City, NV. Perfectly Chrispy juicy tenders with wide bevy of choices for dipping. Plenty of skinny fries with fry sauce!

DO NOT JUST DRIVE PAST THIS PLACE!! Wow! Their chicken strips are to die for, their sauce selection literally has something for anyone, and they are all super tasty. (Well, judging from the 5 I tried, I'm guessing the other 20 are equally amazing) Very friendly staff and owners, who you can tell take pride in the service and product that they provide. Today was my first time going in, but you can be assured that I will be back often.

I usually would go to the Henderson location and order fingers only so I was super stoked that they opened one nearby my house, However, when I went to this location, I noticed that they raised the menu prices so that was a bummer. I took my family with me and told my husband he would love this place (He's a wing guy) he was so disappointed that the wings were breaded and the chicken fingers were so dry and tough, The Fries were a bit salty as well.

Had lunch here today with friend and wife. Great service. Very friendly staff.   Seating area a little small  Food was amazing. Wife and I both had the #4 - wings and fingers combo. Habanero Honey sauce is good mix of sweet and heat.

I love this Chicken Shack.  So happy that we found this hidden gem.  We have been coming here several times now and every time the food is excellent. Chickens are not salty nor greasy. It's juicy and tasty. Perfect every time. I kind of feeling healthy eating this fried food with no guilt. A big plus is that the owner is super friendly. I love coming here when I feel welcomed every time.   I highly recommend this place for fried chicken fingers and chicken wings. I always drive extra distance to get here and skip all other chicken places near me.

Stopped here for lunch as I was up the road for training. What an amazing place to grab a quick bite. Chicken was cooked to perfection and the shoestring French fries are the best I have ever had (and I have been all over the country). Will definitely make a return trip to this place. My only complaint is that the music is so loud it is hard to hear your order called or carry on a simple conversation.

Great hang out place! You have to try all the sauces every time u visit !! They have sooo many different flavors it's crazy!!!  Their fingers were juicy, tender and fresh and I love how big it is and it actually top off the raising canes !! Friendly staffs and the management team !!! If you want to get some good chicken fingers and wings also like to see some friendly faces and smiles this is the place!!!!!

Love this place. First went w some other families and kids after a b day party that was lacking in the food dept. We had boneless wings and the hot sauce is fantastic. The chicken and prep are fresh which is a rarity. And they have beer!   Reasonably priced for the quality. Got them for the adults @ my kid's 6th bday and was a hit. Only wish they had an outlet on my side of town.

Not a huge fan. Stopped in passing through town craving some wings. The portions were huge. Salad, fries, wings, all of it was huge.  The wings themselves were not great. The wings were really big which made them not taste as good. In my opinion, good wings need to be smaller, that way you get more of the sauce to wing ratio. Not only that, they tasted old. Not impressed, should've gone to BWW.

I drove past this place and decided to stop in and give it a try.  The menu is basically wings, chicken strips, or larger portions by the piece.  I decided on the 3-piece chicken strip meal and added a side of cole slaw.   The strips were HUGE!  The meal included a mound of straw-thin fries and a soda.  The small side of slaw was much larger than I expected.  Portion size would earn 5 stars!    The cole slaw was decent.  Not great, but better than many I've tried at other chicken joints.  I prefer a creamy, sweet slaw.  This was a bit runny with a little too much pepper for my taste.  But again, not bad.  3 stars for the slaw.  I really enjoyed the fries, but they are almost too thin.  4 stars  Now for the chicken strips...HUGE size!  Unfortunately, they don't have any flavor really.  The breading could be great with some spices thrown in, but as it is, it's just a crunchy coating of blandness.  2.5 stars  Considering that chicken is the main attraction here, I can't bring myself to give more than 3 stars for the entire meal.  Apparently, the Chicken Shack is under new management.  I might give it a month or so and try it again.

When I found out that they opened another location closer to me, I knew I had to check this place out. I got the 5 piece chicken tender combo with two sauces (honey bbq and creamy garlic parmesan).  I was disappointed that the fries I got was all soggy and oily. For those of you who read my other reviews, this is one of my biggest pet peeves. I am not sure if this is just the way they make their fries or if this was a bad batch. If I'm going to eat something unhealthy, it might as well be a good experience! I ended up just eating a few of the fries before I decided to throw them all out (what a waste of money!). The chicken tenders themselves were pretty good. I really enjoyed the honey bbq sauce and it's nice how the chicken is pretty juicy. One thing to note is that the batter isn't as crispy as places like Raising Canes or as flavorful as Popeye's. This basically means you're pretty dependent on the sauces for flavor.   Overall, this place is just okay. I don't think I'll be coming back unless my friends really want to check this place out. I would recommend just going to Canes or BWW.

Might be the best wings in town!!! Don't let the looks fool you. Yes it's a small greasy kind of a hole in the wall chicken shop, but it's good!!! Kind of place that the smell is in your clothes when you leave. Flavors are all right on, chicken is non-greasy and crispy. They even have PBR on tap. Garlic parm is my fav!!!
The best chicken tenders hands down. I love the honey bbq sauce and the fries are amazing. Everyone should try this place at least once.

Hubby wanted wings so he yelped and found this place.  This is located close to the Galaxy Theater in Henderson, where we had just watched Ant Man an hour prior...  This is a small shop with 7 tables (2-6 tops), and a couple of more tables outside.  The wings are battered fried and you can select the seasoning you want on them.  6 wings, fries, and a drink is $8 and another $.50 for the sauce.  The wings are big (drumsticks and flats).  Hubby thought they were good, I thought they were ok.  My favorite is still Wingstop.  Would I come back, meh...it was ok.

Really awesome chicken! Perfectly cooked and the fries are to die for! If you are going to binge on fried food, this is the place to do it.  The people working there are great too. My kid had a super weird food request and the cook did it exactly the way my child wanted it. Must try!!!
This is a favorite place for me and my family to enjoy chicken , chili cheese fries , and triple stacked burgers.. They have alot of sauces for the chicken..

We've been a few times. Love the "Happy Hour" Special: 12 wings (one sauce choice, 1lb of fries and a pitcher of beer for $16.99. Chicken is crispy (we get our sauce on the side), fries are kinda thin for my liking but tasty none the less.   Only concern...last weekend (Saturday 10/29) it made my husband sick. I dont think we will be back for a while.

we came here after hiking today. I like their outdoor seatings. Inside, the walls are decorated with license plates from different states. It has a pretty cool feel to the place, but it can get crowded given the fact that it is small place.  We ordered the 25 pieces wings for $24.49 with Spicy blue cheese sauce. The sauces actually comes separately, I thought it would be mixed in. Anyways, they came out very crispy and the size is big.   They also have on the menu- chicken fingers, burgers, a Shack salad, sides like barbecue baked beans, macaroni salad and veggie sticks, plus a long list of sauces for the chicken including mild, medium, hot, damn hot, BBQ hot BBQ honey, BBQ teriyaki, hot teriyaki, sweet chili, chili, lime, garlic parmesan, lemon pepper, and habanero honey.

I'm surprised I've never reviewed this place myself  I've been coming here for the last 7 years when it was originally called "chicken bonz". To say the least, it was some of the best fingers you could get over here. There was a change in ownership and they renamed the place "chicken shack". Didn't think it'd keep up with a name change since it was so known with the bonz, but they never missed a beat!   Pros: 11$ and under for any combo (8$ for the 3 finger)           Friendly environment and nice wall decor           Good customer service!  Cons: sometimes the tables could be messy            Overall, this place is a gold mine and an awesome place for chicken and more! If you're ever around Sunset and Mountain vista, look no further than the Shack!
This is the best chicken fingers and wings in town. They also have the best ranch sauce staff are nice, especially the cook the mexican guy very welcoming and with good character

Love this place!! Nice size wings, shoestring fries, choice of different sauces, they give you the option to have them prepared with or sauce on the side. Never disappointed when I go, sometimes the line can be long.
