Stopped here on our way back from Lake Mead. Seriously great food in an old-fashion setting. Small diner with big taste! We got the chicken finger combo and it was wonderful. The fries and chicken were crisp and very flavorful. Highly recommend for a well priced excellent bite!
Had some honey BBQ chicken fingers and fries. They were a bit over cooked which made them very dry. The fries here are good but fries alone are not going to make me return.

Some of the best wings in Henderson, and the best take-out wings I've ever had.   They are cooked perfectly and their sauces are delicious. My favorites are the honey habanero, Hot, spicy teriyaki and sweet chili.   Shoe string fries are addictive, how do they make them so good ?!? Dip them in their crack sauce, I mean honey mustard and OMG. I literally have to throw them away to stop eating them. Their coleslaw is also really good.   So why 4 stars?  They charge you for sauce ?! I have never had wings that don't come with Blue cheese ( ranch for the west coasters) on the side. It's annoying is all it is.  No celery and carrots either?! This you also have to pay for. We always pay extra for these things because you're eating wings and these items are necessities. For the cost you would think it would be built into the price.   I would come here more often if it wasn't for the things mentioned above. Other than that, you won't be dissaointed.

Can I give this place more stars???  I went there hungry ordered 6 hot wings, fries, potato salad and a drink.   I barely ate my potato salad I was stuffed.  The wings are huge.  They aren't your typical Hooters, BWW, major chain wings.  So good.  I will definitely go back again.  It's my new wings place.  They also give a 10% discount on days when the Golden Knights are playing and you are wearing a Golden Knights shirt.

I really liked the concept. The honey BBQ sauce seems like it's made with real honey so it was a good idea. However the chicken fingers were not cooked to perfection. The meat tasted over cooked and dry. At least raising canes cooks their chicken perfect almost every time so if they can master their cooking game it would be a 5.

Excellent !  New !  Quality chicken and fabulous customer service! Everyone is friendly and  Helpful - all of staff and the owner ! I have been 5 times since they opened  A life saver for good fast take out ! Laurel B

FINALLY a Chicken Shack on the southwest side of town (not in Henderson). Happy to report they still have the same high level of quality as the original. Best fingers in town and some very good fries as well. Try the mild and medium sauces. They're fantastic!
So very happy that they have location 5 minutes from house. Now I can have them more than just only when I go to Boulder City
My second time here and the chicken is wonderful crispy and juicy with flavor. Wish I lived closer would come back more!
great place to stop and eat while going to/from vegas. Excellent wing sauces and fries.

Was skeptical about trying this place at first. Tried it and it was ok. I got the number 4 which is 3 wings, 3tenders, fries and drink. Simple meal to start off with a new restaurant . The fries were good. The chicken was juicy but I feel as tho they could cook their chicken wings and tenders just a bit longer, give it that crisp. And it could use some more seasoning, wasn't impressed with the seasoning on the food at all. So decent spot but it won't be somewhere that I'd set out to go to in future unless by passing.

Love this place! My suggestion is EAT IT THERE, usually by the time you get home (even living in boulder) your french fries will be soggy. I usually order just the chicken and fries, great prices too!

I've been coming here for the past few years whenever I need my wing fix. Their wings are delicious, but I always opt for their strips just for the mere fact that I never like getting my hands dirty.  I usually order the combo, their fries are so yummy and their wing portions are huge - I can always get away with just three pieces to feel full.  Lemon pepper is usually my go-to flavor but they've got many others to choose from, all of which are just as good.  Definitely better than all the other wing chains in the city.
Hands down the best wings and fingers I had here in vegas! Wish we could bring this place to Texas!

I had been looking foreword to this location opening for quite some time ever since first seeing the sign on the road for coming soon.  They exceeded all of my expectations with friendly staff, food quality, and getting it incredibly quickly.   I'm very familiar with the sunset location and how busy they are, so walking right up to the register and ordering and receiving my food in 10 mins time was an incredible accomplishment.  Food is incredibly amazing and as I've said, the staff is very friendly. Would highly suggest anyone to check out this place

Talk about some amazing chicken wings, this place has it!  We had the medium, hot and honey habanero and all were out of this world! The wings were cooked to perfection the staff was excellent and the fries are just like I like them. The home made dips were also all very good! I would give it five stars if it was a five star type of place, but this is as good as it gets in dining like this! Next time I am going to try the extra hot as I like things very spicy, and the normal hot wasn't super hot. Also the hone habanero isn't very spicy but is sweet and spicy and very good. Also the garlic parmesan is outstanding, but in wings I do like spicy.
Had a very enjoyable experience at The Chicken Shack. The food was quick to be served and tasted great! Not to mention the service was an A+!

We pass by this place every time we head to Boulder City for a relaxing day but never really concidered eating there until yesterday. After seeing the great Yelp reviews, we decide to try it. We were not disappointed! I had the #1 (6 wings, fries and a drink) with "medium" sauce. Not only were the wings big but I got 7 wings in my basket. The wings have a very light flour dredge ans nicely sauced. The shoestring fries were very crispy but not overcooked at all and nothing was greasy. Only thing I saw missing was a selection of "good" beer but they did have some Bud products. I decided to hold off until we got to Boulder Dam Brewing.

Food was life changing according to my 18 year old son - he had to order another chicken sandwich before even finishing the first. Meals are huge - fries were awesome too! Ranch was great and BBQ sauce was the best. Great place to stop after the Hoover Dam. Owners were very nice. Old facilities, but still HIGHLY recommended!

I just came back from out of the country and honestly, I couldn't wait to come back to Vegas just so I can stop by one of my favorite places in the city.   By far, the best fried chicken (both wings and strips) I've had.  Tried a couple of other places and it just doesn't compare: the flavors, the texture, the size... Mmmmm-mmmm!!!! (smacking my lips)  What also gives it the edge are the shoestring french fry combination, it brings out that crunch that I had been looking for at the other chicken wings/strip spots.  The serving size is huge, I usually split a combo with a friend and that tends to be enough for me.  For those with larger appetites, don't worry, this place won't disappoint.  BIG Thumbs up!  The service is great, everyone there are friendly. Cute little spot that gets busy with a diverse crowd of patrons. The only complaint I have is during the times I've dined in, I can't help but notice how dirty the place is (the walls are friggin' gross as it's covered with dust and grease). As much as I enjoy the food when I dine there, the walls can be distracting.  Other than that, this place has great food (5 stars) and great service (5 stars)... just wish it was a bit more tidy (3.0). Overall, 4.3 stars in my book

Wife and I live close by and come here two or three times a month. We always get the combo #2 and #3. I've heard their burgers are pretty good but we can't seem to get away from the chicken! They've got a great selection of sauces to go with the chicken if you're into that. My wife only does ketchup and I go with the chili/lime sauce. You'll either love or hate the chili/lime sauce. If you get anything to go I'd suggest venting/opening the to-go box a little when in transit because the contents will get pretty soggy. Venting won't guarantee it'll stay 100% crispy but it'll help a little.

When you walk in and view the menu, you think you are in "Chicken Heaven". There are a variety of flavors and various seasonings you can choose for your fries. However, I was not impressed. I ordered the chicken wing and chicken strip meal with a side of fries. The chicken was cooked to a golden crisp and served hot. I ordered the garlic Parmesan, and thought it was waay too salty. Also, a few of my pieces of chicken were undercooked. The restaurant is small, so I had to get my food to go. I have heard mixed reviews and though my experience was not the greatest, I am willing to give Chicken Shack a second chance.
The sides were even better than the chicken! And the chicken was incredible! 5 stars! Highly recommend the beans. New location by kohls - valle verde / 215

Came here for the first time the other day ordered a combo of chicken wings and tenders with French fries and a drink. Took about 8min or less. Chicken fingers were probably one of the best I've had ! They're so juicy on the inside and crispy on the outside. The mild sauce was great in flavor. I actually like the really thin French fries. We'll definitely be coming back for more!

I've always wanted to try this place. Found the chicken to be good, but the portions excessive, the dipping sauces I tried, painfully unappetizing. All in all, I left half my order uneaten, and regretted my visit.

AMAZING!!! Driving thru from Lake Mead back to Cali and thankfully stopped here. Food is awesome and service is just as great. I will stop here anytime I'm in the area and everyone else should do themselves a favor and do the same. 'Best chicken fingers since birth' -my boyfriend lol but really, so great!!
I'm a native from California but my grandma stays down the street and she loves to eat here. we just got a lot of chicken and I must say it was pretty good big pieces and I will be visiting soon!

Love it! Chicken fingers are crispy and juicy, and come out in less than 5 minutes. The shoestring fries are absolutely fantastic- crispy and perfectly seasoned. Management is super friendly. My boyfriend and i both got a 3 piece with fries each, and left with leftovers. Great price, great food. Will definitely be back to try out all the different sauces!
Ok so far the best chicken I've had in a very long time!!! The service was great..... The wait time was short. The establishment was very neat and clean. I'm in love

We spent a couple hours at the Hoover Dam and decided it was lunch time. We were on the way to Vegas and figured we'd find something. There were several chain places and a number of local places, but this one sounded promising since we were in the mood for chicken anyhow. Admittedly the outside didn't inspire confidence but that hasn't stopped us before. Sometimes the best places look unassuming, and this is no different.  The interior is decorated with license plates form all over the US, which gives it that kitschy feel, especially fun for a road trip. She got some chicken tenders, but I love me some wings so I got wings and tenders. She chose the garlic parmesan sauce and I got the honey bbq.  The meals came with shoestring fries and a drink. The tenders were tender and juicy and fresh and hot, the wings were excellent, and the fries? Perfect. I'm not a big fan of the shoestrings but these were seasoned wonderfully and just crispy enough without being overdone. All at a reasonable price. And the best part is that we didn't have a long wait like at some places.  If you're ever traveling through or even close to Boulder City, you simply have to check out The Chicken Shack. You'll be glad you did.

Place was good enough that i'd come back. Chicken was just a little salty. Really enjoyed the fries with that fry sauce. The dude who was runnin the desk seemed like good people, other than being a Cubs fan lol. Gotta support local mom and pop joints like this though!

Really really good chicken fingers! Nice sauce selections and I like the menu variety. Burgers here are great...thin and great beef burger flavor...and on an onion roll.  Service is fast and the staff behind the counter are friendly and have a sense if humor. Great find just beware...hard to get a parking spot.

Glad to see this place finally open! Just as good as all the rest. Wish the parking was a bit more thoughtful as you park around the side of the building unless you're handicapped but once inside its good and clean, nice staff, and great fresh food. Great place to stop in if you are getting your oil changed or a car washed nearby. Go with the chicken. Garlic flavors are great-garlic parm and honey garlic are perfect. Shoestring fries get high praise from me too. Just all around exactly what you want from a wing joint. Sooo much better than wing-stop. Don't forget the ranch and fry sauce!

Chicken tenders are awesome! I love all the sauces that come with it as well. The prices aren't that bad especially on how good the tenders taste. I really loved the service, thank you(: I wish there was a chicken shack closer to my area, the drive down to Henderson side is too far..

I thought the comments "chicken on steroids" and "unusually plump" were funny,,,, and yet true!  It is plump n tender, batter can be a bit more separated but overall a good chicken strip.  Habanero honey sauce is tasty, tried a few other sauces but they were ehhhh... U gotta find your own sauce! Cole slaw was a bit below KFC level, a bit soggy and minced, they do have $1 drafts! (12oz) For 5.95 you get 3 strips, fries n soda, not a bad deal...   And free chicken quotes on the walls....

Located near the intersection of Sunset Rd. and Mountain Vista, which I like to think of as "old Green Valley." This place is definitely a beaut that contributes to the other mom and pop owned places in the area. Chicken Shack was a typical eating spot for me while I was attending USN because my classmates and I would come here during our lunch breaks or after school before we would get our study on. And yes, all the raving reviews are correct. From what I've tired, probably the best chicken wings in LV, so this place is a MUST TRY!   I've noticed that I am a tough critic when it comes to the breading because Raising Canes is a little thin, while KFC is so thick I just opt to peel all the breading off. However, Chicken Shack has the perfect amount of thickness and also has nice crispy texture. Seasoned very well and they offer different types of flavors too like Wing Stop or BBW. The fries are also delish, thinly cut with extra crispies (almost the same as Yard House fries). They also have an all you can eat chicken option for $12.99, but I don't exactly know what it comes with. But I found that interesting because I've never seen such a thing at a chicken place. The only down side is you have to pay extra for ranch or blue cheese, which in my opinion kinda sucks.   I really like the mom and pop vibe of this place with the friendly staff and decorations.They even have their specials written on a chalk board. All of it really makes everyone feel welcomed.
Love the quality of their food...chicken tenders were outstanding...the fries are excellent.

I can't get enough of this place. They continue to consistently improve with their service and quality of food and it keeps me coming back every week. It is a little pricey, don't get me wrong, but it's so damn worth it. The wings are incredible as compared to BWW, these wings are jusr hearty, crispy, and fill you more. The sauces are sweet and define that guilty pleasure. I tend to get a #1 Combo- 6 wings,fries, and drink. I split the wings with Hot Honey Garlic and Mild. You can get sauce on the side or on the wings----The wetter the better. The chicken tenders deliver as well, lightly breaded with meat that is whole and juicy. The manager at this location is awesome too. Very friendly staff. My only complaint would be is that the Large Ranch side doesn't give you enough. I feel like every time I go there the ranch keeps getting lower in that container! But, nevertheless, this is my spot. 5 all day, son.

Loved this place!  Today Friday 30 2:00 pm the cashier that took our order was just the nicest person I've ever met.  Fingers, wings and fries were just BOMB'  I'm giving a "I'll come back"  Price isn't bad at all.. paid $11 for my order and my boyfriend and I were able to both eat from the same plate!   Omg, I'm just so happy we've found this place!  Even better than Buffalo Wild Wings.   Xoxo

We like Raising Canes.  We thought it was the best.....UNTIL...... we had Chicken Shack.  Their fingers are much larger than Canes.  So tender and juicy.  They are served to order and so hot you must let them cool a bit before you can eat them.  Chicken Shack has so many sauces to offer for your strips.  I wish we had a Chicken Shack in Tempe.  If we are back in the area visiting, we will stop here again.
In my opinion, BETTER than Canes! Only we need one on the opposite side of town!

words of wisdom:   if you are heading out of vegas, and need to run through boulder city......do not leave without stopping for some chicken fingers!!!!   you will thank me later!!!   fyi - the spicy blue cheese is to die for!!!

I was really hoping to find a suitable replacement for WingStop, since the closest one to us is across town. WingStop back in Cali was my favorite go to spot for crispy well seasoned wings, but I have yet to find a place out here in Henderson near home that can compare. I ordered the #4 which comes with 3 boneless wings and 3 regular wings all in the Lemon Pepper flavor. The fries are pretty tasty - well seasoned super thin shoe string fries, but the wings were too much on the salty side compared to what I'm used to getting with WingStop's lemon pepper wings. Plus, as one Yelper pointed out, they keep their back door open, which you can clearly see from the ordering counter.  That somewhat worries me, for obvious health hazard reasons.... The place is real small, untidy and not as inviting as some describe it to be. It was an okay visit, but I'd rather go elsewhere - even contemplating just sucking it up and travelling across town to get my WingStop fix.

Good price and good fried  chicken. If you're in the area and looking for a quick bite they fit the bill. Price is right for what you get. A little on the bland side but not too bad. It's fast fried chicken don't go in expecting a whole lot. Lol

Visiting Las Vegas for a basketball tournament with my boyfriend and his team! We came here and it was amazing! I was not disappointed. My boyfriend and i both got the chicken sandwich with bacon! The sand which was made up of 3 large chicken strips! A large amount of food & For both meals, fries & two sodas + a small tip it was less that 23$ in total. The gentleman at the register was amazing with customer service. He acknowledged that we had never been here and was great at recommending options. Although it was a little messy from the rush and the tabletops were a little sticky... my overall experience here was good! Great food and customer service! I definitely enjoyed my visit. Would recommend to others & come back!

Our food was ok. We ordered a 10 piece chicken strip with fries and some wings. The strips were thick and juicy but lacked flavor. The sauces were pretty tasty though... overall I probably would choose another chicken place like canes.
Best chicken and great service!  Always better to call in order for even quicker check out!  I always get the honey BBQ wings, but my son loves the mild chicken fingers.  The ranch is the best too!!!

This place is the business! Their chicken is always hot, fresh and above all crispy. Not to mention their array of tasty sauces to smother your chicken in, but you can also get sauce on the side for you dippers. Not a huge fan of the shoe-string fry. I like my potatoes like how I like my women, with a little more meat on them ya feel. The frys weren't bad by any means though. They also have burgers which I haven't got around to will definitely be back to try though!

The food here is wonderful. We were pleasantly surprised with this place. It was very clean and the food was great. The wings were awesome especially with the spicy blue cheese. Ranch dressing was good too.
I'm looking forward to going back to this restaurant on this trip to Vegas. It was so good and affordable last time I had it a cookie years ago.

First I went in to grab a menu, the gentleman who greeted me was wearing a lakers beanie and was very polite and helpful. I had never heard of the place so I wanted to investigate. After some deliberation, I decided to go back in and order. Again, the lakers beanie guy was there and asked what I wanted. I ordered a 5 piece but changed to a 10 piece. At this point, the computer was giving him some trouble so he asked a lady to come help. She was wearing a baseball cap. While she was fixing the order I asked her a couple questions about the sauces and what type of sauce went on the hot wings and such, to my surprise she replied rather rudely. I had never been to the restaurant before so I figured they were reasonable questions but to her it seemed like I was really interfering with her daily routine. Other than the rudeness from the baseball cap wearing female, I felt goods about this place. The chicken strips were great. I got 5 in medium sauce and 5 plain along with a ranch and spicy ranch. The 5 tossed in the sauce were better overall bur if if you want plain strips i wouldn't hesitate. Also, there are some funny quotes on the wall. I look forward to going back and trying some of the other items on the menu.

First time ordering from this place. Overall I'll rate The Chicken Shack a "B" ordered the basic 5 piece chicken fingers. I was under the impression that the chicken itself would be seasoned, since it was being fried so without the dipping sauce which was amazing (Honey Garlic) the chicken would've been bland. The chicken was also a little oily as well,but I'm willing to give this place another spin.

My first impression was does anyone clean the tables or change the garbage? I heard the chicken was good so I proceeded to give it a try. I was not impressed. The staff had a whatever attitude and when I asked if they could wipe down the filthy table I got a annoyed ok. After ordering quite a bit of food I asked for a soda and a cup for water. Well that was a mistake as the young man behind the counter said NO....I could buy a bottle of water because too many people are taking soda instead of water. Did he just say I was going to steal soda????? Ok well on that note I replied I bought a soda but I'd like a cup of water for my medication....again a resounding no. Even if the chicken was great WHICH IT IS NOT I would NEVER step foot back in this filthy place again. Keep your dirty restaurant, poor service and water!!

Brought the kids here for lunch. Stop everytime we come to Vegas. Would have given 5 stars but for the first time we had a rude staff. I was extremely surprised by this. Ordered the Shake Pack with potato salad and baked beans. The food was amazing as always.

This is probably my new favorite chicken spot! Chicken is tender and lightly breaded. They don't douse your food in sauce (unless asked) and have the option of fingers or wings. Get the #4 if you want both !

We've been here a few times and my boyfriend comes here semi regularly. The staff is always super nice and they tend to remember people well.  I love the chicken fingers here. They don't have a ton of breading on it which is how I like them. The fingers are huge. A 5 piece is enough for both my boyfriend and I.  We haven't tried the wings yet but plan to so.

First time going here yesterday. This place offers chicken tenders, chicken wings, and other dishes such as chili, burgers, chicken sandwich, and salads as well. Located on rainbow and Tropicana. The place was super clean. Went with the combination chicken tender basket with fries. They make their fries shoestring style, and you had a choice of sauce on the side. Chicken you can get regular battered, or with your choice of sauce on top. The tenders and fries came it crispy, with the chicken specifically battered great. Paired it with ranch, my bf went with the fry sauce (mayo and ketchup combined, soo good!!) service was friendly. They also have customer rewards, make sure to grab a card at the cashier- buy 10 get a meal free.
Sometimes their chicken can get slightly over cooked causing them to be dru, but it doesn't happen very often.  Their fries are my favorite especially with their garlic parm sauce!

Hands down, one of the best places to eat after seeing the Hoover Dam. Best wings and fingers to taste like your grandmother fried up on a Sunday afternoon. To go along with it, you can taste the love in the food with the hospitable staff!

It's about time I write a review for this place. I've been coming here for a couple years and I haven't regretted it even once. I personally get the #2 combo all the time. The chicken fingers are juicy and have a light crispy golden crunch that make them fantastic. I usually get them to go but the customer service is always spot on with quick and nice workers.

I can't believe I've never reviewed this place. Chicken shack is my spot! I love hot wings but I love lightly breaded plain chicken wings with sauce on the side better!  Chicken shack serves wings, tenders, chili, beer, and crack fries. Their wings and tenders are lightly floured and are also huge. I always get the wing, fingers, fries, and soda combo. I think it's a #4. It comes with 3 wings 3 fingers, their shoe stringish fries, and a soda. I believe this combo is $8.95. It is A LOT of food. Last night the guy even gave me an extra wing AND finger. Kudos! I ended up taking four pieces of chicken home.  For flavor recommendations I suggest the lemon pepper or garlic parm POWDER flavoring or the hot sauce. The hot sauce had the perfect amount of heat with a slight sweet note that I adore.  I love my sauce on the side when I eat chicken wings and imagine having these breaded wings thrown into sauces would be too much.  They get REALLY busy, but the food comes out quickly. I think for the freshness and taste that the prices are fair as they do give you a lot of food. My only gripe is that you might have to clean the table you want on your own as the turn around is quick and there isn't always someone to wipe it down.

Best chicken fingers I have ever had!  Great quality boneless chicken breast with a wide selection of dipping sauces to choose from.  The service is great and the food comes out fresh and hot!  Do yourself a favor and give this place a try!  You won't regret it!
best wings in Las Vegas period...all the sauces are fresh and there is alot of variety. There's always great customer service and you can get a pitcher of beer for like 8$ what more do u want in life

Food is delicious!!! Best chicken fingers I've ever had. The staff was amazing and even made my dogs feel welcome after a long hike offering them water and grilled chicken. The food beat our expectations would definitely come back!!!

My favorite place to eat!! Have been eating here since High School and loved every single time I've gone. The people are so sweet and kind but the food is even better! I love bringing my friends from out of town here to try the spectacular chicken!
Great chicken! Super nice people. Servings are the way it should be. Thanks for the great meal and the tips on the Grand Canyon. See you next time.
Best chicken strips EVER!!! My favorite sauce is the honey mustard! I could eat here every night!!!

I think I've been here enough times that I should finally be giving it a rating.  So far, I've pretty much only had fingers and fries combos. Three fingers is the right size if you're alone, unless you're super hungry. Five is a bit high unless you're sharing with a friend or two, Sometimes, they'll throw in an extra finger if they think that your pieces are a little small.  I have to start with the fries. They are the best shoestring fries I've had anywhere. There's just something to the flavor that draws you in. Don't put ketchup on them though. I don't know why, but that destroys the flavor for me. You can dip them in sauces (see below).  And of course, the chicken fingers are the main point of the restaurant. They are large. They are crunchy. They are tender. And they come with dry or wet sauces (note: get wet sauces on the side if you don't want to destroy the crunchy texture of the fingers). Come back multiple times and try many sauces.  I have no darn clue why there isn't a lemon-lime soda option here. That's the only negative that I have to share. I would probably just get a small cup for water if I could, but a drink comes with the combo.

What a tragedy to lose one of the more creative restaurants in Henderson. What a treat to have it replaced by another outpost of one of my favorites.  Chicken Shack has been a favorite of mine for years. I was surprised to learn not long ago that they've actually expanded out of state, even as far north as Washington. Their newest location, however, is in the same town as the original location - barely over 10 minutes' drive away from the original Henderson hole in the wall that I've loved for so long.  Very little has changed, and I draw that comparison to two different things. It's the same space where Buddha Belly Deli (and, previously, East Coast Eats) tried to carve out success with casual lunch food, and the tables and chairs are the same as the Buddha's. The fountain drink area and the semi-exposed restrooms (now hidden with a rather garish high-back booth-like chair) are no different either. And there's even lucky bamboo, likely from well-wishing acquaintances of the owner.  More importantly, the food is also the same menu and the same quality. My 5 piece order of chicken fingers ($6.29) yielded the same huge boneless pieces of white meat with the same moistness and crunchy exterior as I've enjoyed so many times before. They were complemented as usual by my choice of Habanero Honey sauce (1 sauce included w/ order), which is an addictive spicy (medium-hot) and sweet blend. I should revisit their many other sauce options next time though - perhaps Jamaican Jerk or Creamy Garlic Parmesan, or a simple Honey Garlic? Maybe all of the above, since it's just 39 little Lincolns for each extra sauce (49 cents for some of the choices such as ranch or blue cheese).  The fries are at least as delicious as and even more addictive than the chicken. Ever since I discovered that the "small" order ($2.49) is still at least twice as big as the combo portion of fries, I've stopped using the combo. This also both saves me money (half a dollar) and spares me from unnecessary high-fructose corn syrup. Anyway, these fried potato shoestrings are just as crunchy and fatty here as I've grown to love, not to mention properly seasoned. It's a tragedy when fries aren't even given enough salt, and Chicken Shack has yet to commit that sin.  Although I have a similar drive time to both my original favorite location and this newest Chicken Shack, I'll probably head here a lot more often from now on because it's on the way home from work, and just off the highway to boot. Another plus: the TVs here have DirecTV HD.   Whether it's game time or just lunch/dinner, Chicken Shack is well worth the visit for some of the best "fast food" around. I have an inkling that they just might make this their home for a good while, but as they say, time will tell.

By far the best chicken fingers i ever had, and I am a chicken lover ... Platonically of course!  They even taste great cold, amazing quality, the sauces are very good as well...and the wings are very good as well. The fingers deserve 6 stars, hands down.
Great food for a really good price. The chicken fingers were lightly breaded and moist. The hot barbecue sauce had a nice bite and flavor. Yummy!

Well.... I was supposed to wait to try this place with my husband. But, coming out of kohls it smelt so good. Lol! I walked in and was crowded, good service. was greeted as I walked in! I ordered me a burger (well done) with bacon (extra crispy) the guy in the back was really nice (might have been the owner he was older) I think I only waited for 5 minutes. They got my order 100% correct! For $8 you get bacon (.50) charge fries and a drink. Good deal. You get a lot of fries and onions, pickles and cheese. Very delicious! I will be bringing my husband. Next is the chicken lol!

Been wanting to try this little gem....they didn't disappoint! Juicy chicken and delicious array of sauces. The fries were crispy and seasoned well. Staff was very friendly and service was remarkably fast. Definitely our new favorite spot to eat!!
This is a great chicken spot. Taste almost like a great southern chicken restaurant. I cant wait to drive back to Vegas, i will be stopping here every time!

Okay, finally tried this place. In short, it was okay. Not worth going out of your way to go to, but if you're in the neighborhood, stop in and try it. Service is exceptional, very friendly. And I wish I could say that the food was stellar...but it wasn't. It was okay.

Thanks to Bethany E. for turning me on to Chicken Shack. To my surprise after I checked in and was seated Bethany came over and introduced herself. It was a pleasure to meet you finally Bethany!  It was the lunch hour and Chicken Shack was rockin although I had no problem finding convenient parking. I opted for the six wing combo which included shoe string fries and a beverage. Service is prompt - within minutes my entree was brought to my table and I was taken back of the size of  the chicken pieces served. I chose chipotle sauce on the side which was tasty and the fries were also yummy. The portions are generous here and I couldn't finish all  the fries.  I would definitely return to the Chicken Shack.

I might be addicted to this place like how Kramer felt about Kenny Rogers Rosters.  They are super fast and the food is always ALWAYS fresh and delicious.  The sweet Chile sauce is a must for me and the fries are the best in Las Vegas.  Place is clean and the staff is always nice.
I've been coming here for over 5 years.  Amazing food!  Wings, strips and chili is the best in this city.

Amazing!   The chicken was perfectly breaded and the fries were hot and delicious!  The employees/maybe owner was super nice!  She was so cheerful and welcoming and the man was very very nice.  They made you feel like you belonged and were part of the chickens shack's family!  It's fast food but we got restaurant service.  They came out and checked on us multiple times to see if we liked it.   Anytime we are driving back from Vegas I will make it a point to stop here!  So so good.  Oh and also, the bathroom key made me giggle! Bonus: The bathrooms were clean and smelled good. If you are rolling by this place it's a must stop!

these are the best chicken wings I've had.  Now, my scope is limited to hooters, bars, and such when consuming chicken wings but, I have eaten many many chicken wings.    These are really crispy, good wing sauce, good blue cheese dressing.  I also ate the chicken fingers.  My friend didn't like them naked.  I believe these are the best chicken fingers I ate as well.  I liked the chicken fingers naked.  These fingers were thinly battered and just super fried.  Once again, you may decide that you like a whole bunch of batter on your fingers.  I haven't tried anything else. I plan on going back and finding it out.  If you are in the hood' this is the place for wings.
I just love the service here, and the food it Awesome.  Must try for everyone.  Great prices, super fast, very filling, great selection of sauces for ur wings and strips

We were missing our favorite chicken fingers from Old Chicago restaurant back in Colorado. We truly hit the jackpot with The Chicken Shack. The chicken tenders here are huge, and very tasty. I just wish there was more room to sit and eat. All tables were full. But when every table is taken, you have to know this place rocks!

Delicioso! My husband was in the mood for chicken tenders, and this location was close to us. There was no one else eating here when we arrived, so that always makes me worried about the food being fresh. We split a 5 piece basket with the fries.  As soon as we sat down, people started arriving. We first sat down in the high back, fabric covered bench seats. Well, that was kind of a mistake as we noticed all of the chicken grease all over the seats. We simply moved.   Our food came out shortly after this, and it was super hot. The chicken was excellent. The pieces were quite large, and the chicken was moist and juicy. Fries were perfectly done. This is some of the best chicken we have had in a while.

All we can say is yummy for our tummy!!!!   A co worker just told me about this place....  we were trying it....  sooooo good.  The cashier girl is really nice n sweet....and girl who brought our food to the table was so nice.  Also there was a man walking around ...  I'm thinking manager....  was making sure everyone was ok......  We will be back often.

Love this place! I've been coming here since they first opened and haven't been disappointed yet. The owners are always friendly and inviting no matter how busy the place is. Whenever I'm in this side of town it is my go to stop.

We were on our way to Vegas from Phoenix AZ, on our way to see Enrique Iglesias! With time not really on our side, we decided to grab a quick bite. The chicken Shack had the BEST reviews I had ever seen so we gave it a GO! I don't know if it was all the adrenaline rushing through my veins because we were on our way to watch my love ENRIQUE, or the fact that the food was just so delicious, and convenient. Is literally on the highway! At first i seen a long line and I freaked out but GOSH!!! All it took was a nice shot of vodka (which i carry in my purse) and i automatically started to relax. Plus all the employees were super friendly and super FAST! I ordered both wings and tenders along with fries! Everything TOP NOTCH! Restrooms were so clean ! I LOVE it! I will be going back soon! SEE YOU SOON CHICKEN TENDERS AND WINGS!!!
For a chicken place it's great they have like 20 sauces and rubs and like more than 5 side's.

Very good tenders! I can only express this rating and review on the tenders and sweet chili sauce. Both were just right. The tenders are white meat and no gristle or unwanted "parts." The breading is light enough that it doesn't fall off and crispy enough that it's not a chore to eat. I think it was seasoned well too. The sweet chili dipping sauce had just the right amount of heat and not overly sweet or gelatinous in texture, like some "sweet/sour" sauces can be. For takeout during a lunch rush, the wait was less than 10 minutes for an order of tenders. Also a plus, will be back!!

The fries were soggy and all the chicken was dried out as if it been sitting there. I see why she said be there in 5 minutes. 12 price and chilling cheese fries shouldn't be done in 5 mins. I want my 23.00 back.

Yummmm is all I have to say.  The chicken fingers were delicious. And I'm not sure of what they do to their fries but they were really good as well. I wasn't a huge fan of their new bourbon sauce or their chipotle bbq (very watery) but everything else was good. I'll definitely go again!

I like the decor in the inside of of restaurant but I would prefer going to Cane's or even Dairy Queen for better chicken strips and fries. Everything smelled delicious when I ordered it and the customer service was great, but the food did not deliver.  I ordered a 3 piece chicken strip combo with fries and a drink. My lemonade from the drink machine first tasted weird, then my fries were hella oily, and the strips were salty. The cashier suggested at check-out to try the different sauces on the side, and they were delicious.Two sauces come with the combo but the food was a huge disappointment.  I doubt if I will ever return to this eating establishment because I've had better chicken at Wendy's and other fat food chains.

Holy smokes this place is fantastic! We always pass it when going out of town, and we finally decided to give it a go. We purchased the large chicken wing family special with coslaw and fries. Y'all- the wings were huge and the sauces were delicious. It was a hit among the entire family. The staff was super nice, and the service was great. Our food came out so fast, I was almost surprised. Total bonus, they have sweet tea!! We look forward to going back.

Best chicken in Vegas! I have been coming here for 10 years and the staff make you feel right at home. Their salads are fantastic and don't forget to order the fries.   Go here and you don't want chicken any place else in Vegas.

It was a Sunday, a bit hungover and looking for that first recovery meal. I got one of the ads in the mail for a chicken restaurant. Thinking that it was just another ordinary wings place, I tried and stepped in the bright yellow and metal interior decor. I order the #3 with 3 fingers and fries and my sister had the chicken wings. The fries were crisp and abundant. Not oily and was actual cut potatoes not the frozen stuff. The fingers were not dry underneath the batter which made me not even need to dip in in the honey habanero sauce. Which was amazing by the way. My sisters wings was a bit too much batter because it overwhelmed the actual meat. But overall it was a good amount as well for the price.  I would definitely be going back to try the other menu items on a non hungover day. Thanks Chicken shack for being so close to the house!

This is one of the best chicken places in the Southeast area.  Most people go for the wings but they also have a flavorful grilled option; even more delicious when coupled with their signature honey barbecue sauce.   Bottom line: great food, drinks, and friendly people. Definitely recommend!

OMG!! who would guess that the best chicken fingers and wings are served here.  The restaurant is very clean and the staff is very friendly.  Make sure you stop here when you're in Boulder City and enjoy the food which is served hot and delicious with little waiting.  Huge variety of flavors from mild to damn hot!  I will become a regular.

I love the chicken fingers and dipping sauces the bbq baked beans were okay the potatoe salad and macaroni salad are amazing the only Thing I didn't like the past couple times is my food took over 25 mins the guy hooked it up with larges so Im not tripping

Dude, this is some awesome fried chicken! Jesus, I love it! The breading is just perfect, not too heavy and the chicken is so moist. I don't know how they do it. The fries are nice and crisp and salty and accompany the chicken so well.   The restaurant is a little hole in the wall, things can get pretty cramped in there. It's a place to grab you chicken, eat it fast and get out there. If you do take it home though it is also tasty; with some places the fries would get soggy but these retain their crispness.  It's damn good fried chicken. Nuff said.

This is the second time I've tried "The Chicken Shack". I have to admit that the product they use in their preparations is top shelf, the wings were plump and juicy (I've seen smaller drumsticks!). I also like the crunchy nature of their recipe. Still, two things disappoint me, one the crunchiness of the product is diminished by the buildup of steam in their to go packaging. Also, they lack charisma at the point of sale, I wish the employees enjoyed themselves more.

Best chicken in the valley!!! Killing wingstop in many ways too! Used to visit twice a week when I lived nearby. Variety of sauces you can choose from: garlic parm, spicy BBQ, habanero, jerk, original hot, etc..... Great place for watching sports too!  The only issue is that they charge for ranch, blue cheese. I feel like it should be included with wings but I don't mind paying cuz i needs my ranch! Would recommend anyone looking for quality chicken!

What is fry sauce? Synthetic Innout sauce. It tasted so fake, I don't even want to know what's in it. The honey mustard also still tasted like it was made in a laboratory and was not meant to be consumed. What are you guys using to make this stuff?!  The chicken is oily and heavy on the breading. Choose fingers over wings. If you're looking for wings go elsewhere. The fries are shoestring fries and they're pretty good if you get lucky. If you're unlucky, they'll be overfried and you'll regret eating them. The sauces for the chicken are all free, the other sauces, such as fry sauce, are 39 cents.
Forget visiting the hoover dam. Visit this place. Looks like an old gas station, but the chicken was real good!!!!!!

Today I had my first experience with The Chicken Shack on a recommendation from a new client. She suggested that I order the #4 combo (3 wings and 3 chicken fingers with fries and a drink).   The staff is fabulous! Rachael was behind the counter to take my order and answered my questions regarding the flavors very patiently after welcoming me with a big smile.  The chicken was lightly battered, moist, juicy and delicious. You drizzle or dip into the flavor as you like. In my opinion, the sauce is not even necessary because the chicken itself has such a great taste. The fries were wonderful; not limp or greasy like some places and there were a ton of them. I ate as much as I could and brought the rest of my meal home for dinner.  I would highly recommend this place and will certainly return again!

Rothman S.'s review is so accurate!   I went to this place based on the recommendation of a co-worker and I prefer to support independents.    It's noon/lunch hour and I can not imagine placing a less welcoming person at the register/order station. NOT A HINT of a smile came across that woman's face and the entire time she was taking my order she had her blue eyes starring out the window. NO LIE; I looked behind me to see what was in the parking lot that was so damn captivating.  I must admit she did make eye contact one time; when I handed her my twenty bucks.    There was no one tending/cleaning the empty tables, so if you came after me; enjoy the crumbs & spilled sauce!   I have an idea, put Ms. Personality on busboy duty and allow customers to yell their order to the cook in the kitchen!  She'd be less appalling and the next customer wouldn't have stains on the elbows of their long sleeve shirt!   I end this by stating my opinion about the food because that's all that really matters, right?  Simply; the chicken was consistent with the service.  F

After paying respects to my Dad at the Veterans Memorial,  my daughter was hungry. So I let her choose the spot. I'm happy with her choice. The chicken was juicy and not over cooked and dry. Flavors were delicious.  Definitely recommend the Chicken Shack to friends and family. And the lady and guy, I'm assuming they were owners, were really nice and concerned on how the food and services were.. signs of a passionate owners of their craft.. I love the habanero honey sauce! But that's 1 of many selection of sauces. We'll be there again and curious to try the other sauces and menu selections.. good eats!!

I work in the pharmaceutical industry, and do a lot of catered lunch and learns at doctors offices on the daily, so I'm very picky about takeout. This place is the first place I have ever ventured to yelp about... that's how good it is. Before my life in pharma sales, right after graduate school;  I even opened one of those, "don't believe the hype", over-priced chicken restaurants on the strip. This chicken was as good, if not better than the southern-style chicken restaurant that I opened on the strip in Vegas!!!  Don't waste your time with anyplace else Vegas! Plus, as a former cocktail server, I'm picky about service, and this place was top notch!   The only time that an entire doctors office has given me rave reviews for the catering!
Amazing food and wonderful customer service.  I can't stop bragging about this place!!

I've gotten Chicken Shack 3 times. The first 2 times were around lunch time, and I thought the food was amazing (I've only had the fingers and wings so far.) I LOVED the fries. The third time I went there was a Friday afternoon, and everything had less flavor, even the sauce. The fries were really soggy and seemed like they were undercooked as well.  I'll try again, though, and hopefully that one Friday was just a fluke.
Ate here Once fell in love.It was finger licking good,I would go there at least twice a week or more, if you really like eating Chicken Wings.

My girlfriend and I arrived at Chicken Shack at 8:30 on a Friday night. As we walked in most of the dining area had the chairs on top if the table tops and an employee was sweeping the room. I find this so annoying as they aren't supposed to close for another half hour. When I ordered the guy behind the counter seemed like he wished we hadn't walked in. He turns and asks the cook if the fryer is "still on". Why wouldn't it be on?  You don't close for another 30 minutes. We sit at one of the few remaining tables to wait for our food. When my order comes up they call my name and say "Aaron! Togo!"  Umm, no I didn't order it togo, but we can take your rude hint and we leave. I work in the restaurant industry and I know that your closing time means that's when you stop taking orders or seating people. Sorry if you had big plans for a Friday night but I had plans too. Plans to get some delicious fried chicken wings and fingers and hang out with my girl. We left very disappointed on our first and LAST experience at Chicken Shack, and not due to the food though which was very good. But there are too many great spots in town where we can get good food AND at least decent service.

As an avid chicken tender fan,  my boyfriend and I are always looking for the next best chicken tenders.   We decided to give this place a try,  and I will say I am presently impressed.   The place it's self is kind of a hole in the wall,  the decor consists of 'why did the chicken cross the road" jokes,  and license places on the walls from various states it's self.    Service is very fast,  and friendly.   We both decided to order the five piece chicken tender meal considering of five tenders  some fries and a drink.   I was pleased to see that they had am array of different seasonings and sauces to go with your chicken. Including chilli,  hot,  mild,   lemon pepper,  and sweet garlic.  I decided to get lemon pepper seasoning,  and a side of honey mustard.  The chicken it's self it nice,  crispy,  and juicy... Magically everything you could possibly want in a chicken tender.  Unlike canes,  I actually really enjoyed their skinny fries that came with the meal.    I was an avid canes lover.... Now it looks like im more of a chicken shack fan.   All and all I'm very impressed with the food,  and service,  and will be coming back soon.

I am so so so disappointed after my latest experience tonight. I ordered a 20 piece finger meal and a large fries. They offer 4 "free" dipping sauces ( I got our chicken plain) and they have like 15-20 sauces to choose from, BUT they charge for ranch and honey mustard...how do they offer so many flavors but charge for the staples?? It felt bad greedy!! To charge for the most popular sauces for chicken fingers so they know they can get a couple of extra bucks out of you feels shady. Then when I get home and feed it to my family the chicken tasted like it was fried in really old or burnt oil and had such an unpleasant taste and even worse aftertaste.... my kids don't even want to eat it. I spent close to 40-50 bucks (  my bill came to 63 dollars because of misunderstanding on my order so 20 was refunded and then charged an additional charge, because of this I am unsure of the amount of my bill,) but I assume its pretty close to $50. I think this will be my last visit! Super disappointing. They did have great employees who were kind and inviting. Still, that will not make up for bad tasting chicken and greedy additional charges.

This is a good little spot i stopped in for lunch and got the 3 piece combo they have quite a few options for sauces this time i got the chipotle bbq verry tasty and the ranch was on point the breading on the chicken fingers is really good but the quality of the chicken itself is a bit on the cheap side, the fries were perfection and the portion is big, The lady on the counter isnt verry friendly any time i come in but gets the job done but a smile wouldn't  hurt
Recently reviewed this restaurant which I love! Fast food and friendly service. Had to come back with an updated picture of my favorite. The 6 piece of wings and fries tossed in hot.
I have to admit, their Chicken Strip are the best I have ever had!!!!  And they are very quick with your order!!! The Service is great!!!

Awesome wings. We showed up three minutes to close and were about to get back in the truck when the young man came out and said we will serve you! How awesome! They were so friendly and accommodating and the food was outrageously delicious.

Not impressed... The wings are WAY to greasy and chicken strips are too dry. I've been here twice, hoping I'll feel differently the next time around but no... A selection of sauces is nice but the wing and strips are lacking. As you bite in, you taste old oil, ew.

Wow, this place has amazing chicken wings! It looks like it was an old drive in, but they don't have car hops. Loved the wings, and the chicken fingers were good. Definitely an awesome value! Glad my family decided to stop here!

They really know how to make  Chicken!!!  I really loved everything there especially their fries  were amazing and if you get tired of the same taste guess what?! They have a bunch of different sauces you can dip your chicken or fries in. This is my go to spot in Boulder!
Omg! The best chicken fingers i think I've ever had so good!!! Can't wait to come back again.

Meh tasting. I got 10 chicken tenders and the happy hour special with hot wings. Chicken was crispy on the outside and moist inside but not flavorful and very greasy. The grease in my stomach and intense thirst woke me and my friend up in the middle of the night! The fries are skinny but plentiful. Generous portions (we couldn't finish between 3 hungry people), cheap beer and nice staff though!

I loved the Chicken Shack! We told the man helping us it was our first time and he was very helpful in explaining all he different options. I had the wings tossed in medium sauce (buffalo sauce). My husband had the #4 (half wings, half chicken fingers) with chili cheese fries. Everything was so good! We also for a side of fry sauce and it was delicious.   The inside was on the smaller side, but the patio had plenty of seating. We ate outside because we brought our two dogs with us. I'm always weary of taking the dogs because not every place is dog friendly. The staff was super friendly and specifically came out to say hi to our pups and even gave them a piece of grilled chicken. They also had a water bowl for them.   The whole restaurant was nice and clean (bathrooms too)! My husband and I will defiantly be back!!

I have been waiting for The Chicken Shack to open since I saw the signs about a month ago. This new  location on Rainbow is great for your chicken cravings. Deliciously juicy chicken fingers and wings for a good price. Wings are quite large. My boyfriend and I were able to share three fingers and a few wings. Ask for sauces on the side as the chicken is fine and a bit salty (and oily) on its own. That is probably the only downfall but good in an unhealthy way ha. Shoe string fries have a nice crunch.
This place is pretty good. Staff is friendly and food arrive fast. The chicken fingers taste delicious and they are nicely sized. Wasn't a huge fan of their fries, but would return back.

Despite driving by this place more times than I can count I didn't even know this place existed. At my last Yelp event Bethany E. was telling me about this spot and how great it was. Once it was brought to my attention I finally noticed it while driving by. So, Saturday comes around and my husband and I doing the thing where we run through 50 options before picking a lunch spot.  My husband remembered that we wanted to try this spot and we knew it had to be done.  This spot was busy on a Saturday afternoon which was a good sign. We decided to get our order to go and it didn't take long for it to be prepared. The guy at the counter was friendly. The prices are great as well.  I really liked the chicken fingers. There is plenty of white meat and the breading is really good. The breading was light and seemed like it was made fresh for our order, not kept in a heater until served. The French fries were really good. The large order was way too many fries, a small would have been enough for two to share. I'd been craving macaroni salad and this macaroni salad really hit the spot. I loved it. The sauce options are crazy. There are so many. We ordered about six because we couldn't decide. My favorite was the Honey BBQ with the Sweet Chili coming in second.   Great food and great prices. This spot definitely beats the chicken chain that is completely overrated.

We ordered the Shack Pack with the 20 fingers to go.  The place is small with some inside and outside seating.  We didn't have any trouble finding a table right away.   It was good but my favorite was their baked beans!
Just what you expect it to be. Great chicken strips, great fries, great sauces.

The service was quick and the chicken was crispy and juicy and not too oily. Their serving sizes are good and filling. Their sauces weren't as good as good as canes' and you can get more from canes for the same price, but if I were in the area I'd go there again
I tried the chicken strips and the wings and they were both excellent. The sauces are good, and they have a good selection of them. Definitely better than Canes or any place like that

Imma start off by saying me and my boyfriend know wings. Nothing is ever spicy enough for him. Finally had a chance to try it here after some co workers recommended. My boyfriend had the damn hot and the habanero honey. I got the creamy garlic parm and the sweet chili. He got combo #4 and then I just got a five piece finger. We split all the food. We are both sitting in the car right now holding our stomachs. Lol. Soooo good! Literally no complaints. We did have to wipe down our own table. But this is an older hole in the wall with a reputation of good chicken. They have cheap beer and a tv playing the game for people who are into that. Definetly  making the trip out here to eat. Well worth it. When I asked my boyfriend how did this compare to bdubs he said and I quote "this place shits on bdubs" lol and we used to be regular bdub custies. So.. Nuff said. Enjoy!
Love this place, I was very happy when they opened the second location. Customer service is great and the food never disappoints.

Stopped here on our long drive from Phoenix to SLC. The wings, chicken strips, and fries were great. I elected to have my sauce on my wings while my husband and daughter had them on the side. I think they were better on the wings. Lots of different sauce flavors and dipping choices.  A hole in the wall kind of joint where the food far exceeds the decor. Big rubber chicken key chain for the bathroom a nice touch.  Will come back for sute.

Wow! It should be called CheapSkate Shack! We are obviously regulars here (ashamed to say Dukedom) and they wouldn't let us have a water cup...basically accusing us of trying to steal soda. My daughter drinks water or soda. If she wanted soda today, we would have bought a soda like all the other times before. But to hassle regular customers about a stupid water cup is RIDICULOUS!!  Being the greasy dive you are CS, you will attract the less than savory crowd who take advantage of water cup privileges. Solve the problem without insulting your regular paying clientele! Also from the lack of cleanliness in your dining area...you could do for a health inspection.

I was by the area on vacation and it was recommended by the locals. I have to say I'm not a fan of fried chicken but this was great. Not greasy!  Nice people serving you. Loved the wide sauce selection.
Great tasting chicken wings and strips! Well maintained restaurant space and rest room. Very pleasant environment. A MUST TRY!

Chicken Shack is a great restaurant! It's a real mom & pop place.  I can't eat any thing breaded due to my gluten allergy. They make me the chicken tenders but without the breading and it is delicious! You can really tell it's good quality chicken. They also make a great chicken salad.  This little spot is great! Stop by and see what you have been missing.
The food was good and came out quicker then expected. A must try if your a local or visitor.

On our way back to Vegas from Hoover Dam, I accidentally stopped here. Family owned business that is friendly. "Damn Hot" sauce is Damn good. I ate here and ordered more "Damn Hot" wings to munch on, in Vegas. The fries are really good too. You won't regret coming here at all.

Amazing!!!! These are the BEST wings! Small little place but the chicken is freaking amazing. I get so excited when I order from here. They are fast too. The garlic parmesan dry wings are my fav! My husbands the honey bbq and my daughter. I do not enjoy the fries but they wings are to well worth it.

Breaded chicken strips and fries are amazing! Chicken strips are really thick and tender as well. They also carry an amazing array of dipping sauces! One interesting note is that the fries are super thin and crispy. They are truly addicting!!
One of the best places to go to in Boulder City. This is the best chicken shack location in the valley.
Great chicken, super nice folks making it.  We just happened to stop while road tripping and were pleasantly surprised by the portions and how good it was.  I wish they were in Phoenix!

Their wings are huge compared to the other "chain" wings joints. I adored their honey garlic wings, but not a big fan of the lemon pepper wings which was too salty and couldn't really taste the lemon or the pepper. Their thin cut fries are also great and a great value. We'll definitely come back the next time we're in Vegas.
It's GREAT!! Hand made chicken tenders. Unbelievable! Friendly staff, clean and great taste!

This place stands the test of time! I have been eating Chicken Shack since it was called "Chicken Bonz" and the food is always great. It's hip, and truly a local jewel!   I think the only thing about this place is a quote on the wall about immigrants that seems very offensive... But other than that this place is cool.

This place is pretty good.  I miss the old seafood place that had the best crab strips in town but the chicken here is pretty good.  The BBQ sauce is a bit too "runny" but the flavor is fine.  The Chicken wings and tenders are pretty good size and you won't go away hungry.  They give you enough fries to feed the neighbors!  For chicken, we're now down to Popeye's and The Chicken Shack.  And...they just opened another restaurant on St. Rose Parkway and 7 Hills!

After a small lunch at Hot Dog Heaven in Henderson,  I was ravenous come dinner time. After reading the great reviews of the Chicken Shack I knew my hunger Blues were about to end.  This small restaurant was jammed with people which is always a good sign. I got the 5 piece Chicken Fingers with fries. Calling them fingers is misleading as they are very big cuts of breast meat that are expertly coated and fried to perfection. The seasoning on the chicken was a letdown as it was way too salty. The sauces are all house made and my Honey Garlic helped out my salty chicken quite a bit.  Overall a decent meal that is close to being great once they get the seasoning down.

An amazing place in a store front complex who not only serves amazing fingers with a variety of choices of sauce, but also sells beer, so you have have amazing wings or fingers with a beer, what a deal in a small store front environment.  The food is actually very good and the staff extremely friendly.  It really does not matter if it is your first time or you have been many times, you are treated like you have been coming there for a long time and they are always happy to see you.  I like this place and highly recommend this place if you are looking for a snack or a meal, either way it is a place worth trying.
Great food and very friendly staff /  new owners!   Will be back lots. Had the chicken strips and chili.  Both were the bomb!

There hot sauce is super good!!! They make really good chicken strips too. The people working there are very nice.  The only critique is I wish they had more chicken sandwiches on their menu or variety
They are fast good and their chicken quality/size leave others crying  in their buffalo sauce. If their burger buns didn't disintegrate, they would be   better with me. Love it.
This place is the real deal: lightly breaded chicken breast tenders with a wide choice of dipping sauces and delicious fries. The service is very friendly and the atmosphere is casual.
Awesome chicken wings! Ordered 6 wing combo with fries and a drink and I was so full! Crunchy wings with great sauce on the side! Great and fast service! Will go back again!

Had a great experience as always. The owner suggested we have a Family platter. 25 wings 2 LG sides and 4 drinks..Good suggestion since there were 8 of us. Food was out fast they adjusted the tables to accommodate us. Thanks Chicken Shack.. see you on our next cheat day!

This place was alright. We were incredibly hungover and cruising around town when we spotted this place. Food was greasy and the tables were dirty but I was in no position to be picky.  The food did its job. Soaked up all that Fat Tuesday  Nothing I would go out of my way for. Meh

We stopped here after a trip to the Hoover Dam and are happy we did. The chicken fingers were amazing!!!  The burgers were delicious. Everything was cooked fresh and came out hot. It was fast and the employees were super friendly. The portions were huge. Definitely on our list of places to revisit!  It's hard to find good food and friendly people, but this place has both.

It was 7pm, I was jonesin' for some chicken, didn't want to cook, so I looked to Facebook and my fellow yelpers for good places to grab some chicken. The reviews for this place were great, and a lot of my friends cursed me out because I have lived here for 4 years and never tried this place.    First things first:  Pros: Short drive from my house Cheap combination plates Festive decor   Cons:  Was a little put off at the guy mopping the floor while I was eating.    The food is amazing!! And they give you a LOT of it. I ordered the #4, 3 chicken fingers,  3 wings, fries & a drink (with ranch)  $10 & some change. The fries, shoestring, are so good and seasoned (which is rare out here cause everyone is afraid of seasoning). I couldn't even finish. Ate 1 finger and one wing, handful of fries, and I was done. Will definitely return, definitely recommend.
Awesome chicken wings with beer! We ordered the sweet spicy and teriyaki extra crispy.

There were a lot of kids just hanging out... that's not bad but.... the shop was playing rap type music... not my taste....  the food was not great... Canes chicken is much better and better prices... I will not be going back there!!
Just opened recently, great food and awesome customer service.  The fingers are my favorite by far. Will be back

Really some of the best wings I've ever had. Their batter is crisp and thick without being unnecessarily greasy. I had 6 wings smothered in honey bbq and dipped the other 6 in bleu cheese dressing.  Their wings are pretty huge too so get a bunch but don't be afraid to share! the staff is also super nice
First time tip: ask for the sauce on the side - wings perfect as they are, undressed!

After 5 years and many more experiences with wings... I still have to say that this place is my all time fav! The wings are lightly dusted with flour and friend to crispy perfection. Habanero Honey is still the best flavor. The wings are pretty big... We ordered 12 and that feed two people. The kicker? We ended up with 14 in our order!   Wish Sacramento has a place like this... I miss vegas because of this spot!! Worth the drive from the strip!

This location was conveniently right across Highway 93 from our camping spot.  The had fun decor with license plates on the wall, funny celebrity quotes, and photos of dogs on the walls.  This place is very popular and stays busy most of the time.  The staff was friendly and attentive.  You can get your own fountain drinks in the dining area, and can sit inside or outside.  We came over for dinner and ordered the Three Chicken Tenders meal with a side of french fries.  You can choose one dipping sauce with the meal and can buy others.  I got a side of teriyaki and blue cheese.  The chicken was moist and tender with a crispy tempura-like breading.  The downside is that it seemed to have a texture to it that I didn't really care for.  I was kind of "waxy" upon chewing that made it difficult for me to eat.  It wasn't a bad flavor but texture only.  I might opt for a bone in chicken wing meal next time to avoid the texture issue.

Holly chicken! This place is good. It's homy, mom n pop owned and the service is as friendly as it gets. Not to mention clean and well, the chicken is incredibly delicious. Perfectly bartered and fried. The string fries are crunchy and as golden as their customer service.  Oh and they offer a military discount:)  Definitely coming back when I'm in the area again!

The place is a fast food outlet in competition with Raising Cane's. Service is good, but a but a bit on the pricy side. Chicken fingers and wings are not crispy. The fries are soggy and the sauces are forgettable. It's just ok. You could do worse, but I prefer Cane's.

This place has the best wings and chicken fingers... they are so crispy and delicious! The wings taste like mini pieces of fried chicken. I don't know what they use for breading, but it's delicious. My 10yr old son said that the chicken fingers were the "best he'd ever had"! The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because they don't have "honey-hot" for a sauce option. I tried their honey garlic and honey habenero, but it didn't satisfy my craving for honey hot sauce.... luckily I had the stuff to make my own at home.

Why did the chicken cross the road? Every table at Chicken Shack was full so I took out my chicken and crossed Mountain Vista Road with it to the Ethal M. Cactus Gardens picnic table. So much for my joke, here is my review of Chicken Shack. It is based on my two recent lunch time visits that were on July 9 and today.      Chicken Shack is a small restaurant in the Smith's and Barley's Casino-anchored Shopping center that has masses of people shocking to the southeast corner of Sunset and Mountain Vista. The two times that I have shocked here in the mid afternoon, the place was packed. Today, I barely landed a table when a couple left. I came close to having to take it out to Ethal. M Cactus Gardens for an impromptu picnic. The reason that Chicken Shack is so popular is that they serve quality food at prices that won't burden the wallet in an upbeat environment.     It is funny that many of the hole in the  places that I have dined in are the most fun places to dine in. Chicken Shack is a quintessential example. Adorning the walls are humorous quotes related to chicken jokes, the Chicken Shack mascot that reminds me of a yellow version of Foghorn Leghorn, and license plates from all over. Supposedly every state licence plate is represented on these walls. Here is an example of one of the humorous quotes on the walls of Chicken Shack:      "In my day, we didn't ask why the chicken crossed the road. Someone told us that the chicken crossed the road and that was good enough."  Grandpa    What is not a joke is the food. And plenty of food! On both of my visits I'd order a combo. The combo includes shoestring fries and a Pepsi fountain beverage. In response to the previous Yelpers stating that the shoestring fries were good, I say "Ditto."     On Friday, July 9; I ordered six chicken wings dipped in a hot garlic honey sauce. The price of the meal was $9.95. If I opted for one of the sundry dipping sauces, I'd pay an additional 50 cents. After taking my $ and name, they brought the food to my table a few minutes later. Sharing the table with the chicken wings combo was a roll of paper towels. They were necessary. These chicken wings were the stickiest finger food that I remember eating in a long time. This might go down as the stickiest finger food or thing that I reviewed on Yelp. I got extraordinary use out of the paper towels. With that said, Chicken Shack chicken wings and texting is a bad combination. When I got past the consistent reaching back and forth to the paper towels, the chicken wings were all right. They were loaded with  white meat and flavor.     Today, I ordered the chicken sandwich combo for $6.99. They gave me a choice between crispy and grilled. I chose grilled. It was worth the long wait. This leads into me recommending passing over Chicken Shack if your in a hurry. This isn't a fast food joint where the chicken is sitting under a lamp. When the chicken sandwich arrived, I was like, "Wow." The sandwich was stuffed with three mutant chicken fingers, lettuce, onions, and tomatoes next to a large portion of shoestring fries. Two of the pictures below show the giant sandwich. It is safe to say that I did not leave hungry.      In the future I conceive visiting Chicken Shack to put their chicken fingers to the test. Ideally this will be at their Boulder City location after hiking. In the present I give Chicken Shack my 4 star stamp of approval.

We eat here all the time - we drive across town to get our Chicken Shack fix! Best chicken fingers - fresh, juicy and thick. I always get the kids meal and am stuffed! Their fries are delicious. I don't know what they season them with but they're yummy! I've tried a lot of their sauces the habanero honey is my go to fave. Small place - always busy!

It's awesome they Bread their chicken at the place , but so does Chick-Fil-A (which is actually good). The chicken and fries are super salty, and for waiting about five minutes, I would have expected hot food. They ask you if you want any sauces then charge you extra without telling you. The fry sauce is okay and the honey mustard is good. The sweet tea is pretty good.

I have recently relocated to the area from the east coast and a huge wing lover.  Currently on a diet but wanted some wings for my cheat day.  Found this place on yelp and they had pretty good reviews.  When I drove up I knew it was about ambiance but all about the food.  The lady at the counter was helping someone else but still greeted me with a pleasant hello and was i pick8up or ordering.  I order a 12 piece wing and #2 tender combo.  You can have your wings sauced there or dip them yourself. I asked for my wings to be extra crispy and they were perfect and good size pieces.  The fries were great and sauces diluted enough for dipping or coating your chicken perfectly.  I WILL BE BACK VERY SOON.  You can place large orders as well with 30min notice.

First of all, it is relatively expensive for what it is.  Family of 4, 2 adults and 2 children under 10, $40.  That seems a bit much imo.    I got a chicken mozzarella wrap with the cucumber salad.  $10 w/o a drink.  Wrap was actually very good, cucumber salad was a bowl of cucumbers with straight, potent apple cider vinegar poured on it.  Way to strong a vinegar flavor to be edible.    My wife got a chicken Caesar wrap with Mac and cheese. Wasn't very impressed.    Friends that met us here got a chicken meal with mashed potatoes.  Chicken wasn't bad, potatoes weren't impressive.   Drink dispenser sprays soda all over your wrist.    Brought the wrong order to our table and weren't very friendly when we brought it back to them.  They replaced it, but didn't really say sorry or anything or even speak to us about it. They looked mad at their staff, took the wrong stuff away and didn't say anything.  I stood there for a bit and then told them, "I guess I'll go sit back down and wait for it." and they didn't reply.   Simply, it wasn't overly impressive for $40.  Won't be returning

This is my first experience at a Chicken Shack and I was pleasantly surprised! The tenders are battered perfectly and I love the skinny, salty fries.  My favorite part is the endless amount of sauces  Sauce heaven and endless flavors, I can't wait to try them all! Also, game changer, diced buffalo chicken tenders on their SALAD. Don't sleep on it- it's bomb!

First timer here and am please to say I was greeted with a smile and some great recommendations on the flavors to try. Portions are healthy, no anemic wings here!  Easy in and out, clean, fast too! Portions were seasoned well and fried to perfection! Would definitely recommend a visit and am sure you'd be glad you did.

Idk where to start, I feel like my boyfriend moved around the corner for this place. Their chicken wings are massive and seasoned to perfection!!! Literally come here at least once a week. They never disappoint and the staff there is tight af.

If you are driving from AZ to Vegas (& vise versa) this is a great place to stop! Its not a chain, the woman working the register was extremely friendly. The chick was done perfect. Not overly seasoned. The best part is all the sauces they have

My first time at the Chicken Shack great little concept lot of fun good energy very tasty food. I ordered the Cajun wings as well as lemon pepper with celery sticks and carrots instead of fries; to stay healthy. Then they gave me a nice little sampling of the damn hot sauce with habanero and jalapeno ground up chili great kit great flavor really enjoy this place I will be back.

Well my first time at the chicken shack SUCKED not due to taste, however, due to the fact that The CHICKEN Shack was out of CHICKEN FINGERS. How could their staff allow for this to happen? Use a better inventory system

By far my favorite place to go for fried chicken. My family and I have been going here for years. I'm a regular and my usual is the #3 with garlic parmesan and ranch but I have branched out and tried other flavors as well and I love almost all of them.   If you're in the mood for some good chicken fingers or wings, this is the place to go! Also, if you're there later in the day be sure to say "hi" to Zeke.

This place is not bad. My wife were on vacation in Vegas and wanted some wings. Tired of buffets! So we went here, the place is not far from the strip. The place is in a strip mall. We walk in and didn't know what to expect, we found this place on yelp and decided to give this place a try. We ordered some wings, fingers, fries and coleslaw. The wings were good but a little salty for my taste, the fingers were bad had to chew on them for hours before I could swallow the darn thing, will not order fingers again!
