Coleslaw was bland nothing to rave about. The fries were good, string fries. The tables were not clean. The hot sauce and ketchup bottle was crusty. The workers looked high from smoking weed. This place has good wings but I guess it's a hit or miss with the sauce you choose. Will I go here again, probably yes. I will give them another try.

Went one time and got fried chicken and fries combo. Chicken had a nice crispness but was sooooo salty it was kind of hard to eat. I would go again because I have heard good things, so it's worth giving a try.

I like that i have the option to do grill or friend chicken. The portion sizes are great for the prize, especially compared to caines. The sauces are the best haberno honey is so good. Also really like the fry sauce. I recommend to call ahead because there is always a wait.

Took a bit of a drive to visit Chicken Shack and I am glad I did.  I walked in and looked at the menu and thought to myself that I could put down a 5 piece chicken fingers easy so I better get some wings to back them up. The portions here are huge and they also have the best fingers I've had in town so far. I was delighted. I love Fried Chicken so much that I drive to L.A. just to eat at Roscoe's, The Chicken Lady, and KyoChon. I am happy this place is here because I would have to drive to L.A. for it too.  Thank you Jaime W. for letting me in on your little secret. I'm hooked, I need to come back here again.

Stopped in Tuesday evening, had the garlic parmesan chicken wings, delicious. I have been to many other locations that served wings and this one became my favorite, more meat than any others. Nice patio to sit and enjoy your meal and wonderful staff
Best chicken place in Vegas!!! You get a lot of food for $10 and you can taste the quality. Every time I go there they never disappoint!
The chicken was good but the fries are thin and get cold fast,for what little food you get.. its pretty pricey. But at least we can say we have tried this place out.

The guys behind the counter are really nice and the sauces were delicious: spicy ranch and sweet chili had just the right amount of heat.  However, my chicken tenders (which they did give me extras of! Very nice) were unevenly cooked and pretty dry. I had to douse them in sauce to chew them. As nice as the service was, I would expect a place that specializes in chicken tenders to ensure that their tenders weren't dry....so unfortunately even though the sauces, thin matchstick French fries, and service were excellent, I wouldn't return to this place.m

Yelp marked my previous review as "not recommend" maybe because they thought it was fake.   It wasn't, but you can't contact yelp, so I'm adding another.  The Chicken Shack is definitely worth the 5-star I gave it on the first review. This is the best chicken I have ever eaten. Fast and delicious. Great dipping sauces for the chicken. I like Sweet Chili and Spicy Blue Cheese sauce.  Love this place!

I wasn't impressed.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't a head turner either.    The chicken strips are large white meat pieces and the wings are large and breaded.  It just seemed plain to me.  I wasn't told until I finished ordering that I can pick the flavor sauce I want to add to my chicken.  First time here, so I had no idea.  I paid extra for a larger ranch, fry sauce, and spicy blue cheese.    The double cheeseburger was large and delicious. I would have that again.   The location is clean and well stocked.  The girls were cleaning and stocking what was already pretty tidy while we were there.

I walked 2 miles up the street from my house to try this place, I went on my daily walk and I ordered three fingers with fries and a drink. They gave me 4 instead of 3, not a complaint there. The chicken is delicious and the fingers are huge portions, they are huge, the fries were ok, very thin but still fries lol. I ate two and was full. Regardless I shared the rest with boyfriend, he liked them too, the sauces are great, lots of variety for sauces, you can pick two with any combo and they are bigger cups. Definitely enough ssauce for your meal. I would say, worth it!

I have to say that I am VERY picky when it comes to my french fries and let me tell you I fell in love with these fries at first taste! I got 3 wings and 3 fingers with fries and a drink. I had a very hard time getting through 2 wings and a chicken finger because I filled up on the amazing fries! I cant wait to come back and try another one of their sauces
One of my favorite quick stops. 10 minutes and I am on my way with 20 chicken tenders that are awesome with there sauces.  And not to mention the large french fries come in a huge box.

Always a pleasant and satisfactory meal at chicken shack, this time was no difference. Had the #1 wings with jerk sauce on the side, perfectly cooked and delicious. Partner had the #2 finger meal, a bit over cooked but overall satisfied. Cheap beer, cheap wings, good sauce. Nothing else to say but bring some towelettes. Recommend wing sauce on side if you are taking out.

This place is SO GOOD!!! This is actually the first place ive ate wings since I moved to Vegas a few years ago. And danggg i'm so happy I live right around the corner!!!! Hubby and I tried the medium sauce wings.  The wings are a nice size, super juicy, perfect amount of breading/crunch. Also the sauce was PERFECT!!! Only issue was No dipping sauce was included with our to-go order (perhaps you are supposed to tell them you want some; we were never even asked if we wanted any) Normally I'd detract a star for something like this. But the wings were so good that it honestly wasn't a huge deal not having anything to dip them in.  This is def my new wing spot!!! Cant wait to try their tenders :)

Food was just okay.  Service was blah. Ordered large 25 wings with large fries and 3 drinks. Even tipped the cashier (even though there is no reason to. ..they don't do anything)and when we sat down we saw that there was a family meal-exactly what we got-but with another side and 1 more drink that was cheaper.  She's didn't even bother to suggest it to us. When she brought the food over I asked her and all she did was shake her head. Horrible customers service! They could have saved me money. ..

Excellent chicken wings. Made from fresh not frozen. Chicken salad also excellent. Big enough to split. Superb shoestring french fries.. wish they would sell just a half order of chicken tenders and french fries at half the regular price. Portions too big

I've been going to the Sunset location for 2-3 years. They have in my opinion have some of the best wings. I was excited to see that a new location was opening closer to my neighborhood.  Like other reviewers said, this location is not as busy as the Sunset location, which is nice. I ordered take-out on a Sunday and when I went to pick it up, there were only two tables of people inside. I usually get bone-in wings tossed in Sweet Chili and Habanero Honey sauce with a large coleslaw. Their wings are super crispy, just how I like them! Service is also better than the other location, but that might be because this location is not as busy as the other one. Anyways, go try their wings! you won't regret.

I can't thing of anything bad I've had here. Always been a pretty good experience. In fact now I think I'm hungry lol. I always feel like it's a tad bit over priced when checking out but remember that's it's worth it once I eat.
Great wings... WAY better than BWW and cheaper too.  Very small place so be prepared to share a table or get it to go.

Looked long and hard to find some good, home-cookin'-type fried chicken wings like back home in Chicago, and I found them. I work in the area, and I hate it when I hear someone say they're going here for a lunch run, 'cause I have to put in an order! And the best part? They're consistently good and fresh. The fries are still hot by the time they get back to the office. The service is always quick, no matter how crowded it is. This is how a business should be run. LOVE LOVE this place. Keep it up guys!
Always juicy AF and crispy at the same time , pretty sure its witchcraft but love is love with the way their hot AF chicken - Now I gotta to order ..I'm out and hungry AF

Taste like moms fried chicken Yummy! And who could beat the $1 draft beer, great baked beans and mustard potato salad. (Why do most people make it mayo? It's just not right.) The family was divided on which sauce is the best. Top picks: chili lime, honey BBQ, Jamaican Jerk. Oh and my daughter believes the tea rates right up there with good southern tea.

Thinking about wings to hang with my son and instead of Buffalo Wild Wings, we to Chicken Shack based on yelp review from Bethany E.  She gave it a five star and I am glad we tried it!  a.  Location - In a funky odd strip mall near to the great Ross J Aloha Grill!  Plenty of parking and space.  This is a very small place that can seat perhaps 30 people approximately.  b.  The fare - Here you can get hamburger, chicken strips, chili and the famous chicken wings.  You can buy by quantity or in combos.  We decided the 25 piece for 22.89 and also the fries.   c.  The taste - Nice and plump wings with a crispy textured coating. Very nice. Not greasy or anything, just right. The sauces come in a variety of flavors that are given to you free based on the quantity you order.   d.  The extras - If you want something like ranch or blue cheese, this will cost you like .39c per small cup.  Odd, but okay.  The veggies of carrots and celery cost you and is considered a side.  They have small and large side portions including macaroni salad and potato salad.  I am sure there were other things I am missing here as I was focused on the wings.  e.  Speaking of wings - Further to my comments, I did like the wings, however, the ratio of drum sticks to the wing portion was about 3-1 and I prefer the wing portion with the two bones.  f.  A following - When we walked in, we were the only people here. After five minutes, the place was packed!  I say, check this place out. It is not bad at all and for the good ole wing craving, this is a well priced and tasty place.

My wife and I love to find "hole-in-the-wall" type restaurants.  Unfortunately there aren't a lot of those in the vegas area.  So many are large franchises and corporate style.    Finding Chicken Shack was a thrill!  Not only did it have the small local feel we were looking for, but their chicken strips are hands down the best we have had! The staff was also very friendly and accommodating.  The fry on the chicken is great, and their shoe string fries are delicious.  They have a HUGE selection of sauces you can use for dipping. They also tend to be very generous in proportions!  We've been back many times and take out of town friends there as well.  Love it!

IF YOU LIKE DRY CHICKEN this is the place for you! I really wanted to love this place because the staff was really great and I've been looking for a solid chicken joint but...  It is a sin for chicken to be dry and overcooked in such a place. First time, we were excited to try it. First bite, we both looked at each other with that "dog gone it" kind of look. We both knew it was a fail. I got the number 4 - wings, fingers and fries. Wings were breaded which is a crime against humanity. Sauce was ok, but the fingers were dry and overcooked. I ate one wing and one finger and tossed it all. Waste of time and money.  Such a let down. Fries were good. I don't see myself coming back. I mean I knew it wasn't exactly healthy as everything is fried but I at least was hoping for good unhealthy food.
Wow good.  Not to diminish the Chicken, but the French Fries are out of this world.  Hardest choice in ordering is what type of sauce for your wings and fingers - there are so many choices.

HORRIBLE SERVICE!!! we usually go to the location on sunset, today we tried out the one on valley verde. The younger Hawaiian lady wig a piercing by her eye.... worst attitude. Had nothing to say but "nope" in the snarkiest way with the snarkiest look. Pulled out a few singles to leave a tip... suddenly her attitude changed because she saw the cash in my hand. lol she thought it was gonna go into her tip jar?? NOPE!!!! not after her attitude. Won't be coming to this location again that's forsure. the only reason i'm giving this 2 stars is because of the food.

Nice place clean peaceful! Simple menu basic itens that go with a chicken Joint!! Customer service is A1 very attentative, all smiles, food brought to the table. Food came out very short time 1. Fresh 2. Hot 3. And tasty dont wanna cant complicate a place like this.... ill be back to the shack!!!
So glad we found this place on the way to Hoover Dam from Vegas! So good and the staff was so friendly and helpful.

This place  sucks.   if you're going to go to a Chicken Shack don't go to this one my girl found a bug in her salad and they claim they wash the salad three times then I went there one time and they threw some chicken fingers in the grease that look like they were already cooked they don't batter them fresh like the one in Boulder City this is a knock off location and they don't even give you the card for if you buy 10 free meals to get one free they're a bunch of rip off please Choose Wisely 0 Stars if there were available.

The best chicken fingers ever! Tasty, perfectly breaded and perfectly fried! Great portions at great prices! If I come to Hoover Dam again, I sure will stop by and grab some of those tasty chicken fingers!
We loved the food. quantity and quality of the food is really good.  Service is prompt.

Stopped by for a quick dinner with a friend. The line was pretty short, but I waited for over 10 minutes to put my order in. The cashier was fantastic, but the trainer looked like she kept getting in the way of what she was doing. the girl with the short hair working night looks miserable a lady thought her combo came with fries and an employee told her he would get her fries she came back up 10 mins later asking and made her pay for them ? horrible customer service from her.

We love chicken shack! It was our first visit to this location and it's been the best so far! We are in love with the fry sauce to the point where we could almost drink it right out of the cup! The chicken tenders always come our fresh, hot and huge! Their ranch is to die for! We also just tried the honey garlic sauce on the wings and there's no coming back from that one #honeygarlicforlife so dang good! So excited that this location is literally 2 mins from our new place so we will be able to go often!

This place is new to my neighborhood and was recommended by a friend, it is a very clean place, lots of seating although parking is a little limited directly in front of this location but not a big deal. I ordered the 5 piece chicken fingers with medium sauce on them and was pleasantly surprised to see the fingers were actually enormous!! I could have actually gone with just 3 and been completely full. The sauce was just right on the fingers themselves but would have been even better if I had remembered to ask for Ranch or Bleu Cheese dipping sauce . The chicken was very moist which you usually dont find with most chicken fingers. I am looking forward to going back and trying their wings next!
Ordered the combo from uber eats. That's a pretty good size for me. I like the chicken wings better than the fingers. Fingers are too dry.

Came here on a Monday night craving some wings. For two people we ordered 3 orders of the 6 piece wings because the orders either came in 6, 12 or 25 with nothing in between. We got the creamy garlic Parmesan, chipotle bbq and hot honey garlic.   Wings came out relatively fast and they are actually really big!  My favorite flavor was the hot honey garlic. A little spicy and a little sweet. The chipotle bbq was sweet as well. I liked it but I'm not sure if chipotle is supposed to be sweet or not.   I was expecting something a little more savory and Smokey. The garlic Parmesan was also good but it got a little heavy towards the end. I'm glad we had other flavors to break up the taste.   I will definitely come back here again as wings are big and well priced and the flavors are pretty good!

I do love me some chicken shack.   This place has some really great fried chicken, but what sets them apart is their expansive sauce selection. My personal favorite being the honey bbq and hot bbq. Their fries are also just amazing.   My only one complaint is that the chicken isnt always consistent. At times their chicken can be very chewy, and not so easy to eat. I would say I experience this about  one out every three or four visits. Thus why I have not been dining there as much lately.   When their chicken is good its a 5 star place, but with the inconsistency I can only give them 4.

My family and I were headed to the movie theater in the same shopping center as this joint, so we decided to give it a try for dinner before hand. The service is pretty good. Their chicken is great. You can tell it is fresh and made from scratch. They have many sauce options for wings and the fingers. It was a neat experience and the next time we catch a movie nearby we will stop in again.

Before the movies today, my work team decided to have some lunch at the chicken shack.  I've heard some good things about their chicken so I was excited!  When you get there, you'll notice two picnic tables outside for additional seating.  I don't know if the tables are constantly cleaned, but it looked sticky and dusty.  When you get inside, there are tables on both sides of the restaurant:  two tops, four tops and 6 top tables. The inside seemed the same type of cleanliness as the outside tables.  Just looked sticky and a little dirty.  It looks like a small place, however, they seem to be efficient.  A lot of people were there but we fortunately got a few tables fast.  The staff was really nice, a guy and a girl in the front.  They were really busy but kept professional and nice.    For the food, we literally got about 150 pieces of chicken:  100 wings and 50 chicken tenders and a bunch of fries for about $150.  We got a lot of different flavors and sauces on the chicken.  Mild and medium heat chicken wings/tenders, lemon pepper wings and my favorite, garlic Parmesan wings.  The wings are super crispy and juicy inside.  I ate a bunch of wings and they were all cooked perfectly.  The garlic Parmesan really had a lot of flavor and no overly salty.  ON POINT!!!  The lemon pepper flavor wasn't overpowering and managed to still shine through.  I REALLY liked the chicken.  Definitely would recommend the food to someone else!  All in all, we ordered way too many wings for our group of people today.  We literally ended up wasting a bunch of wings because we were going to the movies right after and didn't want to leave the food in the car during the movies.  Aside from that, I was definitely a happy customer and think the wings were great!  Will be back for more :)

Chicken Shack is a fun stop for wings, fries and chicken tenders. Meaty wings with lots of sauce choices. Habanero honey sauce has a sweet spicy kick. Crispy shoestring fries with a side of ranch dressing round out a meal. Chicken fingers are hearty with fried chicken coating. Friendly staff. Drive up, walk in and order, then take a seat while perusing the license plates.

Anybody who grew up in the area knows Chicken Shack is a staple. Great food for the money you pay, plus they're lightning quick with getting your food out to you. Even on days the line stretches to the door, I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes to get my food. Often enough, they have it ready before I can even put the lid on my drink.   The ranch is top-notch, as are their fries. And quite often, you'll get more than what you ordered.

The food was great but the service was terrible. The cashier told my friend that we had to take our food to go because they're closing in 40 minutes. Then when I was about to order she had the nerve to have a whole conversation with her boyfriend on the phone before talking to me, haha.

My chicken was so good.  I got the Habenaro honey and the lemon pepper. I thought the habenero could have had some kick to it, but it was good.  My family also enjoyed there's.  They don't have a Chicken shack in there city, they said they want to always come here when they visit.

I didn't realize they had several around town.  I was excited for this place to open.  So we finally decided to check it out.  We ordered 6 piece with fries.  I got the Teriyaki sauce and the really hot sauce (Damn Hot) It was hot.  I can usually take some heat, but I had to push this sauce away.  It had good flavor, it was just too daym hot!  I didn't care for the hot teriyaki sauce.  But it worked out just fine, that chicken is fried just right.  My only complaint, is they need to cut back a little bit on the salt.  It's almost too salty. The service here is really good.  They make sure you have everything you need.  Ohhhh, and don't forget to get your rewards card!

Loved this place.  Awesome big juice and crispy chicken wings and all white meat tenders.  If you like a bit of spice, have have habanero honey sauce.  Amazing.  Fries are crispy shoestring.  Busy place to prepare to be patient to find a table to seat yourself at.  Worth the wait.
Crispy, delicious chicken and crispy skinny fries! Large selection of sauces to choose from. I would definitely come here again to get my chicken fix

Yelp told me this place was hot and new.   If by hot they mean completely over cooked and dry chicken band burnt buns, and new they mean completely new to the operating of a fryer... Then sure. This place is hot and new.   The only thing remotely redeeming is the fries. Thin cut and crispy... So really burnt but I like crispy fries.

This place is the real deal.  Nice thick fresh pieces of chicken fingers.  The sauces are fresh and great variety.  Under new ownership and service is fast. I'll be here often and a great alternative to the commercial Chick Filet.

There must be 15 restaurants on this street, all fast food except a hot dog shack and this chicken joint.  Luckily, my friend insisted on Jack in the Box, so after checking Yelp and seeing a completely 5 star rating with over 100 reviews, I happily crossed the street to see what the fuss was about.    They have a large menu with quite a bit of variety.  I wasn't extremely hungry, so I looked for the smallest thing on the menu - I ordered 5 chicken tenders.  Wow, I got 5 huge, almost the size of a small breast, chicken tenders.  I could only eat two and a half, and we took the rest on the road.  I ordered the Chipotle BBQ sauce which was amazing.  What I liked best was the chicken was very lightly breaded before frying, it was very flavorful with enough crunch and I didn't fill up on breading.  It also felt slightly healthier than fried chicken should be.  Best of all, the flavor was off the charts.    I got my food so quickly that I met my friend back at Jack in the Box just as he was sitting down to eat.  I let him sample my chicken first, then listened to him say "I wish I ordered that" while he ate his burger and tacos.  I would surely visit again next time I'm in the area.  If you're visiting Hoover Dam, you have to stop here to eat.
Some of the best chicken fingers in town . The dipping sauces are amazing . Mom and pop style fast food that is excellent.

Once again my fellow yelpers are spot on with this place, super friendly service and super good chicken.when you first go into a place you have never been to the one thing you most appreciated as a friendly welcome and a great smile. Put that together with some great food and you have the makings of a great restaurant, most definitely will return on my next trip down definitely five stars for me enjoy

This place was so good! The fries were super skinny, fresh and delicious! I got a 5 piece and it was way to much for us to share! The chicken pieces were so big! It was nice sitting outside to eat. Come try it for yourself!

We really liked this place. Order the sauce on the side. We tired the fingers, wings, fries, and potato salad, ranch, bbq and fry sauce  It was great and we had it to go which is so not the same as eating in!  Defiantly will go back!

Okay....Friday night....After work...Hungry. I ordered the 5 piece tenders with chili cheese fries.  I'm disappointed. The mild sauce is kinda sweet, with a strange mustard taste, gross! And they drowned the tenders in sauce and don't separate the chicken and fries...Who does that?! The chicken is dipped, so separate it. The fries are those annoying little  shoestring fries. We didn't get any ranch with our order...Guess you have to ask for it. Hopefully they improve. I was excited to have a new chicken place in the area, they missed the mark.
Best chicken fingers in town, noisy always crowded at noon but food is good hot and plentiful!! I'm never disappointed plus they take good care of regulars!
Great place.  Always consistent with food.  Sauces are great...be sure to try the 'Damn Hot'.

Based on my first experience I this place gets four stars. It could swing either way though. The chicken sandwich was very tasty. The fries are the second best I've had next to Sammie's LA pastrami. It is a little pricey $8.10 for my sandwich. The honey BBQ actually taste like it has honey in it. Once I've tried more I will probably change this review.

This place has really good food. We used to come here all the time when we lived down the street. We went there today after not going for a long time. We were super excited! We walked in there and the place was disgusting. Chicken bones, straw wrappers, utensils, fries, sticky floors, the soda machine was gross, the tables etc etc..it was so bad we walked out and went somewhere else. On top of all of this, their health card wasn't posted anywhere. I know it's a bunch of young high school kids working there, but come on.

We were on a road trip from California to Colorado. We tried the Chicken Shack in Boulder City. Wow. It was the most delicious chicken ever. They had a great variety of dipping sauces that I absolutely loved. They made their cole slaw just like my Mom. Fresh. Crisp. Couldn't get enough. *Very very clean place and especially nice people. We CRAVE their food. Love the place!

I've gone here since high school, our volleyball team would come before or after games, especially after playing GV. Nice small town feel, and SO. Delicious. Skinny fries seasoned to perfection, wings, fingers, FRESH! Annnnnnd THE SAUCES I'm drooling thinking about it, they even have beer!! Happy to find out they have one near my new side of town!
Stopped here while passing through based on the awesome reviews.  I'd give this place more stars if I could!  Great food and great service!

I'm going to make this plain and simple. Don't get your wings tossed in sauce here. Keep the sauces on the side and dip your chicken rather than having it all over. They do not try to be like wing stop or BBW and we should all respect that. But they offer tossing you sauce for you anyway. Also another tip don't eat here it's small and busy so it's best to get in line order Togo and take it home. I love their chicken wings and dipping sauces Mild sauce and sweet chili and garlic Parmesan are my go to sauces but I will try more next time. The wings are a good size and cooked perfectly. They don't overcook it like BBW to the point where you get a mini wing. One of my fave spots to stop when I'm on this side for sure. They seem to be putting out a great product but I think they need more space to operate more smoothly.

Great service but the taste is lacking a little.   It's located in the huge galaxy theater plaza and can be very easy to miss. The vibe of the place is pretty cool. The cook and the cashier are on top of everything and they run it efficiently. It's a small place, and at peak hours you can expect to wait for a table. Prices are average.  I ended up getting the five piece chicken finger in the lemon pepper, tasted okay but nothing stellar. I think you'd be better off getting some of the more wet sauces such as honey bbq.

There was a lot of hype about this place but it wasn't that great. The only great thing about it is that the wings I brought home were hot (about a 15 min drive). They forgot the 2 ranches I paid for, the wings were 75% batter, and the "hot" sauce was supposed to be Frank's Hot sauce but instead I got mild. Also, if you go on Wednesday it's wing Wednesday but they don't have a sign with the 85 cent special.

I am just going to say that this is the Best Chicken wing spot i have ever ate at. We have had both the tenders and the Wings. I did have a burger here and I will say it was quite dry. But its not a burger place. I go to this spot a lot. It is on way to work, I order on way stop in and head back out to work. Once they get to know you it is like family when you go in here. (customer service is job one here. the parking lot has been under construction due to smith's new gas station so it has been a bit inconvenient getting in and out. They are always busy so that is a good sign. Chicken, Josie likes the Garlic Parmesan I am a fan of the regular wings. If you order in they have beer on tap as well. This Chicken is so crunchy and juicy. Big wings with a ton of meat. You can also order sauces to go with you. I like that they offer blue cheese as well as ranch.  I go back again and again. You need to try this place. I believe they have other locations, however I have only been here. They know me by name so what's not to like.
Awesome wings and fingers! Everyone was very nice. The garlic Parmesan wings are fantastic.
Fantastic food! Wings were wonderful. Ask for the bathroom key for a good laugh. The staff was very friendly!

Always good service during the day but always have troubles at night, online it says they close at 10 but they close at 9 actually as if business hours on here I was upset when I drove 15 mins to get here

I am NOT a chicken finger fan but I wanted to try out a new place in town. It's been there for a while but is not the most convenient location. This just became a favorite.  I have the chicken fingers and my son had the wings. He wore the sauce from ear to ear. I highly recommend it.
Best hand breaded chicken ever!  The tenders are large and the fries are amazing!  Their ranch dip is creamy too. YUM
Love this place, it's close to work so we are regulars. Chicken is awesome and they are big wings. Only warning is, if you want to dine in get there before 1130 the place gets packed
Good food, friendly staff, nice atmosphere, if you're in the neighborhood of Valle Verde or Sunset stop in, you will not be disappointed!

So we had ordered 12 wings. It took them less than ten mins and there it was for us. Who would've known she would go home from work as she could not stop hurling and having diarrhea.  Will be in contact with the health department soon as they should look at proper techniques to cook safely.
Chicken fingers are AMAZING. Friendly staff. Great chili cheese fries! Try the spicy blue cheese!! Will definitely be coming back!
I've tried fingers all over the place, and The Chicken Shack has the best. The breading is light and crunchy and the fingers are huge. Worth the drive for the best fingers and wings!
Not from here but i can say that i will be making a stop at the Chicken Shack every time i visit here. Employees have great attitudes and the food was incredible. Overall good atmosphere!
Great service, great chicken, great variety of sauces. Love pretty good French fries.

Friendly staff and great food! I do recommend this place to others. The fries are not too salty which is good. My bf took me to this place, my first time. I love the chicken fingers and the medium buffalo sauce on the side. :)
Delicious, plump chicken fingers.  Tasty sauces.  The best I have ever had.  Chick fil a should take note of the size of these chicken fingers.

There food is great customer service is terrible went in there and the cashier didn't even bother to give us our change 20 dollars in change instead she felt the need to just put our change in the tip jar and we totally forgot about it then we went back and she had an attitude about giving me back my money so yeah watch out make sure to ask for your change because she'll try to finest you !!!!
My friend Mike bragged about what great meaty wings they had and he wasn't lying. Wings were great and staff was warm and friendly.

Geez! I am pretty positive this is the right location. I stopped in to get a to go order while running errands...oil change etc. I don't remember the young pretty girl that helped me maybe she was wearing a name tag and I forgot or didn't pay attention but she was very nice and helpful. Thank you so much for great service. If I am around town I will have to check out other chicken shakes. I am almost certain this was the location on my side of town. Thank you.

Attention: Business Owner - special commendation for your employee Samantha. She was extremely patient even though I was very short with my questions. She explained your menu very patiently and I am impressed. A bit embarrassed with my behavior but really admire her calmness. She's an asset to your team!!

Been here a few times. Chicken is great and had their burger for first time which was awesome. The thing I noticed most is how friendly the staff is, always a hi, how you doing?, and how was your meal?  EVERY TIME! Customer service is huge with me and I appreciate that the most.

Yum! Chicken is tasty and love the sauces, although two of the BBQ sauces tasted exactly the same. The honey habanero sauce was excellent; should be called honey habanero BBQ sauce though because that's more what it tasted like. Great for a chicken fix since I don't have Chick-Fil-A! Fries are good, too. Nothin to make a big fuss about, just a solid take on a staple. :)

Holy macoroni! This place is delicious! My favorite wings are the honey bbq and lemon pepper. Their fries are absolutely delicious if you enjoy shoestring style! I will definitely be eating here again!

Great fast friendly service.  The chicken is amazing. Super fresh and tasty.  I had the medium wings "flats are the best" with the Parmesan garlic sprinkled on them.  Absolutely delicious.  Also got to try the fingers with sweet and sour sauce and hot BBQ.  Also wonderful. I'm not usually a big fan of white meat. But these fingers were so juicy and tender I couldn't help but to devour them.  Fries. Don't get me started.  The shoestring fries are fantastic. I recommend having them with tons of pepper.  They were great.
One of our favorite joints! Had a slight hiccup with our last order and was disappointed cause we love them so much! But, they fixed it quickly! I'm a happy customer again... -Erica

Make sure your order is prepared fresh. Ordered a 25 wing meal from the location on Sunset and Green Valley Pkwy. My order was over the phone and my first clue should have been when the person taking my order said that "my order would be ready in 6 minutes". The chicken was dry and obviously filled w/ old wings!! Chicken would have potentially been better if fresh??!!

Unfortunately my first visit, I had to get a takeout order but the order came out pretty fast!  Their wings are HUGE!!! And they hook it up! Well worth the money!  At first when I walked in, I didn't feel welcome. They didn't greet me so I had to greet them lol.  And I proceeded to order my wings awkwardly. But after I paid, they offered me a water cup while I wait, and told me I can get any fountain drink I wanted! How nice of them  If you order a side of ranch or any sauce their sauce cups are huge so it's easy to dip the wings and portion is a lot too.   I'll be back to dine in soon, especially they have cheap beer too :)

Good wing place.  Small hole in the wall next to smiths.  It's always packed so we like to call in ahead of time.  Wings are huge and they are breaded then fried, very filling.  We normally get the extra hot wings, jerk, and the mango habanero.  Honestly the place could use a good scrubbing and cleaning.  It's a little run down and dirty... but service is always good and it's always tasty. Lol

I have been coming here for over 10 years now! Boy, do I feel old. There chicken never disappoints, whether you want fingers, wings or even both. There is a ton of different sauces to choose from and they are continuously adding new ones to try. For my money, it's the best chicken place around. My orders here are very eclectic, but I'd say my favorite is the Hot BBQ with a side of Hot teriyaki and spicy bleu cheese. It might sound a little strange, but even if you're just dipping their delicious fires in the teriyaki, it's totally worth it.

Words can't explain how hyped I am to have a Chicken Shack down the street from my place. As an avid fried chicken lover (it's seriously my guilty pleasure), I was always willing to make the drive to the other locations except now it's literally three minutes away! Today my boyfriend (who has never had it before) and I went to try it and the quality is definitely the same as the other locations. The only difference is the customer service. The customer service was never bad at the other locations but it never stood out either. The customer service was 10/10 from every person working there. If you weren't a good mood about eating chicken before, you will be now after seeing all of their happy smiles! I got the 6 piece wings with hot sauce on the side and my boyfriend ordered the 10 piece fingers (boneless), half being lemon pepper and half being chilli lime. We also got a side of ranch with french fries. The portions are huge and neither of us could finish! It was a super satisfying meal and I'm so excited to have this establishment down the street!

Khloe, Thank you for getting back to me.  To be clear,  I had Chipotle BBQ on the side, and 1 Blue cheese. When asked about the charge for the blue cheese, the cashier said we make it ourselves. I had nothing extra. When she presented the wings at my table in such a short time,  i asked if they were precooked, she offered to ask the kitchen,  but i declined as I already knew the answer

Chicken shack is a great place to grab some wings. All the sauces are excellent and the chicken is phenomenal. The best in Vegas. If they could brake the habit of serving old fries (cause we know the difference) then they would be a 5 star spot. I'd rather wait a few more minutes for fresh fries rather than fast food with old fries.  Other than that we are 3 years loyal.

This is a small chicken place that I thought must be worth a try considering I still love a good chicken finger meal.  The shop itself is small but really cute.  I enjoyed the "chicken" sayings that were painted on the walls throughout the shop.  Definitely good for a laugh while waiting for your food.   The shop certainly wasn't clean as a whistle.  But the service was nothing to complain about.    I didn't enjoy my chicken fingers.  Breading was not as crispy as I prefer and the finger itself was just... eh.  I did enjoy the shoestring fries.    It's not exactly the same but while I was there I just kept thinking, "If a Raising Cane's were closer I would have just gone there."    I'd go again and try more stuff but it probably won't come to mind over other lunch joints.

I decided to go here for lunch because my coworkers encouraged me to because they are familiar with the establishment. The owners do business with my company so my peers frequent there. HOWEVER, my experience was not good at all. The owner Melissa was very curt and  unengaging to say the least. I was not greeted at all, almost like I was disturbing the convo she was having with her husband.  I place my order and she asked what kind of sauce I wanted and I asked her what were my options she motioned with her head toward the menu....... the rest of the interaction was very rushed, mind you I was the only customer there until I finished placing my order and a 4 kids came in and were greeted almost immediately! Needless to say I will not patronize a business that doesn't respect and treat all customers the same. Customer service shouldn't be selective......

I had to visit the Chicken Shack because I was craving their chicken fingers. I've been here a few times before, but I finally took the time to visit again and write a review.  Inside, the walls are decorated with license plates from different states. It has a pretty cool feel to the place, but it can get crowded given the fact that it is small.  Since I was buying food to feed 4 people, I ordered the shack pack (your choice of 25 wings OR 20 fingers, two large sides, and 4 drinks for $34.99). I opted for the chicken fingers and chose the macaroni salad, potato salad, and the coleslaw for my sides (I decided to get an extra side item instead of the 4 drinks).   The chicken is supposed to be their showcase item, but it ended up being more of a letdown. The fingers are a good size for what you pay for and they're juicy when you bite into them, but the fingers I got tasted like they had been cooking in old oil (it wasn't that pretty golden-brown color, but more on the darker brown side). The sides were alright. The macaroni salad and potato salad were the better of the sides. Unfortunately, the coleslaw looked like it was put in a blender before serving. It was more on the sweet side and really watery.  They didn't deliver on the wow factor, but I'm willing to give Chicken Shack another chance.
Best fingers you will find. Lots of meat, lightly breaded and full of flavor with plenty of sauces to choose from.
BEST CHICKEN EVER.  My family and I eat here at least twice a month. I'm addicted to the Damn hot sauce!! They are always very polite and also very quick. Will definitely be back!
The sauces are the best part and the chicken is amazing. I tried garlic Parmesan and sweet chili and I recommend both. I will definitely be back!!!

Chicken shack is amazing! Our go to place for chicken and wings! Casual ambience. Quite the hole in the wall place.   Chicken shack is a great treat. They have an amazing variety of sauces and they all taste great!! This is the #1 wing place hands down. No question.
Great wings, fingers and FRIES!!! Cozy atmosphere.  You have a returning customer... Like mentioned... passed by many a times... and finally went in and yayyyyyyyy was satisfied.....

Wish I could give 3.5. I work right across the street from this little joint and had to try it on my lunch break. The service was good,  the woman hat took my order was very friendly and knew it was our first time. Prices are a bit high but no too bad. I got the fingers plain with fries, I like to try stuff like this without all the bells and sauces to really get a sense of the food. The fingers were big and hot (temperature), but they weren't very crispy and the actual chicken part was a tad dry. The fry portion was huge and tasty, nice crispy little fries.  I really want to try their wings, sauces sounded good and wings other patrons had looked pretty good. I'll try it again.
Stopped here on the way home from AZ! The food was pretty delicious and the chicken actually stayed pretty warm until we got to our home which was like 45 mins away from here!  Thank you.

I had the number Two, five Chicken Fingers and Fries and I got potato salad instead of the fries. Also got the fingers rolled in the buffalo sauce.     Not what I really expected, first of all the the chicken the star of the dish was way over cooked, like it was cooked yesterday and just flashed cooked today, the chicken was tough and chewy.  The buffalo sauce was good and potato salad was very flavorful.  The bottom line chicken was over cooked, chewy and tasted old, possibly freezer burned.  I have them three stars because the last time it was much more fresher then this body, so next time will decide if we ever come back.
My husband brought home some wings and tenders with hot honey garlic sauce and fries. It was so yummy! Can't wait to go back

SALT SALT SALT- Not the normal flavor of Chicken Shack  I have eaten at all the Chicken Shacks all over Vegas. FINALLY one opened next to my home. The first time I ate there, I thought the chicken was off. It was exactly the same issue the second time.   The chicken taste like someone is adding TONS of SALT to their chicken.  I have asked other friends who have tried it and they all say the same thing. Chicken and Fries are just overloaded with salt and they all refuse to go back to this location.  Some bites of the chicken are crispy and tasting. Other bites taste like a salt pellet has been inserted into the chicken.  This location DOES NOT follow the Chicken Shack standards. I am telling everyone I know to post here in hopes that the Owner sees what is going on.  Change your ways, or I will not ever go back to this location and will tell everyone I know to avoid this place.  I would rather go across the street to Canes and get a better value and not be overloaded with salt.  JUST GROSS! I guess its time to go back to the Valle Verde location.
Chicken shack is always fresh and i really enjoy coming here more than canes. The meat really tastes like fresh chicken and not processed and that's what i really love about it

So this was my first time here ever. So of course I was confused on what to order and the cashier was of no assistance and just confused me more. The food was very bland unfortunately but the french fries were good and the food came out very fast. It was 11 bucks just for myself so I would not go back. It just wasn't worth it to me.

Really good fried chicken and fries! I wish they were open 24 hrs like the spot next door because they are MUCH better. The service is pretty quick and the staff is friendly. This is my go to spot for fried chicken when I don't feel like making it.

Today was our first time trying the CHICKEN SHACK and let me tell you it was sooo good better than Raisin Cane's. The cashier was so great with us told us all about the menu and had such an amazing upbeat personality made us feel like he was a long lost brother. We felt welcomed and enjoyed the atmosphere of this jewel. Thank you to the cashier for an awesome experience don't recall your name but I will never forget someone genuinely kind hearted! Thank you again

Chicken Shack offers great chicken for an affordable price! They really give you your money's worth. I got the combo with 5 chicken strips and shoe string fries. You get one dipping sauce for free and each one after that is $0.35 more. I got Habanero Honey and Sweet Chili which were both pretty awesome. The chicken strips are large and filling - I couldn't even finish all of it. They are cooked perfectly to a crisp! The shoestring fries were tasty as well :) I definitely recommend this place for a quick dine-in or pickup!

Was looking for a chicken place and came across this one so we wanted to try it out. Tried their wings with the suace on the side and man were they nice and crispy!  Got it with the chicken tenders that were just as good. I got the mild sauce so I wasn't too happy because it was kinda spicy for me but i'm a wimp so it's ok but still was good. I loved their shoe string fries too! My bf had the hamburger and he loved it as well. The prices were reasonable. Only downside is that the place is small but other than that I'll come back to try the different sauces!

If you're in the mood for chicken of the fried variety and you want it in the form of wings or fingers, The Chicken Shack might be what you're looking for. This location is the most convenient for us and we always receive friendly, helpful service, but I wouldn't put the chicken on the top of my list.  You can either get fingers, wings, or both via combo. Unlike other proteins, chicken always needs a little help to boost the flavor and with over 20+ choices for sauces, the spectrum is broad enough to meet anyone's palate. Their hottest, damn hot and what I usually order, is tolerable and allows you to still function after consumed. Cajun is probably my favorite of the rest. I have yet to try the burgers, salads, and chicken sandwich also offered on the menu. My daughter especially prefers the shoestring fries and sometimes bypasses the chicken just to get the fries.  I've given the tenders a couple of tries and both times they've been overcooked leaving the meat dry with inedible, tough edges. To me, the wings, although they are plump and above average in size, are their biggest downfall because they commit the mortal sin of coating each wing with breading. A crispy chicken skin is a delicacy providing that unique crunch and holding the salty, fatty chicken flavor. I'm disappointed when I see a wing that conceals that flavorful skin with breading.  The fries and service are strong points. The fingers and wings aren't my top choice, but I wouldn't tell anyone not to give them a try because they might make them how you prefer.

I went here because my friend suggested it. I was not impressed by the food or customer service. When we walked up to the counter, the cashier didn't even greet us or ask if we had questions about the menu. She just stared until I told her I was ready to order. She wasn't wearing a name tag, but according to the receipt, her name was "Cheri". I ordered 12 wings - half lemon pepper and half garlic parmesan. It was overly breaded and it looked like they just dumped the garlic parmesan on top. The coating didn't stick. They charged 59 cents for a small container of ranch. I don't think I'll come back for a second time.

Pleasantly surprised by this place! We'd been staying in Phoenix visiting family, and decided to do a road trip to vegas for a few days. On the way back to Phoenix, we were all starving for lunch but SO sick of fast food.. The chicken shack is indeed just a little shack, and not much to look at, but after reading the good reviews we decided to give it a try.. So glad we did!!! The fresh crispy breaded chicken strips were DELICIOUS, as well as the shoestring fries! Nothing was greasy. The fry sauce (ketchup & mayo) was perfect for dipping. Great little stop, don't pass it up!!!

Im a little conflicted Ive always walked in and ordered but the other night after being sock for a week I called an hour before close and someone picked up the phone and prqctically snarledinto the phone "we are not taking any more orders tonight" I've never had someone in food service be so rude to me. I will NOT be calling for take out again.
My favorite chicken in Vegas. Chicken is not overly seasoned yet still favorable. Given a little more time, they will be as good as Sunset location.

My friend insisted that we try this place and I am glad we did. Sure the line was out the door but that is because the food is amazing. Quick service and chicken that is second to none. Do not let the line discourage you from missing out on the best chicken ever.

Being a vegetarian, every time I came to Smith's just next door I couldn't help but become overwhelmed by the awesome smell that came from this place. So, I had to bring mom to taste it and give me a full review.  She said the wings were awesome and would love to come back, but they weren't as good as hers. ;)  I also learned they have chicken tenders and will have to come and try those for myself, considering I have jumped off the veggie train after ten years and dying to  see if the taste matches the aroma. Come and check this hidden gem out if you are a fan of good chicken. My nostrils and Mom's taste buds are saying you probably will not be disappointed.
It's arrived early n the food r so gud I like it n so as my kids, they njoy eating it especially the fries ,this is a gud resturant please  stop by sometimes to try out their food thank you

We came here with some locals.  Seriously the best chicken fingers I'd ever had.  So fresh and juicy!  They only have chicken and fries.  Definitely a proponent of the do one thing and do it well philosophy.  So, if you have a hankering for chicken, this is the place!

I am not a huge fan of this place. The food is way salty which is good for some people at some times(the bf loves salty ass food), but my firm belief is if you sell food, don't nickel and dime for stuff that makes YOUR food better. For example, making me pay a side price for some (veggie sticks)celery and carrots, ridiculous. Celery is literally a dollar for a giant bunch. Charging for ranch? At a dedicated chicken wing place? Wha??? I mean, where is any logic there?? If you want more than one type of sauce, charge. I mean really...  I am a frequent craver of chicken wings, fingers, anything crunchy and salty with some hot sauce and celery. The celery is a must. I still think it is  a travesty that some fast food pizza places have the audacity to serve wings and yet do not carry celery. I frequented this place a lot at first, but after a while spending over ten bucks a pop for a single meal just so I can get some celery and ranch with my meal is ridiculous. Now I just head over across to (casino takeout)...which is good but I would rather support small business.

Sorry Colonel Sanders, but Chicken Shack does chicken right.  My family is so hooked on this place.  I love the chicken fingers, the wife loves the wings, and the kids are split down the middle.  And you gotta try the honey BBQ sauce.  Nothing better than drowning my chicken fingers in that deliciously sweet nectar from the gods.  They have very generous portions too, giving my late night cravings something to look forward too.  See you soon Chicken Shack.  =)

Best chicken place in Vegas hands down , no one comes close they fast friendly staff, food is always fresh never had no problem , very good place to go , new location on rainbow and trop, go there try it out u won't be disappointed i guaranteed u that , if so then u are use to that face chicken u get from Mac Donald's lol

Finally a Chicken Shack on the West side. Known as the best local chicken restaurant in Green Valley! After eating here and tasting the quality you won't want to go to a Raising Cane's or Popeye's. Huge difference in freshness and taste!

Holy moly!  Chicken wing lovers pay attention - this little counter in a Choice gas station/car wash had some of the best wings I have had in town so far.    Here I was chilling while I was waiting for my car to be washed, and I wanted a snack so I decided to give them a try.  The wings were breaded, and although I usually consider that a sin, these were so moist and juicy and cooked perfectly, it really didn't matter.  My husband, who wasn't hungry, nor is a huge fan of wings, ended up fighting over these with me.  I got the hot sauce, which wasn't massively overpowering hot, but was really flavorful.  They have about 8 other sauces to choose from, similar to Buffalo Wild Wings but much better.  I'm happy there's a wing joint I can enjoy so close to home.  Next time you have an urge for Buffalo Wild Wings, Wing Stop, Chicken Bonz, and especially Hooters down the street, consider this place instead.

I've been going to this specific location since 2009, when it was known as Chicken Bonz. It's my fav chicken strips/fingers in town, just above Cane's. Then they ended up with 3 Bonz named locations before rebooting with The Chicken Shack. Plus a crap load more locations opened up here and other states.. Glad my patronage helped pay for the expansion. Haha  The fingers are great. I always get the Garlic Parmesan flavor. Their ranch dressing is excellent. Their shoe-string fries are a little too greasy, but very tasty.  The service here is excellent. The dude that takes your order is always super friendly. Food comes out fresh and hot EVERY time.   My only 2 issues is they used to have ayce wings and ayce fingers. Both are long gone. Also they raised prices by about 2 bucks per combo.. but still worth what you pay.

These are think pieces of chicken heaven. Let's call em chicken thumbs, cuz chicken fingers are too thin compared to these..  Service: Always great. Dudes at front counter are always super nice and courteous, making you feel welcome.  Food: By far, my favorite chicken fingers in town, edging out Cane's because of the flavor selection here and available ranch dressing, which I prefer over Cane's sauce.   *New location opening on South Boulder soon! In the Albertson's parking lot*  My only gripe is no more ayce fingers and wings they used to have when they were once "Chicken Bonz" back in the day..

I was craving chicken wings while in town and found the chicken shack on Yelp, boy, this place didn't disappoint. My party ordered a 25 piece of chicken wings with 5 different sauces and blue cheese. Every sauce was good, you can tell it was made from scratch. The chicken was crispy and not over sauced. The blue cheese was thick and creamy and was made from scratch. Everything was delicious. I am extremely pleased. This place definitely gives Buffalo Wild Wings a run for their money. The staff is very friendly as well.
Great chicken fingers and good service.  Good value for the money spent. Plenty of sauces to choose from.

Borrowing the words of the owner, this "oasis"  in Boulder City a total Gem. My hubby and I were so pleased to have stopped by, completely satisfied. I had the very fresh and juicy double shack burger and my hubby had the #2 chicken fingers. Deeeelish!!! Friendliest people here.

I was skeptical that Chicken Shack could really be a 5 star place, but with such great reviews we had to take our chicken-strip-loving son to try it out.  It was delish!!!  Moist chicken with a thin breading that was perfectly seasoned!  Shoestring fries were piled high and perfectly seasoned as well.  We will be back!

On a road trip to the Hoover Dam saw this cute little Chicken Shack & decided to stop in and check this place out based on yelp. OH MY GOODNESS!!! Talk about home cooking yes sir!  It was flavorful & delicious the chicken fingers were all white breast meat & the skinny fries were so yummy cooked & salted to perfection this place is a hidden Gem   A kids meal more like a adult meal comes with 2 huge chicken fingers & a basket full of skinny fries with a small i think 16oz drink for the low price of $5.99 with unlimited refills what a bargain this place has plenty of parking space & this place is kept clean that you could eat off the tables you can it outside/inside your choice Oh yeah if you ask for the bathroom key which is attached to a rubber chicken how cute is that cluck cluck!  The restrooms are also kept up & very clean.  So if your looking for a home cooked meal that's served quick than stop by this place its well worth it trust me you will not be disappointed oh yeah they take cash & credit cards

We stopped here on our way from Vegas to the Hoover Dam. What a awesome little place! The food was amazing and very reasonably price with a large portion! The staff was welcoming, friendly, and even gave us a few suggestions of sites to see while we were in town. Keep up the great work guys!

I have gone to the Chicken Shack for years even when they were called Bones. I used to compare them to Canes, but they are different. I love the fingers. I've never had the wings because I'm more of a finger guy. Their sauces are great. I love their fries and their beans. The portions are generous. The staff is GREAT. If you like fingers, don't miss out.

Food is great I've been going there since freshman year of high school back in 2008. Today I had the worst customer experience of my life. I asked the cashier "When you have a moment could you please come wipe out table down its kind of sticky" the place was dead and he wasn't occupied but he never came. Ok I thought no worries. Our food was delivered to us by another gentlemen by the name of Daniel. I asked Daniel "Could you wipe the table down for us when you get a chance" he replied "sure". As he walked away with his back turned to he says "a please would be appreciated " in a completely passive aggressive tone. He's right I should have said please but that doesn't change the fact that he was being completely unprofessional. When he came back I proceeded to address the situation as he comment made me feel really uncomfortable. I told him hey I don't appreciate being spoken to In such an aggressive manner. He then proceeded to argue and escalate the situation in a completely immature way. Cherry on top when our argument concluded he followed it up with "cool story bro" that really got my blood boiling. I'm not one to complain but I felt the need to get a manager involved at this point. Their employee had disrespected me and was being completely unprofessional. When I spoke to them they mocked and asked me what they should do "sit him down and give him a stern talking to" with a huge grin on their face. They essentially blew me off and expect me to believe that will address the situation with the runner? Yea, I don't think so. It wasn't until another runner came out from the kitchen and acknowledged the situation and explained that Daniel can be a bit of a dick. It isn't my fault that's he's a dick or is having a bad day. They shouldn't take it out on their customer and if he can't deal with customers then he shouldn't be working in the customer service industry. I can honestly say that I will not be returning to chicken shack not after the complete disregard they showed for customer satisfaction.
I'm so excited they opened one on this side of town! Now I can come here all the time for lunch during the work week. Everyone is really nice here and the place is super clean!

I love this location. They are super friendly, fast and the food is good. The owner is always here putting in work and coming around to the tables to make sure everyone is doing okay and enjoying their experience.

This is the best place to go in the Las Vegas valley for chicken. They keep it simple, don't have an enormous menu, but they do it right. Way better than the competition and I've tried them all. I just wish they had more locations.

Back for dinner tonight. This place rocks it. The chicken is fresh and good. The fries are unreal. They have about 15 different sauces. This place does it right. Food fresh, service fast. Still not the cleanest place. But, you have to realize they never stop frying chicken and fries.  Bound to be a challenge to keep clean.

I was told to go to this place multiple times and never made it around to going. The service was extremely fast by the time I got my drink and sat down the food was on my table. The food was very good as well. I got the Cajun chicken wings and side macaroni salad. It was extremely good and the people working there were very nice! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for good chicken!

I don't write many reviews but when I do I write it about great service and awesome food like here at da shack. The food here is awesome the coating on the chicken is delicious and the fingers are perfectly moist inside the shoestring fries taste great and there is plenty of sauce options. They have draft beer and it is dirt cheap. Now for the service I have to say Eddie was one of the best employees at a restaurant that I have ever had service from he greeted me helped with the menu options was helpful and courteous the whole time five star service.

Came here first time from moving from Hawaii and gotta say that this place is top notch! It has a chill environment music and Farely quiet and feels like a good chill spot to eat delicious wings fries and BEER!

We came the the chicken shack and Juan Pérez greater us while giving good service. We got the best chicken fingers and fries I've ever came across living in Vegas my whole life. The sauce selection of 20 was interesting to choose. Also I'd like to suggest mixing it up for an interesting  Experience.9

Just happened to be on this side of town and it was about dinner time. I remembered this place from a couple years ago when I met up with a friend here. I liked their hole-in-the-wall location and atmosphere. It seems very little has changed since my last visit. Their place is located in an older strip mall. When I got there it was about 7:00 pm and the place was busy but not crowded. I ordered the five piece chicken strips along with the creamy parmesan and I believe it was the hot honey garlic sauce, both on the side. One side of sauce was enough, actually, to handle all five strips. Shoestring fries and fountain drink completed my order. The chicken strips I received were cooked to a darker golden brown (which made the outside more crunchy) but the chicken itself was tender and juicy, and hot off the fryer. I needed to wait a couple minutes by eating the fries first. The staff was friendly and helpful enough. Although *I* have had no issues, I would side with a few other reviewers and recommend coming during their peak hours. Yes, it will be busier but I also believe this is when they cook and serve their best food. I would be cautious of coming in close to closing time because orders may be cooked inconsistently.
This place is amazing.  Great wing and fingers.  They can get busy but that is because this place is that good.

This place is awesome...!  We were passing by to Las Vegas when we got hungry. We were initially suppose to go to jack in the box but we were feeling spontaneous to try local food. So we crossed they street and went to Chicken Shack. I ordered the #3 combo which was 3 chicken fingers, fries, and a drink. You choose what flavor you want on your chicken fingers which I chose the lemon pepper. Presentation was key with them the fingers were crispy, moist, and gold brown and the fries were hot and crispy! Sooo mouth-watering! My sister order the sweet chili sauce and that sauce was boommbb! Pretty much the place was amazing we truly  enjoyed our food and the experience. We will definitely stop by again if we decide to go Vegas again!!

Love their chicken fingers but they need to really work on service. Each time I call to place order the order taker never repeats order and then they feel annoyed that you expect them to...Sorry but I too worked in fast food establishment and was taught to repeat order with customer. Sometimes they are not clear with their own menu. But good enough to go back.

Shopping next door at Smith's for some time, we had seen the signs for Chicken Shack for some time. One day, our preshopping hunger was going to cost us way too much money in the grocery store, so, we decided to give the Chicken Shack a try.  We both got the chicken finger and fries, with a fountain drink for both of us. Looking at the menu, if I was a fan of wings (too much work, not enough food) I could see myself diving into their AYCE wings. With such a wide selection of sauces available, you could eat your fill and still not have tried all of their sauces (maybe).  Our food came out pretty quickly, and tasted quite good. My main complaint is that the fryer oil appeared to be very old, as our fingers were dark and a bit tough. The high level of grease soaked into the batter was bordering on being too greasy.  That won't be our last visit, I hope to give them a shot, and see if we can time it to be near when they change the fryer oil.

This is an awesome little chicken wing/strip joint. The decorations are clever and cute. The food came out very fast. I order the 5 piece chick strip combo with medium sauce on the chicken and blue cheese dressing on the side with fries and a drink for $7.95. Love this place. Definately coming back!
I ordered the hot wings tender strips came with some fries and a soda the fries was very greasy!! I don't no if I will be back

The staff inside is really cool and down to earth. The flavor to the wings are nice but I recommend eating there or not driving to far . The chicken because it's breaded will become very soggy and a mess all over your fries. I made a stop so the food set for about 15 mins. I will try again maybe next time I will get regular chicken or eat there.

I've been the the chicken shack on sunset and had good experiences there. At this location they had my fingers out to me right after I paid for them. When I got them home we found them so tough and dry we were unable to eat them.

*Military Discount*  This was one of my favorite jokes when I was growing up:   Q. Why did the chicken cross the road? A. To show the possums how it's done.  I don't know why but it cracked me up every time.  It seems pretty dumb now LOL   Went on Friday 3-11-16 at noon for lunch.  This restaurant is located on Mountain Vista & Sunset in the Smith's shopping center.  The place was totally packed!!  Seems to be a popular spot for lunch.   It's kinda small inside but they do have some outdoor seating.    $16.51 got us a 6-wing basket with a drink and a chicken sandwich basket with a drink. It came out super fast!    Their chicken is crunchy on the outside although a bit bland but they have some tasty sauces for dipping to make up for that.  The wings were full of raw, yellow, fat which I HATE but not so much that I wouldn't eat them again.    Their fries are the skinny shoe-string type and were hot and crunchy.  Their soft drink machine must be calibrated perfectly because their mountain dew is pretty much the best I've ever had.   Overall a solid place to have lunch and not too hard on the wallet.  Their ranch is out-of-this-world AMAZEBALLS.

Been a fan of the shack ever since the one on Sunset. Found out that this location opened up near my house,  I knew I had to try it out.  Let me tell you,  I was not dissapointed. I love getting the mix combo with wings and fingers. My favorite is the Jerk sauce for the fingers and Lemon pepper seasoning with my wings.  The staff here was super friendly and the manager even came out to greet us and make sure everything was good.  Very good experience I had and will be definitely be stopping by more often thanks to the new location.
The wings are awesome. Nice big meaty breaded wings just like Hooters!!!

This place is always busy. Every time I drive by it the place is full, so I decided to go there for dinner with my girlfriend. My experience there was "ehhhh."  Girlfriend ordered the fried chicken with fries. I got their triple patty burger and fries. We both got drinks with the meal.   First off, the Dr. Pepper machine was not working. Strike 1.   The guy taking my order asked how I wanted my burger cooked, I said medium rare. It came out well done and dryer than moses' nose in the desert. Strike 2.   There was no strike 3 from myself, but girlfriend did not like the chicken and was less than pleased with the meal. She said the chicken was dry and flavorless. With a simple meal like fried chicken, I imagine its hard to screw that up but it happened.   Perhaps I'll give them another chance in the future and maybe we caught them on a bad night. If that's the case, I'll update the review at a later date.
I love this place, always a friendly hello. Chicken is better than KFC and Kane's!!! Dipping sauces are wonderful, so many to chose from. My favorite is the garlic.

This place was a good little eatery that offered a variety of items from chicken fingers, chicken wings, burgers, chili, etc. Of course we came to try to chicken fingers since that's what all the hype was about. Tried it slathered in hot sauce, which was good flavor... but seemed to be just like Frank's Red Hot sauce just not as spicy. The chicken was  dry, but still okay covered in sauce. I was pleased to have shoestring fries! They also offer a variety of other sauces either on the side or on your chicken. Next time I think we'll opt for on the side. Of course they offer the usual fixings of ranch, blue cheese, etc for dipping as well. This place can get busy though! We beat the crowd, but shortly after many people were looking for  table to sit at. Decent place to check out if you're in the area.
Awesome place for chicken, definitely recommended to all chicken lovers. Ordered #4 combo which comes with drink and fries. The fries are awesome.

I use to work near by so if I was getting lunch this was usually the 2nd place I would pick. When I would go I usually got the 3 piece finger meal, believe me it's enough to make you full without being over stuffed.   It comes with 3 large sized chicken fingers, shoestring fries, a sauce, and drink.    I don't know what seasoning they put on the  fries but the are the most scrumptious fries I've ever had, and I hate shoestring fries.   I always get the sauce on the side. I get the honey mustard sauce, which costs a bit more but I don't mind because its like crack!  I'm really not a fan of their buffalo sauces something is off putting about them.  What I love most is that it's quick, tasty, real chicken fingers, AND they have sweet tea (that alone pulls at my southern girl heart strings)

Great service, wings crispy  but bland, tenders nothing like the well known food chain in Vegas, but very big. Customer service was great, food came fast. Free refills,  wish I had gotten all wings instead of tenders. .wouldn't go back but it was ok

Everytime I drive by here, there are people. Roberto's next door might be empty,  but the Chicken Shack has people there.....why? What is it about this place?  Well, finally decided to go in an check it out on a Monday night around 8pm. A couple TV's with some sports on. They serve beer. OK, I'm beginning to understand the appeal. Wings, chicken strips, burgers, chicken sandwiches, fries, and a few other sides. Simple menu.  I got a 12 wing pack, creamy garlic parmesan and Damn Hot! split. $11.99 or a dollar a wing. Wings are big, so decent enough pricing. At a glance I thought the sides prices were a bit high, but I didn't see the quantity served.   I wasn't overwhelmed with the creamy garlic parmesan wings, I have had better at dive bars. Not bad, just not great. My friend said the Damn Hot! wings weren't that hot. I didn't try them so no comment.  Its an ok place, mostly frequented by younger people. I'll probably stop by again sometime but I wouldn't go out of my way. Usually I bbq my own wings. 3 stars fits the bill.

I don't entirely know why, but I'm kind of obsessed with Chicken Shack. I'm rarely on that side of town, but have noticed it on my way to Ross J's. It looked kinda ghetto so I stayed away till a couple weeks ago when Ross J's was closed early. I'm glad I tried it because I'm a little addicted now.  I'm probably kind of biased because their plain wings taste just like when my mom makes korean chicken before she dips it in the sauce. Nostalgia is a funny thing, but I do think they're also just really good wings.   Price is about $1/wing and many have mentioned that's overpriced, but that seems standard to me for restaurants - BWW is about the same. Chicken Shack also has huge drummies and wings, not broken or midget ones like a lot of other places. I'm a fatty, but I was full off of 6 wings because they're bigger and meatier.   For sides, we've tried the cole slaw, baked beans, and fries - only the fries were really good crispy shoestrings, I'd pass on the rest and just stick with wings. For sauce my fav is the habanero honey (not that spicy) and garlic parm. The bbq and sweet chili were pretty standard, but I also liked the wings just plain because they had seasoning already.   Service was great and the tables were clean the 2 times that I've been, with guys coming out to wipe down tables as soon as they're free. I hate nickel and diming - they charge for ranch/blue cheese and extra sauce, but what can you do.  I also agree with others who've said that their chicken fingers are dry - stick with the wings.

Their fries and chicken tenders are nice and crispy. The fries are thin and the chicken tenders are a good size, not too big and not too small.   They have a variety of sauces, I tried a few and those were good.

I am so glad this place opened up and it's close to my home.  Customer service is amazing(there's a real cool vibe), food was cooked up and ready to go before I could sit down to wait on it.  I will def be back for more and would recommend anyone to swing by for some great chicken and fries.  I'm super excited to try their chilli cheese fries next!!

Enjoyed Chicken Shack so much my second trip was only three days after my first! They have a sauce for everyone (try the jerk) & wings are the size they're SUPPOSED to be (big)!! They even have salad & burgers if wings aren't your thing.  They offer a really good ayce deal I'm not prepared to take advantage of...  yet.  Located in the same shopping center as Ross J's Aloha Grill  & a Roberto's this is a delicious food run adventure waiting to happen!

Chicken Shack is the best! We've been eating here for years. Eddie helped us and was very polite, accommodating and friendly. Glad to see them opening new locations but  still keeping up customer service at   all of the older locations.

OMG  I can't get enough of this place. Forget Popeye's, forget Wing Stop... Chicken Shack is where it's at. From the Wings to STRIPS TO THE CHICKEN SALAD!! YUMMY I been there 3 visits and will be a regular as my Man and I work wacky schedules and don't always cook.  The fries are light,fresh and tasty and salads are fresh! Everything is made to order, even when you call in, you'll get HOT food at pick up. Amazing job Valle Verde Team!! Staff super nice, professional clean and ready.

Yes yes yes! Amazing! They seriously have the BEST chicken fingers I e ever had! The fries are great as well. They have a ton of different sauces and rubs to choose from, I've had a few of them and they have all been really good! Not to mention the customer service is incredible! The employees are so helpful and friendly! Keep up the great work chicken shack!
They are friendly and the food is always amazing. This is by far the best chicken shack I've been too!

Awesome food! Love the HUGE selection of dipping sauces. The fry sauce is great and the habanero honey has just the perfect kick. The fries are thin cut which is my personal favorite! Definitely recommend it over other chain fast food places on your way to Vegas or wherever!

Amazing chicken! Our favorite spot for chicken literially every Sunday after church! We bring everyone there! But recently the customer service hasn't been very pleasant. The 2 new cashiers that we encountered the past 2 months have been very rude & aggrivated with their job. The back of the house guys are always good to us and personable. We recently missed a Sunday there bc of their service. We hope that it'll change soon or they will lose us.
Great place. Friendly staff and great food. Multiple sauces that are really good. If they tell you the sauce is hot. They mean it. But all in all a great place to eat.

People don't waste your money we bought the $40 dollar order when we got it home the chicken and the fries were over cooked and the fries were so hard over crisped that you couldn't chew them I called and they were not very interested in what I had to say I asked for manager sounded like a young guy don't waste your money go to the one on sunset road very disappointed a waste of $40 and threw most of it out
Stopped here on the way to grand canyon staff was great and the food wad fresh and not overly priced like everything else in vegas, i ate the wings and my wife ate the strips both were good

I looove their fries! I'm a shoestring fry kinda girl. I got the garlic parmesan wings and they were pretty good. Not much to complain about.. good price, good food.
