Just the woman working the counter seemed a little bit too busy and didn't provide such great customer service. Everything else was good!

Or ma gerd, this place is good!  Fresh, never frozen white meat chicken fingers.  Huge/tasty.  Their chili is great too. I've had their wings and fries and a burger once but the fingers are what it's all about for me.  I get the honey mustard and medium wing sauce.  The place is clean and always a few customers in there.  Someone told me it is under new management.  Good enough.  As long as they manage to keep making those fingers, I'll manage to buy them on my way home from work.  Oh, and its fast service!   I met the owner - they are very hands on and always there. You can tell.

So good!!  The chicken is incredibly moist. The only criticism I have is when I ordered, the gentleman asked what type of sauce would I like with the chicken. I requested blue cheese, but was surprised that he charged me for it. I got a 10 pack - I thought sauce would come with it. Had I known it was not included, I would have used my own blue cheese at home (to go order).

My husband really likes Chicken Shack in comparison to Raising Cane's.  The quality, the taste, the size of the tenders are no comparison.   They are usually quick and it takes little to no time to whip up those tenders.  The girls behind the counters are super sweet, helpful and patient when I'm picking out the sauces.    The chef is really nice and we get an extra tender or two because I always order the 20 pack, so we can some leftovers for a snack.  Sounds like a lot for 2 people, but those suckers goes fast with heavy eaters like us.    If you're a lightweight, like me with hot sauce then don't mess with their habanero mixes- they will burn your mouth for HOURS.  The Yelp check-in discount helps me tip more =)

I always love coming here because the food is so awesome. Today I had an extra special experience. Eddie was the cashier and he is great. He has such a fun and positive attitude. We all know no one likes to work but he seemed to be genuinely happy to be there & it made me want to come back. Way to go Chicken Shack and way to go Eddie!!

Great service and nothing beats an air conditioned quaint place.   The bf and I had a "half & half" of 3 wings and 3 fingers with shoestring fries.  Tried : Honey bbq, hot teriyaki, garlic parmesean, and lemon pepper. Gotta say the lemon pepper was my favorite since there was this kick to it at the end.   Ended up eating just one of each because we were curing a hangover...  Their sweet tea is excellent!   Brought it home for dinner and dipped it into spinach dip which was surprisingly good.   Will definitely go back again
Had stop in for the amazing sauce(s) and homemade chili.   Tried a few new sauces today. All where yummy and delicious.
Makes raising canes on lake mead and i95 on the run.  Then again it is good place to go since I work at SandHill and Patrick.

One of our favorite places to order lunch at the office. Prices are good, food is always fresh, hot and delicious, and the staff is very friendly. The shack salad is second to none, I could eat it every day.  My kids love it too! Thanks for the great service and great food!

This place is awesome. It's a small shack with air conditioning. Thank God! My boyfriend and I stopped by here after tour Hoover Dam and we were damn hungry. I found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try. I even convinced the boyfriend. I got the meal option with 3 chicken tenders with cajun sauce, fries, and a drink. They gave me four tenders!! Whoo!! They were crispy and crunchy even when doused in sauce.   My boyfriend had 12 wings with lemon pepper and creamy garlic parmesan. Those wings were crispy too!!! I hate when my wings just are sauced up with no flavor on the meat.  Their wings are full of flavor inside and out. I would definitely come here again. Also, their fries are sooooo good.

The name Chicken Shack accurately describes what this place is. The facility is extremely small and can barely hold the amount of customers coming in and out. It is super cramped and during lunch time, say goodbye to personal space. It's quite the struggle trying to maneuver yourself around the place.   Fortunately, the food here is delicious. The chicken fingers are some of the best in town, not because they're the highest of quality, but rather they're cooked just like southern chicken fingers. If you can get your mind away from how uncomfortable the facility is, you'll definitely appreciate what Chicken Shack has to offer.

Chicken Shack is under new ownership. YES! Well there goes my waist line. Lol Today I had a little bit of everything. Chili was amazing! You can totally tell that it's "homemade" everything about it screamed give me more. There's this great kick to it that makes it stand out for sure. The breaded strips were cooked to perfection. I'm a ranch dressing type of girl but there's plenty of specialty sauces to indulge in. The fries were, ahhh perfecto!  They have  revamped the shack and I'm down for the cause!  5 stars guys. Amazing turn around I really wish I had the strength not to return but crap I don't! Hahahah

Best wings in town! They are crispy and still moist with a great sauce selection. The menu is extremely limited, but you really only go for one or two things. The inside doesn't have much in the way of atmosphere so I'd recommend ordering to go. The only downside of this place is if visiting right before they close, they run out of some options and it just never tastes as good - the rest of the day is spot on.

I was at Kohl's and saw that Chicken Shack was now open in their new location. Of course I had to stop in and check them out! There was no one line when we arrived so I had to time to browse the menu.   I decided on the #1 combo: 6 wings, fries and a drink. I ordered the garlic parmesan as they are my favorite. The Pepsi fountain drinks were limited, with two of the eight choices not used. A short time later I noticed our order sitting waiting to be delivered. No one brought them out so we walked up to get them ourselves.   The garlic parm wings were regular wings with a wet garlic sauce on top. Ive never had them served like this before anywhere, they are always coated in garlic and parmesan and then fried. I did not care for them served like this at all, I hate "wet" wings.   The actual wings themselves were large and juicy, cooked perfectly. The fries were shoestring style and also good. Being a new business you would think someone would come by and check on you, but no one did. This is try #3 for this location with East Coast eats and Buddha belly both going under. I will give them another try but will have to make sure they are served dry!

Ordered the #1 and while the wings were cooked well and the fries were crisp (love them this way), their food is ruined by whoever is responsible for salting the food because my food was overly salted. I couldn't finish my food because all I can taste is salt. I hope next time, if here is a next time, the food won't be overly salty.

Why'd the chicken cross the road? To go to Chicken Shack...duh! ha ha  I've been to Chicken Shack a few times now, and it's been consistently good. For about $6.00, you can get fries, 3 chicken strips, and a soda - Combination #3 on the menu...they also have beer (on tap) for around a $1.00, but the selection is limited. Both times I've been, the place has been packed with people. It's a small space, but I've always been able to snag a table. I like when a restaurant has some personality, and this place is anything but boring! The staff is friendly, the patrons are lively, and the walls are covered in funny phrases that reference chickens...on top of that, the service is usually pretty quick.  Okay, now for the food. The star here is the chicken. It's crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside...it's surprising that with no bone they are able to keep the chicken so tender and juicy, but somehow they manage to do it. I should mention, too, that these are NOT little chicken strips...they are plump pieces of all white meat (their chicken is the antithesis to McDonald's ha ha). Every time, my friend thinks that he needs the 5 piece, and although he finishes them, he always says it was too much food! Everyone is different, but the 3 piece combo has always been plenty for me. I get the Habanero Honey BBQ sauce on the side, and also order a side of blue cheese. One of my pet peeves at restaurants is when they nickle and dime you, and here the blue cheese/ranch/extra sauce is an extra $0.49/$0.35...I'd rather them just factor that cost into my food. The fries are good, but after eating my chicken, I find that it is salt overload...  The reason I come here is for the chicken. They execute it well, and they're consistent. If you're craving some fried chicken, skip KFC and check this place out!

There wings were ok. They just threw the rub on the wings ( more on plate then wings) the thin fries are good! The fingers weren't amazing. I've had better from carnes. They also just sprayed lightly  the fingers in sauces I could of did that's myself and better.  Best option order plain and dip urself in sauce..

I'm in Boulder a couple times a month and usually eat at a different local dive. But, I've seen this place and the reviews and wanted to try it.  The woman that helped me was super nice and it's a nice, and seemingly cozy place to eat.  The three stars are because my chicken was leathery and chewy which was really unfortunate and may keep me from returning. I would have asked for a redo if I wasn't already on my way back across town. Also, as a first timer I didn't know the sauce situation. They give you a "house" sauce even if you don't want it and then charge you $.49 for others. Not a fan of that policy.  There's a lot of good reviews so I wouldn't say don't try it... I just hope your chicken is a lot fresher than mine. I've never been let down by my normal place in Boulder (TPS).

You don't have to have a lot of money to enjoy some really good chicken here it's a great place for nice relaxed atmosphere with your family I also got brave enough to try the hamburger for the first time and it is really top-notch I was definitely surprised considering it's a chicken place

Very delicious chicken, we got the chicken sandwich, grilled salad, and the big combo. The wings were more flavorful and popular with my family than the fingers. Sweet tea was great aswell. Would come again if stopping in the area!
I have been going to Chicken Shack for 2 years and I love it. The chicken is so fresh and delicious. The workers are always kind. Go to Chicken Shack, it'll change your life

This is a revision of my previous review, which was done several months earlier on the 2nd day of their opening.  They definitely had their glitches on the 2nd day, but things have improved quite a bit!  The service is fast and EXTREMELY friendly.  The food is pretty good for the fast food category.  Definitely worth a stop if you're heading down Nevada Highway.
